description: A small dirt road known as NorthWest Access Road runs along here
going east and west.  The road runs along the outter fence of the
complex, for security measures.  These roads are used for the Port
Employees to move about and do their business.  The roads encircle the
entire complex to the Main Building, at the southern ends.  The roads
also connect into the main Airship Area.
27381.name: {RNorth{x-{mWest {CH{cangar {RR{road{x

description: This is the Department Of Makou Gas Engines, a new invention that allows
this to be pushed without the power of magic or living.  The shop is very
messy, tables line up down the middle, with metal parts and even a large
contraption that seems to be running by itself.  To the east and west,
against the walls are more tables, filled with glass tubes and bottles with
diffrent color liquids.
27238.name: (Deil Inc) Makou Gas Engines

description: You find a small room, with a desk, a dresser with a mirror and a
bed within the room.  A single carpet lies on the floor between all
three peices of furniture.  A closet stands to one side.  Windows look
out over whatever landscape is on the side of the building.
27739.name: [Jack's Bar] Room 6

description: A stone staircase leads up a stone spiral tower that overlooks the
southern gates of Torregiano, built in the middle of the Southern
Makou Reactor, built as an expansion project when Torregiano only had
4 Reactors.  The staircase leads up to the top the tower.
28998.name: The Stairs of the Clock Tower

description: The shop is filled with junk, well things that promote the arena.  You
see shirts, mugs, hats, pants, and even large foam fingers.  You see dolls,
toys, dart boards, almost anything novel is in here.  A lady sits behind a
small counter, watching the people buy stuff.
27462.name: Sovenir Shop

description: You stand in the hallways of the Station.  The Hallway goes to the
east, which is somewhat dark, with doors on either side.  To the west,
a large door reads "OFFICE".  There is really nothing more here.
27192.name: The Hallway

description: {x
{&||=====||{x   A ladder rises above the Main Pier straight up to the
{&||     ||{x center of the bridge.  The massive iron support tower of
{&||=====||{x of the bridge stands to the east and west, above is the
{&||     ||{x main deck.  Below is the Sea Port of Torregiano.
28613.name: {CLe{7gi{Bon{Cna{7ir{Be {RH{rarbor {RB{rridge {CA{cccess {CL{cadder{x

description: You are now in one of the nicer rooms that you have ever had the pleasure
of being in.  There is a comfortable looking couch up against the east wall,
and beautyful pictures of the countryside all over the room.  The only draw
back to the room is the view of Stalin's Organ out of the window.
27214.name: Ruby Suite

description: {x
| {GACSC {RPort Torregiano{x  | |
| |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  | {GX{x: {gEntrace/Exit Your Location{x |
| |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  | {GG{x: {gTemporary/Guest Parking{x    |
27773.name: Above Port Torregiano [Tower 4]

description: {x
{x             Cobble stone stretches to the east and west, making up        {*M
{x           what is known as Camelot Avenue, named after a city to the    {g//{G@{g\\
{x           south.  The homes along this avenue are large, standing       {g<{G@@@{g>
{x           from two to three stories tall, reflecting their rich         {g\\{G@{g//
{x           owners inside.  Kalilyn Park stands behind the homes to         {*U
{x           the north, a rich natural haven within the city.  Life of       {c|
{x           the rich goes on as usual in this area, giving a false          {c|
{x           sense to what the rest of the city look like.                   {c|
{x                                                                           {c|
{GA{gvenue                                                             {GA{gvenue{x
28201.name: {G[{RCa{Ymel{Rot {GA{gvenue{G]{x

description: You walk into a lush garden.  Many plants and trees are growing here.
Birds sing and animals seem to have gathered here.  You look at all the
diffrent color flowers, some that seem un-natural.  A small fountain stands
in the middle of the garden, pour out water.  Some small lilly pads float in
it.  You see a park bench to the west.
27416.name: The East Garden

description: You stand infront of large iron gates, they stand 25 feet tall,
made from large boards, wrapped in iron hinges.  A few makou gas
touches burn on either side of the door, giving some light.  A ladder
here leads upwards on to the top of the wall.  The iron sign of the
gates stands inbedded on the stone face, on the outside of the wall.
The letters look knew, but not all there.
28000.name: The Gates Of [T rr gi n ]

description: A large iron gate greets you as you walk in.  The gate is locked
shut, and two guards stand in front of it.  Behind the gate a small
tunnel leads into the Airship Port directly south.  A sign next to the
gate reads AUTHORIZED PERSONELL ONLY!
27499.name: North Security Gate

description: {x
{x    {*M   {x{x{x    The avenue of cobble stone stretches to the east to the
{x  {g//{G@{g\\{x   west, along the southwest side of the city of Technology.
{x  {g<{G@@@{g>{x   Along each side past the stone sidewalks and makou gas
{x  {g\\{G@{g//{x   lights are large victorian homes, ranging from two to three
{x    {*U   {x{x{x  stories tall.  The streets are clean and well guarded, as
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  daily life of night and day continue on this avenue, far
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  away from the hustle and louder atmosphere of Downtown.
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  Numbers are carved into the sides of the sidewalk.
{x    {c|{x
28112.name: {G[{bZ{ro{bZ{ro {GA{gvenue{G]{x

description: Under the Makou Reactor directly above the southern gates of
Torregiano is the security check point.  A large iron gate spreads
across the opening, and five smaller turn-style gates stand.
Torregiano Guards watch over the people entering and leaving the city,
for illegal items that are against City Law.  To the south is the iron
gates of Torregiano, and to the north is Torregiano Square, and Main
Street.
28102.name: The {RT{rorregiano{x {MS{mecurity {GC{gheckpoint{x

description: To the east you can see Wall Market now, which is packed full of
people.  Merchants on the market itself try to pawn off merchandise
and other things.  Back west is Main Street.
27517.name: {G[ {CW{call {CM{carket {CS{ctreet {G]{x

description: This tunnel is one of the main tunnels leading to Port Torregiano
Complex.  To the west the tunnel connects into the Southern Tunnel out
of the complex, the main "people" tunnel.  This tunnel is used to
bring crates and inports to the train yard, and Torregiano Grand
Central.
27144.name: {&[{RT{r-{BA{b-{RP{&]{B Eastern Entrance Tunnel{x

description: You walk into a large office with several Order officers scurrying about.
There are several plaques along the wall with portraits of many outstanding
officers.  A larget shield bearing the Tripower symbol is above the far
wall.  Under it is the motto "To Protect and Serve" A man in an Order
uniform sits at a desk busy with his papers.
27701.name: The OOJ Recruitment Office

description: You are in the stairwell of the first floor.  The stairs wrap themselves
up going to the second floor.  Back west is the first floor, up is the
second floor.
27223.name: (Deil Inc) 1st Floor Stairwell

description: {x
[North] Reactor #5
[West] Reactor #6 Western Gate
[East] Reactor #4 Eastern Gate
27881.name: {yS{*ub-{yT{*errian {RT{rorregiano{x: {RNorth Junction{x

description: To the northwest is the city of Torregiano, the tall 20 foot
circular wall stands above you, and the Makou Reactors of the city,
and even just the hum of the city itself.  To the east the coastal
plain that runs along the great mountains to the west continues along
the southern end of the Istar Sea.  A few farms dot the landscape, and
directly in the east something can be seen.
27019.name: The {RR{red {RS{rteel {BI{bstar {7R{&o{*adwa{&y{7s{x

description: {x
{x    {*M   {x{x{x    The sounds of middle class life echo against the walls of
{x  {g//{G@{g\\{x   the three to five story buildings, which stand together in
{x  {g<{G@@@{g>{x   a row, giving little to no space inbetween.  Children tend
{x  {g\\{G@{g//{x   to play along this Boulevard in the northeast side of the
{x    {*U   {x{x{x  city, away from the downtown area.  Behind to buildings to
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  the west, almost hidden is the Torregiano Battle Gardens,
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  home to the city's battle arena.  Above as everywhere else
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  in the city is the Makou Cannon Support Structure.
{x    {c|{x
desc
{GB{goulevard                                                          {GB{goulevard{x
28408.name: {G[{bC{*annon {GB{goulevard{G]{x

description: The smaller second story of the main hangar.  You find the room in
here looks like an office, soft chairs line the walls with tables in
front.  The tables are covered in magazines and plants.  A large
reception desk stands to the north, a receptionist behind it.  A large
sign stands behind the desk, reading [PORT JUDGE - AIRSHIP
INCORPERATED].  To the east you see the pilots lounge, and the
bathroom.
27096.name: Airship Inc. Reception Hall

description: {x
{&||=====||{x   A large ladder stretches up the side of the massive iron
{&||     ||{x tower.  The tower stretches up to the top of the tower, a
{&||=====||{x possible fifteen stories above the bridge.  Far below under
{&||     ||{x the bridge is the Sea Port of Torregiano, and the waters of
{&||=====||{x the Sea of Istar.  Airships and boats dock at the five
{&||     ||{x massive piers in the sea port.  An unsure footing on this
{&||=====||{x ladder might cause a nasty spill.
28566.name: {RH{rarbor {RB{rridge {ME{mast {CA{cccess {CL{cadder{x

description: Welcome to the AIRSHIP CUSTOMIZATION SCHOOL, which will help you
make your airship one of kind.  This school is part of a series of
schools to help you work with your airship.  The school is setup with
rooms explaning information about the airships, like help files.
After reading each room, go DOWN, to continue the lesson.  And the end
you will return to this room.  This school will tell you the basics of
EDITING your airship.
28194.name: The Airship Customizing School

description: You have walking into the East Wing of the Colliseum.  Before you stands
a long hallway going down, doors on each side.  The hallway is filled with
diffrent people, walking in either direction.  People walk in and out of
each door.  The door to the east reads "RANGER'S GUILD".
27458.name: The East Colliseum Wing

description: Fueling Your Airship, Loading Your Weapons
{x
You will need fuel for your so it may move.  You will find
a fueling station around ports and other locations.  To buy
fuel, type Buy (Number Of Gallons) Fuel.
{x
To load your wepaons, type PUT (Name Of Ammo) (Cannon Name).
28210.name: Airship Purchasing School

description: The staircase continues up or down.  Which way?
27091.name: The Spiral Staircase

description: The plaza continues north and south.  Stretching to the east is
Hilp Avenue, known for its many pubs, night clubs and bars.  Also the
grand World Battling Arena Battle Gardens stands, taking up most of
the northeast district.  To the north you see the Makou Gas Company
and The Torregiano Ritz.  To the south is the bank and Citizen's
Center.
28916.name: {&-{*[ {7The {RT{rri{Bp{bower {GP{glaza {m({ME{m) {*]{&-{x

description: {x
{x    {*M   {x{x{x    The avenue stretches to the east and west, lined with its
{x  {g//{G@{g\\{x   rich cobble stone along Camelot Avenue, named after the city
{x  {g<{G@@@{g>{x   keep northwest of Westbridge.  Along the street are large
{x  {g\\{G@{g//{x   two, three and even four story homes, whose outsides reflect
{x    {*U   {x{x{x  that of their rich owners inside.  Along the north behind
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  the homes is the city park known as Kalilyn Park, a lush
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  haven of wilderness amounst the less natural setting of the
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  city.
{x    {c|{x
{GA{gvenue                                                             {GA{gvenue{x
28200.name: {G[{RCa{Ymel{Rot {GA{gvenue{G]{x

description: The cobble stone of Main Street continues north and south in the
north district.  To the west you see a large building with a wooden
fence on either side.  You can hear construction going on behind the
building.  The old sign outside reads "{CThe {CTorregiano Ship Builders
Union{x".  A few sailors stand outside the building, smoking a
cigarette.  To the east you see a two story building made of red
brick, a small sign next to the door reads "{CPort Customs{x".  Main
Street continues north and south to the Sector 9 district.
28925.name: {C>{c-{C>{RT{C<{c-{G[ {RM{rain {GS{gtreet {G]{c-{C>{BP{C<{c-{C<{x

description: This is the main hangar of Port Judge, in Torregiano.  The hangar
is made from brick, and stands very tall above you.  To either side
huge wooden doors lock away airships in special storage areas.
Bay 11 is north.  Bay 12 is south.
27052.name: Eastern Workshop

description: {x
{x             Sector 9 continues north and south.  To the east a
{x           large three story building of business stands.  The gold
{x           letters above the front door reads "First National Bank
{x           Of Torregiano".  A guard stands right next to the front
{x           doors.  To the west a very expensive building stands.
{x    {*M   {x{x{x   The outside of the building is carved stone, very fine
{x  {g//{G@{g\\{x    crafted.  The doors open up, and carved above them reads
{x  {g<{G@@@{g>{x    "The Torregiano Opera House".  To the north you see Main
{x  {g\\{G@{g//{x    Street splits into a large section.  Directly north is
{x    {*U   {x{x{x   the TriPower Tower Complex, the grand stairs of the tower
{x    {c|   {x{x{x   right on the edge of the streets.  A large statue of
{x    {c|   {x{x{x   Nisstyre Bloodstoner stands in the middle of the square.
{x    {c|   {x{x{x   Main Street in Sector 9 Continues southwards.
{x    {c|{x
{x{C Judgement Building                                                {CNational Bank{x
28909.name: {C>{c-{C>{RT{C<{c--{G[ {RM{rain {GS{gtreet {G]{c--{C>{BP{C<{c-{C<{x

description: Before you stands a tower of iron.  The top of it glows a erie green.
The sound of machines echo out of it, as it pumps the gas that makes this
city live.  A large iron gate stands to the west, locked tight.  A single
man, dressed in a pinstripe suit stands there, waiting for someone.
27500.name: Outside Torregiano Reactor #4

description: As might be expected of a room named the Diamond Suite, there is a lot of
glass, and other sparkley things in this room.  In the corner there is a
fairly large pool, with crystal clear waters.  There are a few paintings on
the walls, but the real decoration of the room comes from all the windows
looking out over the city.
27216.name: Diamond Suite

description: A lonely dirt road travels through the open expanse of the Istar
plains.  The surrounding countryside is quite flat and covered in
tall golden wild wheat.  When the wind blows, the plains ripple as
is they were liquid.  The road continues west and east.
28098.name: {BThe {GE{glven {GV{galley {7R{&o{*adw{&a{7y{x

description: Welcome to "The Bar Of The Last Drink".  Torregiano's welcome mat to
everyone who enters the city thirsty.  Around the room diffrent groups of
people sit, chatting.  To the east, a large bar stands, filled with drinks.
The whole bar is made from a dark wood, the walls, ceiling and floor.  On
the floor many round tables surround the bar.  To the east, bar stools and
the actual bar stands.  Diffrent pictures hang on the walls, and a few
27408.name: The Bar Of The Last Drink

description: Part of the iron dock here extends away from the pier.  A large
TriPower Destroyer is docked here.  You see its outter metal shell,
and the guns on the side.  A walk-way to the west goes onto the boat.
27283.name: The [Legion] Dock

description: Gigantic windows overlook north outside to the Airship Tarmack and
pretty much the entire port.  Before you lay the field, the towers in
the corners, and the construction shop to the west.  The Cannon Towers
run along the end of the port, and tend to be a danger to incoming
airships.  Simple tables with binoculars sit in front of the windows,
with a Crystal Communicator inbetween them.
27753.name: Port Torregiano Control Center

description: A small indoor hangar stands here, big enough for a couple of
airships to fit in.  A few glowing orbs float above, giving off just
enough light to see around the area.  A small workbench is built into
the wall, with a few tools scattered on it.
28247.name: {CP{crivate {CD{cock {m[{C9{m]{x

description: Off the end of the railway platform you see a large pair of stairs
going down under the tracks, and to the west.  To the west from here
you can see a large section of tracks, and a complex in the center of
this square of the city.  The complex is sunk down below the city
level, but its massive in size.  Back east is the Train Platform and
Torregiano Grand Central.
27139.name: {MEast {CE{cntrance to {CP{cort {RT{rorregiano{x

description: This massive hangar has enough room to stuff a small fleet of
airships within.  This is the Tripower Industrial Hangar, personal
hangar of the Tripower Company.  There is nothing too special about
this area though, the floors are made from large stone tiles, the
walls are made from stone blocks.  There are large timber supports
holding up the ceiling.  Makou Lamps hang down by chains to help
illuminate the area.
26550.name: {r={c={C[ {RT{rri{Bp{bower {&Industrial Hangar {C]{c={r={x

description: You stand in the Courtyard Of Nightmares.  The courtyard extends
out from the rear of the main building, being the actual church.  To
the north another building stands, with a watch tower high above it.
In the middle of the courtyard you see a large fountain, and the doors
to the second building.
27833.name: The Courtyard Of Nightmares

description: {x
{x            The rich apartments of Legion Boulevard, named after the       {*M
{x          defense force of the Tripower Kingdom stand smashed up         {g//{G@{g\\
{x          against each other, leaving little to no room inbetween        {g<{G@@@{g>
{x          these two to four story structures.  The buildings are         {g\\{G@{g//
{x          dressed in the best fasion, and reflect those who rent           {*U
{x          within.  Above the cannon support structure stands, casting      {c|
{x          shadows over the city during the day, and giving light from      {c|
{x          large gas lights which hang from the structure itself.           {c|
{x                                                                           {c|
{GB{goulevard                                                          {GB{goulevard{x
28306.name: {G[{CLe{7gi{Bon {GB{goulevard{G]{x

description: Shhh, ON THE AIR.
27197.name: [TriPower Public Station]

description: The musty odor of an unused building permeates this decrepit-looking old
warehouse.  The otherwise bare room is piled high with boxes, which probably
only contain useless junk.  The walls and floors are completely bare, and
made of solid grey stone.  It seems as if the place has not been used in
years, but looking at the ground you notice footprints in the heavy layer of
dust, and they seem recent...
27311.name: An Abandoned Warehouse

description: {x
{x    {*M   {x{x{x    The avenue of cobble stone stretches to the east to the
{x  {g//{G@{g\\{x   west, along the southwest side of the city of Technology.
{x  {g<{G@@@{g>{x   Along each side past the stone sidewalks and makou gas
{x  {g\\{G@{g//{x   lights are large victorian homes, ranging from two to three
{x    {*U   {x{x{x  stories tall.  The streets are clean and well guarded, as
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  daily life of night and day continue on this avenue, far
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  away from the hustle and louder atmosphere of Downtown.
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  Numbers are carved into the sides of the sidewalk.
{x    {c|{x

description: {x
[South] Reactor #1 Gate
[West] Reactor #8 Eastern Gate
[East] Reactor #2 Western Gate
27864.name: Under Torregiano: South Corridor

description: The cobble stone street travels to the west, into the western
district of the city.  To the north a red brick building stands, but
only the side.  The front entrance is from the TriPower Plaza.  To the
south the {CSunflower Cafe{x stands, its side entrance leading to the
patio area.  New Thalos Avenue contines to the west.  To the east you
see the Tripower Plaza, the heart of the city.
28934.name: {G[{MN{mew {MT{mhalos {GA{gvenue{G]{x

description: You are on Harbor Docks A, which is for merchant ships to docks.
To either side of you is a smaller finger sticking out in the water,
and a ship is docked next to it.  You see all kinds of diffrent people
walking around, moving crates, importing, exporting, and tring to sell
stuff.  You also see some creepy looking guys...  Maybe criminals.
27277.name: {BS{Ce{Ba{&-{RP{rort {RT{rorregiano {GP{gier{x {R[{&-{R>{MMAIN{R<{&-{G]{x

description: A small office opens up, a desk with a secretary sits here.  The
office is filled with file cabinets, and other workers walking around
changing around papers and other documents.  On the walls hang
paintings of airships, and otehr papers of business.  To the east
there is a pair of double doors leading into the Manager's Office.
28228.name: {CR{ceception of {CP{cort {RT{rorregiano{x

description: You step onto the New Thalos Bound Train....  You hear "ALL ABOARD" and
the train jumps forward, and you begin your trip.
27697.name: The New Thalos Bound Train

27554.name: The Small Barrel of Stalin's Organ

description: {x
{x             Machinery running makes it presences known by the sound       {*M
{x           coming from behind large stone walls, hiding the factories    {g//{G@{g\\
{x           and facilities of the Torregiano Industrial Zone. Very few    {g<{G@@@{g>
{x           people choose to live in this area, but once in awhile a      {g\\{G@{g//
{x           shack or even an apartment building stands between the          {*U
{x           factories.  The air is heavy with the smell of salt coming      {c|
{x           from the Istar Sea north past the city.  The Legionaire         {c|
{x           Harbor Bridge can be seen to the northeast.                     {c|
{x                                                                           {c|
28605.name: {*[{CS{chire {GA{gvenue{*]{x

description: This Elven Valley Roadway is nothing more than a rutted, barely
used road leading from Torregiano, to the east, to the Valley
of the Elves, to the west.  All along the road, tall sheafs of
wheat grow wild and untended.
28114.name: {BThe {GE{glven {GV{galley {7R{&o{*adw{&a{7y{x

description: {x
{x          The Boulevard named after another invention of the               {*M
{x        Tripower Kingdom stretches north to south along the north        {g//{G@{g\\
{x        east side of the city.  The three to five story buildings        {g<{G@@@{g>
{x        along the side of the street sit together, only once in          {g\\{G@{g//
{x        awhile giving way to an alley leading behind them.  To the         {*U
{x        west stands the Torregiano Battle Gardens.  Above the cannon       {c|
{x        support structure stands, large iron gas lights hanging off        {c|
{x        of it.                                                             {c|
{x                                                                           {c|
desc
{GB{goulevard                                                          {GB{goulevard{x

27351.name: To {CP{cort {RT{rorregiano {GG{gate {x[{BVI{x]

description: You walk down the large corridor lobby of the Citizen's Center.
You see people walking around with there children, watching them point
out diffrent areas of interest.  In the center of the lobby you see a
small scale model of the completed Torregiano, or at least the plans
of the future.  To the north, you see a local shopkeeper standing
outside the door, greeting people.  To the south you a Legionairre
standing.
27651.name: The Lobby Of The Citizen's Center

description: A large hallway extends to the east and west between two doors on
either end, brightly lit up by an exit sign.  On either side of the
hallway is a single door with a white blurred window going into
another room of the building.  The hallway continues this east and
west.  On the walls are varies pictures and plaques of the port.
[North] Head Mechanic's Office
[South] Port Torregiano Cargo Shipping Office
27727.name: 2nd Floor Hallway

description: All around inside the room is large peices of fabrics, sewing
machines and other material making things.  Large well crafted peices
of furniture are being assembled here, made for airships.  You
purchase the stock item here dirt cheap, have it restrung with Quest
Points and place it within your airship (and saving your airship &
objects) and it will remain within the airship.  A small sign hangs on
the wall, urging you to read it.
27939.name: The Airship Furniture Shop

description: You stand right before the steps leading to the front door of the
tavern.  The sign stands above you, still reading out "PORT JUDGE BAR
- GRILL - INN".  A sign on the door reads "The owners wish to keep
this a SAFE area".  The port is back to the east.
27076.name: Before The Tavern

description: A large gate appears in the road, as behind it a fenced in area
holds airships who were towed away to this impound lot, mainly for
parking in places they shouldn't.  The gate is made from iron, and
probably could not be opened by any means.  The Access Road continues
back north.
27493.name: {&[{RT{r-{BA{b-{RP{&]{B East Access Road{x

description: This Elven Valley Roadway is nothing more than a rutted, barely
used road leading from Torregiano, to the east, to the Valley
of the Elves, to the west.  All along the road, tall sheafs of
wheat grow wild and untended.
28095.name: {BThe {GE{glven {GV{galley {7R{&o{*adw{&a{7y{x

description: {x
{x            The drone of machines running almost drown out the sounds      {*M
{x           of life in this neighborhood, as this area can be known as    {g//{G@{g\\
{x           Zone of Torregiano, factories spewing forth coal dust and     {g<{G@@@{g>
{x           dirt, but luckly the city has created a tunnel underground    {g\\{G@{g//
{x           which pipes all the smoke away from the city, only leaving      {*U
{x           the constant noise of work.  On either side slum homes and      {c|
{x           shacks line the sides of the street.                            {c|
{x                                                                           {c|
{x                                                                           {c|
{GB{goulevard                                                         {GB{goulevard{x
28708.name: {*[{GM{gakou {GB{goulevard{*]{x

description: A large pool table stands infront of you, full size and green.  The
walls around the pool table are filled with pictures and paintings of
other famous billard players.  An ashtray sits on the corner of the
pool table.  The pool hall continues in almost all directions.
27930.name: The Backstreet Pool Hall

description: Before you stands a hill of pure death and evil.  The stench of rotting
corpses is very strong.  All plant life around this area seems to be dead,
the ground is mainly made from rough cut stone.  All around you see diffrent
things of death.  Crosses dot the small square.  In the center a large stone
table, is stained {RRed{x with blood, still warm from a fresh killing.
27027.name: Crucification Hill

description: The room here is filled with a large window, looking north down
onto the main room of the station.  In the center of the room, a large
dark green crystal stands here, glowing.  A few mages stand around it
chanting something unknown.  A large metal rod goes through the
crystal, and into the ceiling above.  There is a few chairs here, that
is about it.
27199.name: Control Room to the Station

description: A large warehouse before you stands, as busy bodies inside move
large wooden crates back and forth from large iron racks that run down
the center of the warehouse.  You see all kinds of workers within the
warehouse, including large titans who move the crates without
problems.  To the east you can see an opening and more light.  To the
north is the main entrance/exit of the warehouse.
27391.name: Port Cargo Warehouse [W]

description: {x
{R6{&-#-{!A       {!A {*-{7 Port Control
{&|         {@B {*-{7 Main Office
{CPort Tarmack{x      {&{R@{&-{@B       {#C {*-{7 East Entrance

{R4 {*-{7 Parking Gate 4  {R5 {*-{7 Parking Gate 5  {R6 {*-{7 Parking Gate 6{x
Massive glass windows overlook the port outside, as the airships of
the Great Realms move back and forth on the tarmack, doing their daily
jobs.  Port Torregiano is one of the largest airships ports in the
Great Realms, since the Tripower and Torregiano was the home of the
original airships.  Passangers and workers walk up and down this giant
lobby which runs along the outside of the port tarmack.  Signs hang
down from the ceiling pointing out locations.
28182.name: The Port Torregiano Lobby [East]

description: Welcome to the AIRSHIP DRIVING SCHOOL, this is a special area setup
to teach you on how to drive your airship.  This school is setup as
part of a series of schools to help you to understand the airship
system.  Each room displays a description of something you should
know.  After reading each room, go DOWN, to continue the lesson.  At
the end, you will return to this room.  This school will tell you the
basics of DRIVING, NAVIGATION and other things you will need to know.
28190.name: The Airship Driving School

description: Its almost like an endless road, there is very little in the
surrounding area to break it up from looking like the rest of the
road.  The Istar Plains, also sometimes called the Torregiano Plains
is mainly made up of grass fields.  Much of it is left to grow wild,
with an occational farm cutting into the wilderness with well groomed
crop fields.  Southwards the Reaper Scythe Mountains stretch upwards
and block the southern view.  These mountains merge into the 'Central
Bowl' mountains that makes up the center of the Cruoris continent, and
can be seen westwards.  These mountains are much taller than the
Reaper Scythe, many of the peaks stretching far into the atmosphere,
and always snow covered.  The South Istar Roadway continues east
towards Torregiano, or west towards Makou City and the road to Vector.
28438.name: {BThe {RS{routh {BI{bstar {7R{&o{*adw{&a{7y{x

description: The cobble stone of Main Street gets a little dirtier as it enters
the Northern Sector, were Main Street is a devide between Sectors 6
and 5.  Two buildings stand to either side.  To the west the small two
story building reveals all different kinds of masks.  The sign outside
reads "{CSnivley's Hideous Masks{x".  The smell of hot diner food comes
from the east at "{CJambalya's Curios{x".  To the south is Sector 9, the
high class rich area of Torregiano.  Also the best place to pick up
goods.  To the north is Sector 6-5, were Main Street goes through the
northern, poor end of town.
28922.name: {C>{c-{C>{RT{C<{c-{G[ {RM{rain {GS{gtreet {G]{c-{C>{BP{C<{c-{C<{x

description: You find a small room, with a desk, a dresser with a mirror and a
bed within the room.  A single carpet lies on the floor between all
three peices of furniture.  A closet stands to one side.  Windows look
out over whatever landscape is on the side of the building.
27743.name: [Jack's Bar] Room 3

description: Within this agency there is a large counter displaying colorful
posters and brochures for exotic destinations.  A travel agent stands
to greet you from behind the counter as you step inside.  Behind the
counter lies a small office where people planning a trip can be heard.
27911.name: Torregiano Travel

description: To the north stands a building on the south side of New Thalos
Avenue, which can be entered through the staircase to the east.  To
the west a large building stands with two closed wooden doors.  The
southern end of the courtyard is fenced in, and beyond the fence the
southern neighborhood can be seen.
28633.name: The Large Courtyard

description: {x
| {GACSC {RPort Torregiano{x  | |
| |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  | {GX{x: {gEntrace/Exit Your Location{x |
| |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  | {GG{x: {gTemporary/Guest Parking{x    |
27767.name: Above Port Torregiano [Tower 10]

description: The control tower stands just north of the road.  It rises above
all the other buildings, and is used to navigate the airships out of
the port.  The port also deals with shipping trade, as to the docking
area on the Istar Sea.  To the west the Main Port Road breaks into a
circle around the Pub.  The rentable hangars stand at the far end of
the area.
27067.name: Main Port Road

description: A small dirt road known as NorthEast Access Road runs along here
going east and west.  The road runs along the outter fence of the
complex, for security measures.  These roads are used for the Port
Employees to move about and do their business.  The roads encircle the
entire complex to the Main Building, at the southern ends.  The roads
also connect into the main Airship Area.
27374.name: {RNorth{x-{MEast {CH{cangar {RR{road{x

description: This room seems much older than the apartment complex which used to exist
above it.  Seemingly untouched by the fire, the walls and floor are smooth
marble, covered with a thick layer of dust.  There is a large black marble
altar at the far end of the room.
27313.name: The Basement

description: You stand in the challenger's training gym.  In this room, all the
machines needed to create a strong warrior stands.  Weights and lifting
bars.  Bench presses, military press, punching bag, even a practice dummy.
A trainer sits in the corner, who will help anyone going into the arena.
27268.name: Challenger B's Training Gym

description: Its walls are made out of the same, black rock the church was.  The
ceiling is high, and the rafters of roof are exposed.  All around you,
everything is draped in darkness.  The windows glare out the light of
the city, through its black glass.  There is a pew here for praying,
facing north, to the throne in front of the church.
27823.name: Isle In The Middle Of The Church

description: A large workshop expands before you here, just big enough for one
large airship to fit in.  Large oak chests line a wall, with a large
oak counter in front of them.  Tools are laid out neatly on the
countertop, and some of the drawers in the chests are open.  A cork
board hangs from the wall, with tons of papers tacked into it.
28634.name: The Workshop

description: |               Deil Inc.               |
| Please Ask The Guard First If You Wish|
| To Speak To Vincent Blackheart.       |
|          Mobile Program Alert!        |
| To Ask The Guard, Say 'audience'      |
| The Guard Should Disappear.           |
| If The Guard Does Not Come Back, Then |
| Vincent Is NOT On, Or Is Not In His   |
| Office. If The Guard Comes back and   |
| says OK, he should open the door.     |
| If the guard comes back and says      |
| "Sorry But Blackheart Ain't Taking    |
| Visitors" means Vincent doesn't want  |
| to be disturbed. Office Hours Are Held|
| 9am to 6pm.                           |
You stand in the Third Floor of Deil Inc.  To the north you see a door,
with a picture of weapons on it.  Inside you hear metal on metal and some
screaming and shouting.  To the south you hear a strange hissing noise...
To the east stands two large guards, in a strange uniform, watching over
you.  A pair of double doors stands behind them.  A sign hangs here on the
wall.  (READ SIGN).
27230.name: (Deil Inc) 3rd Floor Hallway

{x
{x  This vast hanger on the ground floor of Port Torregiano is home to where
{xsomeone would go to purchase an airship.  The hanger itself is filled with
{xbasic models of airships, and sale persons wandering around trying to make
{xa commission off possible buyers.
{x
{x  In this section of Airship Purchasing you will buy the 'Hull' of the
{xairship, which is the basic structure that defines how many rooms, engines
{xand cannons an airship can have.  In addition to buying a 'Hull' you will
{xalso need to buy at -least- 2 Engines, sold in the next room.
{x
{x- Type LIST to see a list of all available airships for sale.
{x
{x  For more details about each design, please see the room located below
{xthis one.  When buying an airship, please keep the following in mind...
{x
{x- You do not need to include THE in the name, such as THE STAR, the mud
{x  automatically inserts this in most airship messages.
{x
{x- Do NOT use apostrophes ' ' within the name of the airship.  This can
{x  have a negative effect on certain commands.  Use a backwords apostrophe
{x  which is located on your TILDA key (usually to the left of Number 1).
{x
{x- The use of non-letter/number characters !@#$%^&*()-=[] is now disallowed.
{x
{x- When you purchase your airship, you will be naming it.  Make sure you
{x  type in the correct command, which is as follows
{x
{x- You do not need to use the {{x color reset character when using color,
{x  this is automatically inserted into the name by the mud.
{x
{x  BUY (Number of the ship in the list) NAME OF YOUR SHIP
{x  Example:  Buy 4 Titanica
{x  The Highwind 'Titanica' is parked here.
{x
{x  The room located to the west houses the Engine Shop, you will only need
{xyour airship keys when making these purchases.  The keys will appear in
{xyour inventory after purchase.  The Weapon/Cannon Shop is located two
{xwests from here, but is not needed for flight.
27942.name: {CP{cort {RT{rorregiano {YH{yull {YC{yonstruction {YS{yhop{x

description: {x| | Model       Piston  Time || MOdel     Piston  Time || Model   Piston  Time |
{x|T| Battle Cruiser   4  1:56 || War Cruiser    4  1:45 || Hammerhead   4   :20 |
{x|R| Battle Cruiser   6  1:26 || War Cruiser    6  1:15 || Hammerhead   6   :15 |

{x| | Highwind        20   :15 || Stormchaser   20   :20 || Ram-Duster  20   :05 |
{x| | Highwind        40   :10 || Stormchaser   40   :10 || Ram-Duster  40   :05 |

{x|H| Swordfish        4   :35 || Juggernaught   4  2:25 || Battle C.     32,000 |
{x|E| Swordfish        6   :25 || Juggernaught   6  1:40 || War C.        14,000 |
{x|I| Swordfish        8   :15 || Juggernaught   8  1:10 || Hammerhead     4,480 |
{x|F| Swordfish       10   :15 || Juggernaught  10  1:00 || Highwind      16,000 |
{x|O| Swordfish       12   :10 || Juggernaught  12   :40 || Stormchaser   12,000 |
{x|N| Swordfish       20   :10 || Juggernaught  20   :25 || Ram-Duster     5,000 |
{x|G| Swordfish       40   :05 || Juggernaught  40   :15 || Swordfish      4,480 |
{x| | Swordfish       XF   :05 || Juggernaught  XF   :05 || Juggernaught  15,000 |
{x
{x  Airship speed varies from airship to airship, and depends on the size of the
{xengine.  Airship Engines are not just for show, the bigger the engine, the faster
{xyour airship will move.  The above graph displays the time trials for all current
{xairship models, along with all available and soon to be available engine sizes,
{xwith the exception of the "XF" Model, which is just an experimental engine to see
{xthe max speed of all airships.  These times were taken by racing each of the
{xdifferent airship down a 20 room stretch.  The time shown, will show how long it
{xtakes an airship to move 20 rooms on the map.  5 Seconds is the fastest an airship
{xcan move in this system.  The actual weight of the airship object determines how
{xfast the airship can move, in the bottom right box is the weight of each airship
{xmodel.
{x
{x  Please also take note that the smaller ships max out with certain engine
{xsizes, meaning such as the Hammerhead does not need an engine bigger than
{xthe 10 pistons.
26724.name: {YA{yirshi{Yp {CT{cim{Ce {CT{cria{Cl {RR{recor{Rd{x

description: You stand in the backroom, which turns and stretches north the
entire length of the building.  The black cinder block walls and dim
lighting makes it somewhat hard to see.  The air is filled with smoke,
and many different people.  A large plywood room has been built to the
south, along with a makeshift bar used for parties.  To the north you
see a group of couchs and chairs.
27936.name: The Backroom in Backstreets

description: Three streets intersect here in the eastern end of the city.  To
the west runs Hilp Avenue, famous for its bars, pubs, eateries, and
most of all the Torregiano Battle Gardens, the city's famous battle
arena for people and airships.  To the north runs Cannon Boulevard,
filled with middle class row housing and apartment buildings, leading
north to Westbridge Avenue and the Harbor.  To the south runs Cannon
Avenue, home to the rich row housing and apartments of the city,
running along the southeast side of Kalilyn Park, ending with Camelot
Avenue which runs along the southern side of the city.  To the east a
large building stands which looks to be a club.  A large iron shaped
bong sits on top of the building, producing fake bong.  A green sign
{xoutside reads Studio 420.                                        {yII
{x{yII                                                               {yII
{x{yII                                                               {yII

description: {x
{x            The rich apartments of Legion Boulevard, named after the       {*M
{x          defense force of the Tripower Kingdom stand smashed up         {g//{G@{g\\
{x          against each other, leaving little to no room inbetween        {g<{G@@@{g>
{x          these two to four story structures.  The buildings are         {g\\{G@{g//
{x          dressed in the best fasion, and reflect those who rent           {*U
{x          within.  Above the cannon support structure stands, casting      {c|
{x          shadows over the city during the day, and giving light from      {c|
{x          large gas lights which hang from the structure itself.           {c|
{x                                                                           {c|
{GB{goulevard                                                          {GB{goulevard{x
28308.name: {G[{CLe{7gi{Bon {GB{goulevard{G]{x

description: You stand inside the Makou Gas Products room.  In here you see many
diffrent items lined up that uses makou gas.  You see the stoves, lamps and
other things you have never seen before.  Some people sit in chairs waiting
for customers to come.
27233.name: (Deil Inc) Makou Gas Products

27564.name: The Med. Barrel of Stalin's Organ

description: You find yourself in this small humble bakery the smell of fresh sweats
is overwhelming.  A man stands behind the counter cooking and selling his
delectable delights.  You look in the large glass display case and dream of
what you want.
27501.name: Barry's Bakery

description: You stand in the challenger's waiting room.  This room is created for a
person about to go into the arena to heal and wait.  A large table stands in
the middle of the room for the challenger to sit on, or lay on.  Lockers
line the wall for the challenger to put things into, before the fight.  A
large iron door stands to the west, leading into the arena.
27267.name: Challenger B's Waiting Room

description: {x
{&||=====||{x   A large ladder stretches up the side of the massive iron
{&||     ||{x tower.  The tower stretches up to the top of the tower, a
{&||=====||{x possible fifteen stories above the bridge.  Far below under
{&||     ||{x the bridge is the Sea Port of Torregiano, and the waters of
{&||=====||{x the Sea of Istar.  Airships and boats dock at the five
{&||     ||{x massive piers in the sea port.  An unsure footing on this
{&||=====||{x ladder might cause a nasty spill.
28574.name: {RH{rarbor {RB{rridge {mW{Mest {CA{cccess {CL{cadder{x

description: The lobby here is mainly just waiting chairs and other little
things.  Some red chairs, plants and tables.  To the south the lounge
stands, a more comfortable place with a bar.  To the east is the
center of the lobby and other parts, and a door to the west reads
"Employee's Only".
[South] Port Lounge
[North] Airship Construction
[West] To Second Floor & Port Cargo Warehouse
27148.name: Port Lobby West

description: {x
{x             Machinery running makes it presences known by the sound       {*M
{x           coming from behind large stone walls, hiding the factories    {g//{G@{g\\
{x           and facilities of the Torregiano Industrial Zone. Very few    {g<{G@@@{g>
{x           people choose to live in this area, but once in awhile a      {g\\{G@{g//
{x           shack or even an apartment building stands between the          {*U
{x           factories.  The air is heavy with the smell of salt coming      {c|
{x           from the Istar Sea north past the city.  The Legionaire         {c|
{x           Harbor Bridge can be seen to the northeast.                     {c|
{x                                                                           {c|
28601.name: {*[{CS{chire {GA{gvenue{*]{x

{x    Moderate sized houses standing about one or two stories tall stand on   {*M
{x on either side of the southwest boulevard in Torregiano, named after one {g//{G@{g\\
{x of the Empire's greatest inventions to this world.  The cobble stone     {g<{G@@@{g>
{x street runs north to south, with sidewalks in the side giving way to     {g\\{G@{g//

description: [West] Passages To Reactor Gates 6W, 7, 8E
27792.name: Under The Torregiano Plate [N]

description: A small indoor hangar stands here, big enough for a couple of
airships to fit in.  A few glowing orbs float above, giving off just
enough light to see around the area.  A small workbench is built into
the wall, with a few tools scattered on it.
28246.name: {CP{crivate {CD{cock {m[{C10{m]{x

description: You stand inside the Coronet Cafe.  The cafe is filled with books, and
kind of looks like a library.  Several round tables line the room, with
small chairs.  To the west a large counter stands, and three shopkeepers
stands behind it serving the customers.  In the air is the heavy smell of
coffee, and cigarettes.
27429.name: Coronet Cafe

description: You are standing in an elevator on the ground floor of a four story
building.  On the wall of the elevator you see two fairly large buttons.
They aren't labeled, but you can guess tht the one on the top will go up,
and the other one therefor goes down.
27206.name: Elevator

description: You stand in the Courtyard Of Nightmares.  The courtyard extends
out from the rear of the main building, being the actual church.  To
the north another building stands, with a watch tower high above it.
In the middle of the courtyard you see a large fountain, and the doors
to the second building.
27834.name: The Courtyard Of Nightmares (W)

description: This is a small dirt road.  It is mainly formed by ruts from carriages
heading through the surrounding fields of wheat.  To the east, a cobble-
stone road leads off toward Torregiano.  To the west, the dirt road heads
deeper into the countryside where some type of barricade seems to block
the way.
27022.name: {BThe {GE{glven {GV{galley {7R{&o{*adw{&a{7y{x

description: {x
{x    {*M   {x{x{x    Large stone walls make up either side of the avenue, and
{x  {g//{G@{g\\{x   the sound of machinery running is almost deafening to people
{x  {g<{G@@@{g>{x   walking around in this area.  This is the Shire Avenue, home
{x  {g\\{G@{g//{x   to the Torregiano Industrial Zone.  To the north and south
{x    {*U   {x{x{x  stand factories and other facilities, with only a random
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  building of residents.  The street has trash blowing around,
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  but no smoke comes from the factories, all the smoke stacks
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  are connected to a tunnel leading out of the city.
{x    {c|{x
28262.name: {*[{CS{chire {GA{gvenue{*]{x

description: Its almost like an endless road, there is very little in the
surrounding area to break it up from looking like the rest of the
road.  The Istar Plains, also sometimes called the Torregiano Plains
is mainly made up of grass fields.  Much of it is left to grow wild,
with an occational farm cutting into the wilderness with well groomed
crop fields.  Southwards the Reaper Scythe Mountains stretch upwards
and block the southern view.  These mountains merge into the 'Central
Bowl' mountains that makes up the center of the Cruoris continent, and
can be seen westwards.  These mountains are much taller than the
Reaper Scythe, many of the peaks stretching far into the atmosphere,
and always snow covered.  The South Istar Roadway continues east
towards Torregiano, or west towards Makou City and the road to Vector.
27132.name: {BThe {RS{routh {BI{bstar {7R{&o{*adw{&a{7y{x

description: You stand before the Throne of Nightmares.  All around it, candles
burn brightly, with their black flames.  A hell hound sits next to the
throne, looking at you with red eyes.  The throne stands in darkness,
made from a motionless matter, that almost looks like a dream world.
Draped behind the throne, a 20 foot TriPower Flags hangs vertical,
its war battled status shown brightly from the window behind it.
27830.name: The Throne Of Nightmares

description: A metal spiral staircase leads upwards into the building above.  To
the west is the courtyard and workshop.  A sign reads "Starwind &
Hawkins" in the shape of a hand, pointing up the stairs.
28635.name: Staircase To The Upstair

description: {x                                                                         {*M
{x             Sector 9 opens up, and its wall to wall shops.  To the      {g//{G@{g\\
{x           west, a three story building, the front of the first          {g<{G@@@{g>
{x           you see another three story building, with the first story    {g\\{G@{g//
{x           full of windows. Pictures and paintings line this window,       {*U
{x           and the sign over the door reads "Raka'asha's Artistic          {c|
{x           Dermagraphics".  To the south is Main Street in the 1-2         {c|
{x           District, and to the north is Main Street in Sector 9.          {c|
{x                                                                           {c|
{x{C  Dept. Store                                              {CArtistic Dermagraphics{x
28906.name: {C>{c-{C>{RT{C<{c--{G[ {RM{rain {GS{gtreet {G]{c--{C>{BP{C<{c-{C<{x

description: A large pool table stands infront of you, full size and green.  The
walls around the pool table are filled with pictures and paintings of
other famous billard players.  An ashtray sits on the corner of the
pool table.  The pool hall continues in almost all directions.
27932.name: The Backstreet Pool Hall

description: A long corridor leads out of the building to the east, towards the
Torregiano Grand Central Station Complex.  A set of steps leads up to
the Train Platform.

description: You enter the Ship Builders of Torregiano.  In the room are several
sailors and captains, all drinking and talking.  The walls are covered in
paintings of diffrent sailing ships and small boats.  A small counter stands
to the west with a sailor sitting behind it.  Behind him, there is a price
chart of boats, and ships.  The walls behind the counter are lined up with
boards and tools.
27436.name: The Torregiano Ship Builders

description: All the buildings have disappered below you.  You are very high up in the
air now.  Below you, the ladder extends to the ground, above you is the
support track.
27406.name: Climbing The Support Tower

description: You stand in the cozy room of the Inn.  In here are three beds lined
against the wall, for a group of travelers to sleep in.  A few chairs sit
next to the windows, and a small fireplace stands in the corner, with fresh
wood next to it.
27246.name: (Inn Of The Drow) Room One

description: Leading away from the Tripower Plaza to the west heading to the
eastern side of the city is Hilp Avenue, known for its bars, pubs, and
other various clubs and activities.  Its also known as the party area
of the city, always filled at night with the younger crowds of people
coming out, to hand in the clubs.  North of the street is the
Torregiano Battle Gardens, home to the battle arenas of the city.  To
the south stands Kalilyn Park, the only major area of nature found
inside the city, besides people's front lawns in the neighborhoods.
28929.name: {G[{GH{gilp {GA{gvenue{G]{x

description: {x
{x             Machinery running makes it presences known by the sound       {*M
{x           coming from behind large stone walls, hiding the factories    {g//{G@{g\\
{x           and facilities of the Torregiano Industrial Zone. Very few    {g<{G@@@{g>
{x           people choose to live in this area, but once in awhile a      {g\\{G@{g//
{x           shack or even an apartment building stands between the          {*U
{x           factories.  The air is heavy with the smell of salt coming      {c|
{x           from the Istar Sea north past the city.  The Legionaire         {c|
{x           Harbor Bridge can be seen to the northeast.                     {c|
{x                                                                           {c|
28603.name: {*[{CS{chire {GA{gvenue{*]{x

description: A large structure reaches out from the port building, and large
rings hang off the metal structure to allow airships to dock here.
These Gate Towers are used for overnight parking.  Airships cannot
remained here park for months on end.  DOWN is the Port Tarmack, and
south is the PORT BUILDING.
28176.name: {CP{cort {RT{rorregiano {GG{gate {RT{rower {x[{BI{x]

description: The first thing that strikes the eye upon entry into this room is the
sheer cavernous SIZE of the place.  The next thing that becomes apparent is
the richness with which it is decorated.  The solid gold doors on either end
of the room are almost 150 feet high and could never swing without the use
of powerful magic.  Guarding the northward door into the palace proper is a
single statue of- could it be?  {7Mithril!  {0 Gigantic pillars of rare
black marble line the velvet carpeted walkway, and tapestries spun of gold,
silver, and even platinum thread line the towering walls.  Up above, the
dome of the ceiling is intricately painted in a scene of the gods bringing
light to the world.  At the apex of the painting, where the hands of all the
gods meet, there is a single magical ball of light casting its brilliant
illumination upon the entire hall.
27399.name: A grand entry hall

description: Before you is a small diner.  The building itself is long and
narrow.  Booths stand on the northern side, looking out through large
picture windows onto New Thalos Avenue.  To the south a large bar runs
along, with the owner behind it.  A small window looks back into the
kitchen behind all of this.  Along the bar there is stools to sit on.
27924.name: The Eat and Run Diner

description: The red carpet of the office stretches out before you.  The room
has red carpet, and dark wooden walls.  Pictures of airships hang
under small lights.  A few models dart the shelves.  A large oak desk
stands to the north, near the wall of windows.  The windows overlook
the northern end of the port, looking at the Istar Sea and launch
area.  Two chairs sit in front of the desk.
27097.name: The Head Office of Port Judge

description: {x
{Y  ##      {xA massive iron tunnel cuts through the underbelly of     {Y# #
{Y ### #  {xthe city itself.  Far above massive iron beams hold the  {Y# ###
{Y #####  {xceiling, which only a couple feet above is Main Street   {Y#####
{y\{r+---+{y/ {xTorregiano.  The tunnel stretches north towards the Sea {y\{r+---+{y/
{y\   /  {xPort of Torregiano, a massive iron island that stretches {y\   /
{y\_/   {xnorth away from the city into the Sea of Istar.  Large    {y\_/
{y|    {xtorches on the sidewalls light the way, only a bright      {y|
{y|    {xlight shines to the north, at the end of the tunnel.       {y|
27427.name: {B[{&T{*he {RP{rort {RT{runnel {&O{*f {RTo{rrregia{Rno{B]{x

description: Its walls are made out of the same, black rock the church was.  The
ceiling is high, and the rafters of roof are exposed.  All around you,
everything is draped in darkness.  The windows glare out the light of
the city, through its black glass.  There is a pew here for praying,
facing north, to the throne in front of the church.
27827.name: Western Seating Of The Church

description: The 1st Floor Hallway, holding all the employee's needs.  To the north, a
large employee bar stands, allowing after hour drinks and small time drinks
during the day.  Since the owner of Deil Inc is a major drinking after
hours, he likes to keep a bar right in his tower.  To the south, a cafateria
stands, for food and soft drinks.  To the west and lobby of this business
building stands, and to the east the hallway continues.
27221.name: (Deil Inc) 1st Floor Hallway

description: You stand in the NorthWest part of Wall Market.  To the west a
large building stands.  The building looks very important and old,
even though its new.  Above the doorway in stone reads "The
TriPower/Torregiano Stock Exchange".  To the north, another building
stands, which is the newly founded "Torregiano Water Company".
27531.name: {&[{RN{mW{&] {CT{che {CW{call {CM{carket {CS{cquare{x

description: {x
{x            The rich apartments of Legion Boulevard, named after the       {*M
{x          defense force of the Tripower Kingdom stand smashed up         {g//{G@{g\\
{x          against each other, leaving little to no room inbetween        {g<{G@@@{g>
{x          these two to four story structures.  The buildings are         {g\\{G@{g//
{x          dressed in the best fasion, and reflect those who rent           {*U
{x          within.  Above the cannon support structure stands, casting      {c|
{x          shadows over the city during the day, and giving light from      {c|
{x          large gas lights which hang from the structure itself.           {c|
{x                                                                           {c|
{GB{goulevard                                                          {GB{goulevard{x
28304.name: {G[{CLe{7gi{Bon {GB{goulevard{G]{x

description: A small indoor hangar stands here, big enough for a couple of
airships to fit in.  A few glowing orbs float above, giving off just
enough light to see around the area.  A small workbench is built into
the wall, with a few tools scattered on it.
28248.name: {CP{crivate {CD{cock {m[{C11{m]{x

description: As you enter this room you notice that the whole thing is collored blue.
There is a large hammock along the east wall, and nect to it there is a
running water fountain.  The water fountain is, like everything else in the
room, colored blue, but a softer blue than the rest of the room.  The room
feels very safe and relaxing, perfect after a hard day adventuring.
27215.name: Saphire Suite

description: West Seating.  A thunderous roar fills the stadium as you clamber to find
your seat and witness the upcoming arena match.  You see bloodstains on the
very front benches from particularly gruesome matches of the past, and you
try to find a clean patch of bench and get comfortable.  For whom will you
cheer to reign victorious over the corpse of his fallen opponent?
27444.name: West Seating

description: A long tunnel opens up at either end, as the train platform extends
out near the track sunk well below it.  The underground tunnel sits
underneath New Thalos Avenue, in Torregiano.  The ceiling above
extends to the cobble stone of the road itself, held up be large,
steel beams.  A doorway to the north leads out of the platform.
27944.name: New Thalos Ave Train Platform

| Weapons: 6 Cannons [Crewed]  |mainly for large crews and battles.  They are  |

26727.name: {YA{yirship {YH{yull {RD{resign {RD{retail {RR{room {c({C1{c){x

description: You stand at the rear of the church.  To the north, a large
courtyard, and a second building stands before you.  Back south is the
door leading into the Church Of Nightmares, allowing people to walk
in.
27835.name: Outside The Rear Of The Church

{x    Moderate sized houses standing about one or two stories tall stand on   {*M
{x on either side of the southwest boulevard in Torregiano, named after one {g//{G@{g\\
{x of the Empire's greatest inventions to this world.  The cobble stone     {g<{G@@@{g>
{x street runs north to south, with sidewalks in the side giving way to     {g\\{G@{g//
{x citizen traffic, as the main cobble stone boulevard is mostly used for     {*U

{GB{goulevard{x                                                         {GB{goulevard{x
28807.name: {G[{YA{yirship {GB{goulevard{G]{x

description: Nothing but air.  To the east is the Legionnaire Bridge, below,
The Harbor.
{x
28585.name: {BThe {mW{Mest {CS{cide {RH{rarbor {RB{rridge {GJ{gum{Gp{x

description: | Welcome To The Torregiano Colliseum |
| The colliseum uses many mobprogs to |
| make this place more fun. If the    |
| room description has (READ SIGN)    |
| then read the sign to get instruc.  |
| on how to work that mobprog.        |
Before you a large colliseum stands, open air.  Within the screams and
cheers of over 5 thousand citizen's echo from within, cheering on the
fighters in the ring.  You look around and see a long line of people walking
around, the colliseum stands very tall, made from marble.  A man stands here
selling tickets.  A sign stands next to him.  (READ SIGN).
27440.name: Before The Colliseum

description: Large glass windows look out into the tunnel, and special machines
are lined up to rate and test the airships that run the course.  There
are several tables setup in the room covered in manufactor designs and
blueprints.  Other tables have large notebooks and test results laying
on the them.  The walls are covered with all kinds of charts and other
stuff.
28088.name: The A.T.F. Control Room

description: The Elven Valley Roadway is really nothing more than a barely paved
cobblestone road.  This lightly used route travels through the wide
expanse of the Istar plains, covered mainly by naturally growing
golden wheat.  To the west, the cobblestones peter out into dirt. To
the east there is an intersection.
27021.name: {BThe {GE{glven {GV{galley {7R{&o{*adw{&a{7y{x

description: A large lounge opens up here, kind of half a diner and half a bar.
To the west are small round tables sitting in the middle of the floor,
each with its own napkin dispensor and condiments.  Along the sides of
the walls are built in booths.  To the east a long bar stands, with
the kitchen behind it.  The walls are covered with pictures of
different airships and pictures of the construction of the airship
port.
28216.name: {CP{cort {RT{rorregiano {CP{cilot's {CL{counge{x

description: Welcome to the World Battling Arena Information Center.  This room is
very bland.  The walls are covered with diffrent warriors fighting, and even
some weapons hang from the wall.  Chairs line the walls too, under the
pictures.  In the center of the floor is a desk, with a single person
sitting behind it.  A sign hangs on his desk....
27240.name: (Deil Inc) WBA Information Center

27567.name: The Main Barrel of Stalin's Organ

description: You walk into the padded floors of the workout Gym.  Here is where people
can train up and practise of the WBA.  You see various weights and machines
to help them out.  The walls are covered in mirrors to allow you to watch
yourself work out, and an instructor stands in the middle of the floor
barking orders to some poor person on a weight machine.
27241.name: (Deil Inc) WBA Workout Gym

description: {x
|  Hulls can have their 'material' upgraded after purchase.  This will increase|
|the hitpoints of the airship, allowing it to take more damage.  There are six |
|available materials.  Airships are built default with wooden hulls (10,000hp).|
| (HULLIP) Iron Plated Wooden Hull                     [ 15,000 Armor Points ] |
|  Large iron plates are attached to the wooden hull for added protection.     |
| (HULLPI) Plated Iron Hull                            [ 20,000 Armor Points ] |
|  The wooden hull is removed and replaced with the Iron Plated Hull, then     |
|  smaller iron tiles are added ontop of the plates for a scale like hull.     |
| (HULLSR) Steel Reinforced Iron Plated Hull           [ 25,000 Armor Points ] |
|  The weaker iron tiles of the Plated Iron Hull is removed and replaced with  |
|  stronger steel plates.                                                      |
| (HULLPS) Plated Steel Hull                           [ 30,000 Armor Points ] |
|  The iron or wooden hull is replaced with reinforced steel plates.           |
| (HULLSS) Solid Steel Hull                            [ 35,000 Armor Points ] |
|  The costly production of having a solid hull engineered for your airship.   |
|  The entire hull is forged from molten steel as a single piece.              |
| (HULLMH) Materia Hull                                [ 40,000 Armor Points ] |
|  A solid steel hull is sprayed with liquid materia, a process created with   |
|  the crushing of materia crystals mixed with certain potion chemicals.       |
| See HULL HELP and HULL LIST for more details.                                |
|  Crewed:  When this appears under Weapons, it means the airship is designed  |
|to be 'manned' by more than a single person, and the weapons are located in   |
|their own room, seperate from the helm.  Single Seater Airships are made for  |
|only a few passengers and their weapon controls are located at the helm.      |
|  Floatation:  All airships use some type of device for floatation.  The lift |
|engines of an airship are used to change altitude and compensate for heavy    |
|cargo loads, while the floatation devices counter the initial weight of an    |
|airship.  A well floated airship should be liftable by a mere human.          |
| * Blimp  - Large balloon type structures made from raw canvas, but typically |
|has some sort of protective outter shell made from wood and or metal.         |
| * Tubing - A newer design in which pipes are outfitted to the framework of   |
|the airship.  They are filled with the same floatation gas and even though    |
|adds to the weight of the airship, have the same effect as blimp floaters.    |
|They are more ideal for battle as they are protected by the ships armor.      |
| * Magic  - In rare cases magic is used to float an airship, typically a type |
|of fly or levitation spell.                                                   |
26728.name: {YA{yirship {YH{yull {RD{resign {RD{retail {RR{room {c({C2{c){x

description: To the north a large walkway leads to the Port Building, the main
structure of "{CP{cort {RT{rorregiano{x".  The walkway goes inbetween two
buildings and towards the giants doors leading to the lobby.  To the
south, a small two story shop stands, with a few puppies inside.  The
sign on the door reads "{CNew Thalos Ave Pet Shop{x".  New Thalos Avenue
in Sector 9 continues to the east and west.

garden and maintained by an elderly {YG{ynome{w who always has a
twinkle in his eye and a raunchy joke to share.  His potions are
brewed with care and confidence and fairly priced for all to make
use of.  He is new to {RT{rorregiano{w but quickly making a name for
himself with his honesty and quality products.{x

description: A small dirt road known as West Access Road runs along here
going north and south.  The road runs along the outter fence of the
complex, for security measures.  These roads are used for the Port
Employees to move about and do their business.  The roads encircle the
entire complex to the Main Building, at the southern ends.  The roads
also connect into the main Airship Area.

few trees poke out along the grass, giving some shade.  To the north, a
large, dark forest can be seen, leading into nothingness.

with sacks and crates of ingredients.  To either side of you, very large
towers of booze stand, you see some of the men climbing up the stairs to it,
and dropping in the contents of the sacks.  The smell of oaks and barly is
very strong around here.  The Brewer Continues eastwards.
27254.name: The Brewery Area (B)

description: [Lesson One: Aiming Your Weapons]
{x
To begin, you should already have purchased your weapons.  You
will need ammo to fire your cannons, which can be purchased at
an ammo shop.  There is currently no command to check how many
shots you have in your cannon.  Your airship can aim only at
other airships and in directions, and can only cause damage to
other airships.
{x
TO AIM AT AIRSHIPS
{x
To aim your weapons at other airships, you type the following,
{x
Aim (Cannon Name) (Airship Name).
{x
When you type look, the cannon will show it aiming at the airship.
{x
TO AIM IN A DIRECTION
{x
To aim your weapon in a direction, you type the following,
{x
Aim (Direction) (Airship Name).
{x
You can hit airships aiming in a direction, and your range is
the area borders (shots will not cross into different areas).
But it is a bigger chance of missing than direct aim.
28212.name: The Airship Battle School

description: You stand in the NorthEast part of Wall Market.  To the east a warm
feeling comes from your local Stove Shop, selling diffrent types of
stoves that run on wood, coal or even Makou Gas.  To the north, a
large building stands, a metal tower stands on top of it.  Even
without magic detects on, you can see an aura of a strong magical
force coming off the tower.  A sign hangs above the doorway reading
"The TriPower View Crystal Station #1".
27521.name: {&[{RN{ME{&] {CT{che {CW{call {CM{carket {CS{cquare{x

description: You stand in a underground layer.  This room is made from a dark
wood, which has pictures hanging on the wall.  A large round table
stands in the middle of the room, and several lackies sit at it,
playing poker and drinking.  To the south, a small bar stands with
free drinks.  The bartender stands behind it, joking around with the
guys at the table.  A door to the east leads into an office, and
another door is to the north.

any further east along the road.  Past the barricade, part of the tall
wheat just beside the road has been blasted down.  The earth there is
scorched and broken apart.  To the west, the rutted dirt road continues
through golden fields.

southern gates of Torregiano, built in the middle of the Southern

People walk back and forth moving boxes and crates, also tring to pawn

slopes down to Level B.

monsters!  Wait a moment, these are masks, they're not real.  All along the
walls are masks of monsters the roam the realm, even the store owner is
wearing a lovely mask of a hideous orc.  Wait a moment, that's not a mask at
all, but he is the store owner.

is made from brick, and stands very tall above you.  To either side
huge wooden doors lock away airships in special storage areas.
Bay 1 is north.  Bay 2 is south.

description: There is very little light in this room.  And its very crowded.  Many
vampires are here, drinking, talking and dancing.  A large ball hangs from
the middle of the dance floor, gas lights shine on it creating light that
circles the room.  A stage is to the far west, where a band is playing.  To
the north, you can make out a bar, hardly.  A stream of light seems to be
coming up from below the bottles, making them look like they glow.  Some
people stare at you, probably also looking for Fangs.
27415.name: The Lifeforce

description: Looking around you see that there are several small pictures along both
the south and north walls.  There is a nicely carved door leading north,
with the sign "Cloud Strife's Bar and Pub."  The hallway continues east to
the front counter, and west to an interesting looking contraption known as
an Elevator.

the Torregiano Airship Port, in the center of this area.  A large

two security guards waiting at a large gate.

description: You begin to walk between two buildings.  A large stone pathway has been
built leading into the center of this section of the city.  The buildings on
either side tower a good 3 stories above you.  To the east, the sounds of
Main Street Torregiano echo around.  To the west, you see a large stone
building, with letters carved into the front of it reading "Torregiano Grand
Central Station".
27643.name: The Walkway Between Two Buildings

Welcome to the Port Torregiano Courier Office, the Central Hub of all
airship trade in the Eastern Great Realms.  The room is painted nicely
with a large oak desk.  The walls feature paintings of different
airships, including maps of the continent.  A corkboard hangs from one
wall covered with work papers, wanted ads and so forth.
{x
If you have not already taken the job as AIRSHIP CARGO PILOT, then
you need to visit the local WORK OFFICE here in Torregiano, located
on South Main Street.  From there please read JOB HELP.  To start your
job as a cargo pilot, please park your ship in the room below and then
you may JOB REQUEST.
26723.name: {CP{cort {RT{rorregiano {CC{cargo {CO{cffice{x

description: [West] Passages To Reactor Gates 6S, 7, 8N
27995.name: Under The Torregiano Plate [W]

description: A stone staircase leads up a stone spiral tower that overlooks the
southern gates of Torregiano, built in the middle of the Southern
Makou Reactor, built as an expansion project when Torregiano only had
4 Reactors.  The staircase leads up to the top the tower.
28994.name: The Stairs of the Clock Tower

description: Many grasshoppers lazily sun themselves on the rutted dirt surface
of the Elven Valley Roadway, jumping out of the way only at the last
minute to avoid being crushed.  The tall wheat of the Istar plains
grows all around, whispering quietly in the breeze.
28113.name: {BThe {GE{glven {GV{galley {7R{&o{*adw{&a{7y{x

description: A small indoor hangar stands here, big enough for a couple of
airships to fit in.  A few glowing orbs float above, giving off just
enough light to see around the area.  A small workbench is built into
the wall, with a few tools scattered on it.
28252.name: {CP{crivate {CD{cock {m[{C15{m]{x

description: A large warehouse before you stands, as busy bodies inside move
large wooden crates back and forth from large iron racks that run down
the center of the warehouse.  You see all kinds of workers within the
warehouse, including large titans who move the crates without
problems.  To the west you can see an opening and more light.  To the
east is the backdoor of the warehouse.
27393.name: Port Cargo Warehouse [E]

description: Nothing but air.  To the south is the Legionnaire Bridge, below,
The Harbor.
{x
28580.name: {BThe {RN{rorth {CS{cide {RH{rarbor {RB{rridge {GJ{gum{Gp{x

description: You are stopped by two Legionaires asking where you are going.  To the
west, a large iron structure holds up the cannon, a fence surrounds it.  The
only way in is passed the guards.  To the east is the alley and Main Street.
27401.name: Near A Cannon Support Tower

description: The circle contines to the west around the Bar and Grill, to the
hangars on the western side.  A sign stuck in the ground points out
that the airship LANDING & TAKE OFF ZONE is north.
27070.name: Port Circle

description: The stairs lead up into a small building on top of the port
building.  To the north is the control room and lookout tower of the
port, in which airships are guided to their places within the Port
Yard.  To the south the door leads to the Port Manager's Office.
27750.name: 2nd Floor Port Torregiano

description: The street continues north and south in Sector 9.  The store to the
west has a few windows.  The building stands about three stories tall,
a few people stand at the edge of the roof, enjoying some free time.
The window of the western building is filled with musical instraments.
Some that are rare and exotic.  The sign next to the door reads
"{CWashburn Music{x".  Another type of music rangs out of the eastern
building.  The building to the east has two large doors on the front,
and only windows in the upper two stories.  Inside Smokey Joe the
third stands, pounding out a new sword.  The engraved sign over the
two massive doors read "{CSmokey Joe the III's Blacksmith{x".  Main Street
continues north and south in Sectori 9.
28919.name: {C>{c-{C>{RT{C<{c-{G[ {RM{rain {GS{gtreet {G]{c-{C>{BP{C<{c-{C<{x

description: A massive hangar opens up revealing enough room to stuff a small
fleet of airships within.  This is the Tripower Industrial Hangar,
personal hangar of the Tripower Company.  There is nothing too special
about this area though, the floors are made from large stone tiles,
the walls are made from stone blocks.  There are large timber supports
holding up the ceiling.  Makou Lamps hang down by chains to help
illuminate the area.
26536.name: {r={c={C[ {RT{rri{Bp{bower {&Industrial Hangar {C]{c={r={x

description: A small room opens up, with all different types of keys hanging
from the wall.  A small dwarf sits behind a counter, next to a
grinding wheel.  The smell of grounded metal is strong.  Type "Newkey"
to recieve a key to your airship.
28226.name: {CP{cort {RT{rorregiano {CA{cirship {CL{cocksmith{x

27760.name: Above Port Torregiano [Tower 1]

description: This is the main hangar of Port Judge, in Torregiano.  The hangar
is made from brick, and stands very tall above you.  To either side
huge wooden doors lock away airships in special storage areas.
Bay 5 is north.  Bay 6 is south.
27053.name: Western Main Hangar

description: You stand in a very long line by the Ticket Booth.  You see several
people behind barred windows, giving out the tickets for the train.  The
walls here are covered in posters of diffrent places, besides that, there is
really nothing more here.
27648.name: The Ticket Booth

description: The room is somewhat cozy in that home feeling.  A single bed sits
in the corner, an old beat up nightstand next to it.  A dresser and a
mirror in the room, a desk and chair.  There are windows looking out
over the port, with light, white curtians on them.
27103.name: Port Judge Inn - Room 5

description: Ahh the scent of pot is in the air.  Behind a small counter, a long
haired person is smoking a bowl.  You have entered Torregiano's Finest Head
Shop.  The walls are covered in diffrent devises for smoking.  On the walls
many diffrent bongs and pipes hang.  You see a weird device that is painted
in all diffrent colors, in a nice design, that reads "Automatic Makou Gas
Burning Bong".  The shop is nothing to scream about.  The floors are made
from a dark wood.  The walls look white, but are covered in diffrent bowls
and pipes.  The ceiling looks stained from smoke.
27413.name: Smokey Joe's Head Shop

27568.name: The Main Barrel of Stalin's Organ

description: Nothing but air.  To the south is the Legionnaire Bridge, below,
The Harbor.
