description: A large set of metal staircase leads up to the 2nd Floor of the
Port Building.
28229.name: Staircase to the 2nd Floor

description: The northeast corner of the Port Circle.  To the northeast you can
see the sea shipping docks, and Import / Export area for the entire
port.  The circle contines to the west around the Bar and Grill, to
the hangars on the western side.
27069.name: Port Circle

description: This shop has an almost eerie feel to it.  Empty suits of plate stand
guard along one wall.  Limp tunics and leggings of mail hang on hooks like
macabre corpses.  And helmets of all sizes and shapes sit on shelves like
empty skulls.  Doing nothing to detract from this aura is the shopkeeper
himself.  A large, quiet man, he is clad in a suit of red scale-mail which
so completely covers him he almost seems an animated suit of armor himself.
27310.name: Jortagna's assorted armor

description: {x
{x                          {RT{rripower {YK{yingdom
{x
{x                          {CC{city of {RT{rorregiano
{x            {MV{mectorian {ME{mmpire    {*/ {&|{* \    {CC{castle {RR{red {RS{rteel
{x               {CC{city of {CMa{ck{Cou    {*\ {&|{* /    {CC{city of {RZ{ro{RZ{ro

{x                          {CC{city of {MN{mew {MT{mhalos{x
{x
{x  A large intersection opens up in the road, as one major roadway
crosses another.  Northwards only a short distance stands the giant
iron gates of the city of Torregiano, home of the Tripower Kingdom
and one of the most modern cities in Cruoris.  It stands on the
original fishmen town that was destroyed during the formation of the
Kingdom, the birthplace for freedom in the southern Vectorian lands.
Eastwards is the Red Steel Istar Roadway leading to Castle Red Steel,
a central meeting place for the eastern coast countries.  From that
Roadway the city of Zozo can also be travelled to.  Westwards is the
South Istar Roadway, following the coastline west towards the Elven
Valley, and northwards to the Vectorian Empire.  Makou City can also
be travelled to from this roadway, a once difficult city to access.
27018.name: {R>{r- {RT{rorregiano {RC{rorners {r-{R<{x

{x            {MV{mectorian {ME{mmpire    {*/ {&| {*\    {CC{city of {RT{rorregiano

{x                            {CC{city of {CMa{ck{Cou{x
{x
{x  An intersection opens up to the south in the South Istar Roadway, a
sign post points out possible places that can be travelled to from this
point.  Westwards the roadway continues to the Vectorian Corners, which
one can travel to the Vectorian Empire from there, or continue west to
the Elven Valley.  Eastwards is the Torregiano Corners, which the city
is only northwards, with Castle Red Steel and the city of Zozo east.
Southwards a road cuts through the grassy fields of the Istar Plains
into the Reaper Scythe Mountains that divides this region from the
civilization in the south.  The road leads to Makou City, an
underground mining city known to be home to Outlaws and Lawless people.
No major government rules over the people.  At one time this road did
not exist, and access to the city was only through the top of the
volcano it occupies, or through an underground river.
27137.name: {R>{r- {GMak{gou Corn{Gers {r-{R<{x

description: You find a small room, with a desk, a dresser with a mirror and a
bed within the room.  A single carpet lies on the floor between all
three peices of furniture.  A closet stands to one side.  Windows look
out over whatever landscape is on the side of the building.
27742.name: [Jack's Bar] Room 1

description: The massive hangar stands before you.  Everything inside is huge.
The hangar is made from brick, and looks old.  The ceiling can be seen
above, along with a smaller second story.  This part of the hangar
goes north into it, or south leaving the Port and Hangar.
27047.name: Inside the Main Hangar [South]

Massive glass windows overlook the port outside, as the airships of
the Great Realms move back and forth on the tarmack, doing their daily
jobs.  Port Torregiano is one of the largest airships ports in the
Great Realms, since the Tripower and Torregiano was the home of the
original airships.  Passangers and workers walk up and down this giant
lobby which runs along the outside of the port tarmack.  Signs hang
down from the ceiling pointing out locations.
28172.name: The Port Torregiano Lobby [South]

description: The smell of hot pasta and pizza floats around in the air, as
waiters and waitresses wander around the fancy and decked out dining
hall.  A low light only gives a glance at the pricey high cut cloths
and solid gold jewerly.  The waiters and waitresses wander back and
forth up a flight of stairs in one corner, which the sounds of the
kitchen echo from the top.  The walls and carpets are red, as large
red draperies hang from all ends of the room.  Tables and booths line
the floor, each pointing themselves out with a small gaslight.  In one
corner a small stage with a lone gas light burns, as a couple
musicians beat out a song.  Welcome to Tony's Pizza Parlor of
Torregiano.
27956.name: {Y>>>{y---{GT{gony's{y-{RP{Yizza{y-{GP{garlor{y----{&>{x

description: A large office stands, with windows looking out to the south,
almost level with the actual city.  The rear of the Church of
Nighmares can be seen here.  A large desk stands facing towards the
door, with a few papers and personal items on it.  The walls are
covered with airship pictures and a few file cabinets in the corner.
A large leather chair sits behind it.
27749.name: Port Manager's Office

description: A large pool table stands infront of you, full size and green.  The
walls around the pool table are filled with pictures and paintings of
other famous billard players.  An ashtray sits on the corner of the
pool table.  The pool hall continues in almost all directions.
27931.name: The Backstreet Pool Hall

description: Three streets connect right here in the western part of Torregiano.
New Thalos Avenue connects into the intersection from the west.  The
riches of Sector 9 is well seen from here, down New Thalos Avenue.
Makou Avenue connects from the north.  Sector 7, one of the poorest
sectors in the city stands to the north.  Airship Avenue connects in
from the south, leading into the middle class residential area of
Torregiano.  To the west, a small road side bar stands.  A balcony is
{xover the entrance of the bar.                                     {yII
{x{yII                                                                {yII

description: A small indoor hangar stands here, big enough for a couple of
airships to fit in.  A few glowing orbs float above, giving off just
enough light to see around the area.  A small workbench is built into
the wall, with a few tools scattered on it.
28238.name: {CP{crivate {CD{cock {m[{C5{m]{x

description: [ Lesson One: AIRNAME, AIRFURN, BOLT, UNBOLT]
{x
{x  Airname command will allow you to change the room name in your
airship.  This is the blue text that appears above the description.
It can have color.  To change it, type AIRNAME (Whatever You Want).
{x
{x  Airfurn command will allow you to change the long description
of airship furniture.  The long description is the text you see
when an item is on the ground.  To use this command, type
AIRFURN (Whatever you want).
{x
{x  The BOLT and UNBOLT command are used to secure your airship
furniture to your airship.  It will make it so you cannot pick
the furniture.  Type BOLT (Furniture Name) to bolt it down.  The
Unbolt command will allow you to be able to pick up the item.
Type UNBOLT (Furniture Name) to remove the item.
{x  Airship furniture can be found at the furniture shop.
28195.name: The Airship Customizing School

description: You step onto the St.  Plattsburg Bound Train....  You hear "ALL ABOARD"
and the train jumps forward, and you begin your trip.
27698.name: The St.Plattsburg Bound Train

description: You stand in a large shop, filled with tiny little shelves.  In each
shelves, you see a rolled up peice of paper.  Welcome to the Torregiano Map
Shop, the main place to find a map you want.  Many maps fill the shop,
either in the little shelves or hanging on the wall.  The interior of the
shop is mainly these brown shelves.  The floor is made from hardwood, the
ceiling plaster, and from what you can see on the walls, they are grey.  You
see a guy sitting behind a counter drawing out a map.
27007.name: The Torregiano Map Shop

description: This is a very small office.  All the walls have windows looking out over
the warehouse.  A single desk stands in the middle of the room, filled with
papers, and a in/out box.  A dark man sits behind the desk, leaning back in
his chair, looking at you.
27491.name: The Office

description: You have walked into a smoker's lounge.  The air is filled with heavy
grey smoke, making the visiblity in the room very low.  In the room, several
round tables are scattered around the floor, most of them filled with
people.  To the north a small stage stands, where a piano player and someone
singing stands.  To the west a large bar stands, the barkeeper stands behind
it, cleaning some drinking glasses.  Behind the barkeeper, a variety of
bottles sit on several layers of shelves.  There is a door to the south,
leading out.
27162.name: The Lounge Of The Last Smoker

description: {x
{x    {*M   {x{x{x     A large boulevard stretches to the north and south through the
{x  {g//{G@{g\\{x   southwest side of Torregiano, named after one of the greatest
{x  {g<{G@@@{g>{x   inventions of the empire's.  On either side moderate sized one or two
{x  {g\\{G@{g//{x   story houses dot the sides of the boulevard, and the area is submerged
{x    {*U   {x{x{x  with the sounds of active daily life, of those who live in this lower
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  middle class neighborhood.  Eastwards the taller buildings of Downtown
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  Torregiano can be seen, and the obvious presence of the Makou Cannon
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  above looms.
{x    {c|{x

{&||=====||{x   A ladder rises above the Main Pier straight up to the
{&||     ||{x center of the bridge.  The massive iron support tower of
{&||=====||{x of the bridge stands to the east and west, above is the
{&||     ||{x main deck.  Below is the Sea Port of Torregiano.

description: You stand in a very large warehouse.  Many diffrent crates expand over
the huge floor of the building.  Workers walk around, opening crates,
stamping crates and moving them.  The warehouse seems to be very alive.  The
warehouse is an empty shell of a building.  Very long, and windows towards
the top of the walls.  In the corner, a stairwell leads up to a small
office.
27490.name: A Warehouse

description: The platform in the great Train Yard of Torregiano.  Before you, tracks
of steel lay out in the whole center of this part of town.  Rail after rail,
train after train stands, waiting for leave for its bound city.  To the
north the platform extends, to three trains.  To the east is the station.
27645.name: {RT{rorregiano {CG{crand {CC{central {GP{glatform{x

description: A walkway leads off New Thalos Ave towards a giant building to the
north.  The Port of Torregiano is one of the greatest airship ports in
the world.  The stone walkway goes north up a flight of steps and into
a pair of large doors, leading into the Port Building.  To the either
side of the walkway are the large buildings of New Thalos Ave.
28223.name: {rSouth {CE{cntrance to {CP{cort {RT{rorregiano{x

description: A small dirt road known as NorthWest Access Road runs along here
going east and west.  The road runs along the outter fence of the
complex, for security measures.  These roads are used for the Port
Employees to move about and do their business.  The roads encircle the
entire complex to the Main Building, at the southern ends.  The roads
also connect into the main Airship Area.

description: You stand outside one of the four Torregiano Makou Reactors.  Above you,
a large tower of metal stands, creating the makou gas that powers the city.
A strange, deep green glow hovers above the reactor.  The side of the
reactor is painted with a large, unknown symbol.  Under the symbol its
number stands in large letters.  The sound of machinery echos from within
the walls.  A large iron gate stands here, keeping you away.
27632.name: Outside Torregiano Reactor #2

description: A stone staircase leads up a stone spiral tower that overlooks the
southern gates of Torregiano, built in the middle of the Southern
Makou Reactor, built as an expansion project when Torregiano only had
4 Reactors.  The staircase leads up to the top the tower.
28996.name: The Stairs of the Clock Tower

description: Behold, the colliseum.  Before you layed out is a huge battle arena.  The
whole place is encircled with seats, which look like they are filled.  You
see a walkway to either side of you, going to the seating in the arena.
Back south is the lobby of the colliseum.
27443.name: Seating

description: The roadway comes very close to the Istar Sea, and someday may even
erode into it.  Just northn The roadway comes very close to the Istar
Sea, and someday may even erode into it.  Just north of the well
groomed path lies the shoreline, as the sea cuts inwards to create a
small bay near here.  The South Istar Roadway continues east towards
Torregiano and west towards the road to Makou City.
27133.name: {BThe {RS{routh {BI{bstar {7R{&o{*adw{&a{7y{x

description: You are in a small shop clutterd with the weirdest things you have ever
seen.  Gnomes are huddled around some small object and pounding on it with
hammers to no avial.  Do habs and whatnots along with gears trinkets and
thingys sit in piles overflowing the room.
27504.name: We Fix It

{xclass neighborhood made up of row housing and apartments.   {yII=<{G+----------+

{xcity, close to Kalilyn Park.  West is Westbridge Avenue,    {yII  {G+----------+
{xhome to the Fishermen population of the city, and beyond    {yII

{xAbove the massive structure of the Makou Cannon overcasts   {yII  {G|  {rSouth  {G|

description: The fire that destroyed this building seems to have happened
recently.  Charred support beams from the upper floors lie scattered
around the area.
27550.name: Burnt apartment building

description: The southern back room of the billards is the bar.  A large oak bar
stands to the south, a man behind it serves drinks.  Behind the bar
large shelves are filled with all sorts of bottles of booze.  A small
door stands to the east.  The bar room is filled with small round
tables that dot the floor, the walls are covered in billard pictures
and item.  Back north is the pool hall.
27937.name: The Backstreet Billards Bar

description: {x
{x    Moderate sized houses standing about one or two stories tall stand on   {*M
{x on either side of the southwest boulevard in Torregiano, named after one {g//{G@{g\\
{x of the Empire's greatest inventions to this world.  The cobble stone     {g<{G@@@{g>
{x street runs north to south, with sidewalks in the side giving way to     {g\\{G@{g//
{x citizen traffic, as the main cobble stone boulevard is mostly used for     {*U
{x airship travel.  The sounds of lower middle class life echo around in      {c|
{x this southwest neighborhood, only a dull roar to the greater sounds        {c|
{x found in Downtown Torregiano, which its tall buildings can be seen         {c|
{x east.                                                                      {c|
{GB{goulevard{x                                                         {GB{goulevard{x
28803.name: {G[{YA{yirship {GB{goulevard{G]{x

description: Its almost like an endless road, there is very little in the
surrounding area to break it up from looking like the rest of the
road.  The Istar Plains, also sometimes called the Torregiano Plains
is mainly made up of grass fields.  Much of it is left to grow wild,
with an occational farm cutting into the wilderness with well groomed
crop fields.  Southwards the Reaper Scythe Mountains stretch upwards
and block the southern view.  These mountains merge into the 'Central
Bowl' mountains that makes up the center of the Cruoris continent, and
can be seen westwards.  These mountains are much taller than the
Reaper Scythe, many of the peaks stretching far into the atmosphere,
and always snow covered.  The South Istar Roadway continues east
towards Torregiano, or west towards Makou City and the road to Vector.
27135.name: {BThe {RS{routh {BI{bstar {7R{&o{*adw{&a{7y{x

description: A large lobby opens up as large windows above allow daylight and
night light to shine down on the polish marble floors.  To the east on
the wall in front of the large windows, the Seal of the {RO{7O{&J{x stands
bolted to the marble walls, the light from the windows reflecting off
it.  In the center of the floor a round desk stands, with a secretary
in the middle.  A few round benches dot the floor.  A large staircase
leads upwards.  A sign next to it points to a staircase leading
downwards.
27183.name: {&-[{7Lobby of The {ROr{rd{7er {&of Ju{7d{rgem{&ent{&]-{x

description: {x
{x    {*M   {x{x{x     A large boulevard stretches to the north and south through the
{x  {g//{G@{g\\{x   southwest side of Torregiano, named after one of the greatest
{x  {g<{G@@@{g>{x   inventions of the empire's.  On either side moderate sized one or two
{x  {g\\{G@{g//{x   story houses dot the sides of the boulevard, and the area is submerged
{x    {*U   {x{x{x  with the sounds of active daily life, of those who live in this lower
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  middle class neighborhood.  Eastwards the taller buildings of Downtown
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  Torregiano can be seen, and the obvious presence of the Makou Cannon
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  above looms.
{x    {c|{x
{GB{goulevard{x                                                         {GB{goulevard{x
28800.name: {G[{YA{yirship {GB{goulevard{G]{x

description: You stand in the control platform of "Stalin's Organ".  Straight
ahead of the platform, the awed, Makou Cannon stretches out over the
city of Torregiano.  The mass of the cannon makes you think, of the
power that is behind it.  The platform is made from scafalting and
grates.  To either side of you, large wires and cables go back into
the Tower Of The TriPower.  A large control panel stands, with many
buttons and lights.  You see four MAKOU REACTOR symboles there, with
lights under it spelling "Active" and another set saying "Connected".
None of the lights are lit.  Next to it, you see another Makou Symbol,
this one has the words painted above it "Underground".  The lights
under that Symbol are lit.  All the meter lights across the board are
lit, and the power board is green.  Two large buttons sit next to a
large RED Button.  The button to the right says "On/Off".  The button
in the middle says "Fire", and the button to the left says "OverRide".
28999.name: The Cannon Control Room

description: This is the one of the main tunnels leading to the Port Torregiano
Complex.  The tunnel runs to the west into another tunnel, and then to
the Complex.  To the east is the tunnel leading to Torregiano Grand
Central and the Railyard.
27143.name: {&[{RT{r-{BA{b-{RP{&]{B Eastern Entrance Tunnel{x

description: The Enterance to the Horn of the Unicorn Inn is a fairly clean building,
where most of the locals go to rest after a long day, and adventurers go to
heal their wounds.  To the north there is a fairly small room with a
counter, and a man sitting behind the counter selling room keys.  To the
south you can see people playing ball games on New Thalos Avenue.
27201.name: Horn of The Unicorn Inn

description: The circle continues around Port Judge Bar & Grill.  The circle
goes to the east and west.  Back west is all the hangars and the
western end of the port.
27074.name: Port Circle

description: Welcome to the Misty Hollow.  You see the room is filled with all kinds
of diffrent nick-nacks.  It almost looks like a head shop, but not as many
pipes.  You see spikes that can be rivited onto clothing, necklaces, chains
and alot more.  The interior of the shop is plain.  The walls look white,
and floor a dark black color.  Some ceiling fans sway in the air above you
head.  The owner looks at you from behind his counter.
27418.name: The Misty Hollow

description: You stand outside The SunFlower Cafe.  It is a small building, sitting on
the corner of New Thalos Ave, and The TriPower Plaza.  The building is
painted a nice white color, and a large sign hangs on the front of the
building, reading out "SunFlower Cafe", which a large sunflower on it.  The
Patio Area here overlooks the TriPower Plaza, which you can see what is
happening infront of The Tower.  Along the Patio Area, you see a few round
tables sitting outside.  The door to the inside of the Cafe is west.
27189.name: {g[{G- {7T{&he {YSun{yflo{Ywer {CC{cafe {G-{g]{x

description: A set of steps goes down towards the eastern entrance to Port
Torregiano A set of steps goes down towards the eastern entrance to
Port Torregiano.  To the south the walkway leads towards Torregiano
Grand Central.
28225.name: {MEast {CE{cntrance to {CP{cort {RT{rorregiano{x

description: {x
| {GACSC {RPort Torregiano{x  | |

27763.name: Above Port Torregiano [Tower 7]

description: {x
{x    {*M   {x{x{x    The avenue of cobble stone stretches to the east to the
{x  {g//{G@{g\\{x   west, along the southwest side of the city of Technology.
{x  {g<{G@@@{g>{x   Along each side past the stone sidewalks and makou gas
{x  {g\\{G@{g//{x   lights are large victorian homes, ranging from two to three
{x    {*U   {x{x{x  stories tall.  The streets are clean and well guarded, as
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  daily life of night and day continue on this avenue, far
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  away from the hustle and louder atmosphere of Downtown.
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  Numbers are carved into the sides of the sidewalk.
{x    {c|{x
28260.name: {G[{bZ{ro{bZ{ro {GA{gvenue{G]{x

description: You are in a old warehouse.  Cobwebs and spiders hang from the ceiling
making this place not only dark, but creppy as well.  Small beety red eyes
glare at you then scudder away into the cracks of the floor boards.  With
each step the flor creaks as your weight is applyed on to them.
27505.name: An Old Warehouse

description: You find a small room, with a desk, a dresser with a mirror and a
bed within the room.  A single carpet lies on the floor between all
three peices of furniture.  A closet stands to one side.  Windows look
out over whatever landscape is on the side of the building.
27738.name: [Jack's Bar] Room 4

description: {x
{x    {*M   {x{x{x    The avenue stretches to the east and west, lined with its
{x  {g//{G@{g\\{x   rich cobble stone along Camelot Avenue, named after the city
{x  {g<{G@@@{g>{x   keep northwest of Westbridge.  Along the street are large
{x  {g\\{G@{g//{x   two, three and even four story homes, whose outsides reflect
{x    {*U   {x{x{x  that of their rich owners inside.  Along the north behind
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  the homes is the city park known as Kalilyn Park, a lush
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  haven of wilderness amounst the less natural setting of the
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  city.
{x    {c|{x

description: You stand in Vincent Blackhearts office, which seems very cold.  The
whole office is made from the same black marble as the rest of the world is.
On the walls diffrent paitings and advertisments stand, showing his power.
His desk is created from the black marble, only a few objects sit on it.
All around the room you see diffrent trophies of Vincent's, animals and
weapons mainly.  A large window stands to the east, overlooking to
Torregiano Park.
27231.name: (Deil Inc) Blackheart's Office

description: {gYou enter the Green Room, the lounge of the Station.  Here you see
couches and chairs spread across the room.  To the south, a large
table filled with food stands.  Some people and workers of the
"Station" walks around here, eating Donuts and drinking coffee.  The
walls here are green, and so is the ceiling, rug and furniture.  The
walls also have posters on them.
27196.name: The Green Room

description: The hallway ends with three doors.  The door to the north reads
"THREE".  The number on the door to the east is "FIVE" and the number
on the door to the south is "FOUR".  The Inn only has five rooms,
others must go pay the city prices.
27102.name: Hallway in the Inn

here, one to the north and one the west.  Both buildings stand five
stories tall, and are apartment buildings.  TriPower Plaza continues
to the east, and to the south.  Southwards you can see the Sunflower
Cafe.  To the east you see the Torregiano Ritz.

{x  The roadway comes to an intersection here.  Northwards a new road
leads northwards along the western shores of the Istar Sea into the
Vectorian Empire.  Eastwards the roadway travels past the City of
Makou to the City of Torregiano, and points beyond.  Westwards the
road travels into the grassy Istar Plains towards the Elven Valley.
Southwards the road heads towards Blazier Mountain and the southern
lands, home to Westbridge and the Dwarven Kingdom.

description: North Seating.  A thunderous roar fills the stadium as you clamber to
find your seat and witness the upcoming arena match.  You see bloodstains on
the very front benches from particularly gruesome matches of the past, and
you try to find a clean patch of bench and get comfortable.  For whom will
you cheer to reign victorious over the corpse of his fallen opponent?
27446.name: North Seating

27563.name: The Med. Barrel of Stalin's Organ

description: Here there are several elegant soits of armor in the corners, and large
intriquitely carved doors on every eash wall.  These doors are much nicer
thn the ones on the floor below you, and instead of numbers they have the
name of the suite carved in them.
27213.name: Upper Class Hallway

description: Nothing but air.  To the east is the Legionnaire Bridge, below,
The Harbor.
{x
28611.name: {BThe {mW{Mest {CS{cide {RH{rarbor {RB{rridge {GJ{gum{Gp{x

description: The gates are behind you, and the main hangar to the north of you.
The yard here is filled with scrap metal, old junk and just piles of
metal.  Two massive doors stand infront of you, leading into the
hangar.  The sign above the door reads "Port Judge" [Airship Inc].  To
the west you see large buildings, and a road.
27046.name: Between the Gates & Building

description: You have reached the end of the hallway.  To either side of you a door
stands.  The door to the west reads "CHALLENGER B's WAITING ROOM".  The door
to the east reads "CHALLENGER B's TRAINING GYM".
27266.name: The East Colliseum Wing

expands 2 stories upwards reveiling a large dome.  Makou Gas lights hang
down from the ceiling itself.  In the lobby, people walk around to diffrent
doorways.  Diffrent types of seats line the whole floor, and a area to the
south is filled with nothing but chairs.  To the north, several ticket booth
stand, with clerks waiting behind them.

description: You enter the small store that is ligned with endless shelves lined
with trinkets and toys that can only be found in Torregiano.  This
shop truly is what one would call cute.
27912.name: Khellis's Gift Shop

description: A large meeting hall opens up, as an autiorium, rows of seats line
down towards the stage to the south.  This is where the TPAA holds
their meetings, better known as the Tripower Airship Authority, the
police of the skies.
|{RT{rri{Bp{bower {YAirship Authority{x|
27751.name: Port Torregiano Meeting Hall

description: You stand on the 2nd Floor of the Deil Building.  You see the hallway is
made from the black marble as the downstairs lobby.  Doors line each wall on
either side, leading into the various shops of Deil Inc.  To the north a
loud rumble, and a smell seems to be falling out.  To the south the door
stands, with a hammer and what looks like a peice of iron on it.
27225.name: (Deil Inc) 2st Floor Hallway

description: You stand in the First National Bank Of Torregiano.  A large lobby
stands, filled with people, and tables.  To the south you see a long bar,
with windows and lines infront of it.  The whole bank is made from white
marble.  The walls are made from fine crafted wood.  You see on every wall a
guard, watching over everyone.  To the east you see a door with a sign over
it reading "Safe Deposit Boxes" Main Street is back west and the Plaza to
the north.
27410.name: {&<{*|{&> {R1{rst {GN{gational {YB{yank {*o{7f {RT{rorregiano {&<{*|{&>{x

Tripower and Heart of the Airship Society.  From the large windows
to the north overlooking the Airship Field, the marble floors stretch
south, leading to a staircase upwards to the second floor of the Port
Building.  Two sets of double doors are on either side of the lobby
leading out east and west.  From the outside you'd be aware of the
giant doors leading into the building, which stretches like an L
around the Airship Field.

{x  The cobble stone of the avenue stretches to the east and west,           {*M
{x lined with iron makou gas lamps, which at night give off a strange      {g//{G@{g\\
{x green glow, giving the city an odd look during the nighttime.  On       {g<{G@@@{g>
{x either side large two or three story homes stand, prepped and clean     {g\\{G@{g//
{x compared to other neighborhoods in this city, only a piece of trash       {*U
{x floats about in the streets from time to time.  It is somewhat quiet      {c|
{x around here, compared to the dull road of the downtown area, or even      {c|
{x more so the industrial area in the northwest side.  As seen all over      {c|
{x the city, the support structure of the makou cannon stands above.         {c|
28108.name: {G[{bZ{ro{bZ{ro {GA{gvenue{G]{x

description: This department is by far the largest in the store.  Rows and racks
are stuffed with every necessity a modern woman could possibly desire.
Some fashions are importated from lands as far away as Heifong,
although the majority of the items reflect local styles.  The men's
department is found up a metal spiral staircase and the teen's
section is to the west.
27810.name: {WWomen's Department{x

description: Its walls are made out of the same, black rock the church was.  The
ceiling is high, and the rafters of roof are exposed.  All around you,
everything is draped in darkness.  The windows glare out the light of
the city, through its black glass.  There is a pew here for praying,
facing north, to the throne in front of the church.
27822.name: Isle In The Middle Of The Church

description: {x
{yV{x    The {CLe{7gi{Bon{Cna{7ir{Be {RH{rarbor {RB{rridge{x is the only connection   {yV
{&|{x  between the city of {RT{rorregiano{x and the {GI{gsland{x of         {&|
{&|{x  {YAc{ycoma{Yxx{x, located just north of {RT{rorregiano{x.  The island  {&|
{&|{x  was once home to The {CLe{7gi{Bon{x, and the {ROr{rd{7er {&Of Ju{7d{rgem{&ent, {&|
{&|{x  before the {CLe{7gi{Bon{x was disbanned.  It now serves as a     {&|
{&|{x  small village, as part of the city of {RT{rorregiano{x.  The   {&|
{&|{x  bridge, built from massive stone blocks, stretches high  {&|
{*---{x above the harbor and sea port below.                    {*---{x
28559.name: {RT{rhe {CLe{7gi{Bon{Cna{7ir{Be {RH{rarbor {RB{rridge{x

description: A small indoor hangar stands here, big enough for a couple of
airships to fit in.  A few glowing orbs float above, giving off just
enough light to see around the area.  A small workbench is built into
the wall, with a few tools scattered on it.
28253.name: {CP{crivate {CD{cock {m[{C14{m]{x

description: You are on Level C..  To the east and west is nothing but
buildings.  People walk back and forth moving boxes and crates, also
tring to pawn off fish and broken items on people.  The Level goes
north, and then slopes down to the docks.
27275.name: {G[{BS{Ce{Ba {RP{rort {YR{yoad{G]{x

description: You stand in a room that really has no true purpose.  The room is
filled with metal cash boxes, more or less probably filled with money.
You also see all diffrent types of weapons on the walls, in boxes and
just laying out on the floor.  You see bats and clubs, iron knuckles
and even some piano strings.  A small table sits in the middle of the
floor, which has some cold cash on it.
27264.name: {GThe Co{gll{rect{gio{Gn Room{x

27569.name: The Main Barrel of Stalin's Organ

description: This roadway was originally built the Vectorian Empire as part of
its continential network, in theory a person could walk these roadways
all the way to the Figaro Kingdom on the western coast, untold miles
away.  This road served as the main trade passage between what is
known as the Northern Vectorian Tier and Southern Vectorian Tier,
divided by the Reaper Scythe mountains to the south.  Together this
once made the entire Vectorian Empire until the sucession of the
Tripower Kingdom, which ruled over the entire Southern Tier for a
period of time.  Now they only rule over these grassy plains, while
the rest of the Southern Tier is ruled by the Factions.
28437.name: {BThe {RS{routh {BI{bstar {7R{&o{*adw{&a{7y{x

description: The stairs come to a complete end at the top, and turns to the east
into the main port building.  A large hallway extends across the
building, with three doors on the north and south side.  The hallway
is wide, with all kinds of pictures and plaques on the walls.
27730.name: West Stairs To Second Floor

description: The roadway has a strange sound when feet, wheels or anything
touches it.  Unlike cobble stone streets and other roadways, the
surface seems to be made of crushed white colored stone.  Its soft on
the feet, but at times needs to be smoothed out and graded, which can
be costly for the comfort.  Here and there some plants have managed to
grow in the stones, and yet again people must walk and pull the weeds
out, because sooner or later nature would reclaim this path.  The
white road can be seen for a long distance, travelling in a straight
line within the grassy plains of the Istar Sea.  Eastwards the city of
Torregiano can be seen, its massive walls julting upwards far above
the grass, or the massive cannon which sits above the city.  Westwards
the road heads towards the Vectorian Empire, and Makou City.
28439.name: {BThe {RS{routh {BI{bstar {7R{&o{*adw{&a{7y{x

description: This is the most peaceful room you have ever seen.  It has a large bed
with satin sheets in the middle of the room, and a very comfortable looking
chair rests againt the wall.  Next to the chair there is a small stand with
ice in it, and some complimentary champaigne.  The scene out the windows
looks almost like a picture it i such a perfect veiw.  You can see cmall
children playing ball in the street, and the ice cream shop across the
street.
27219.name: Adventurer Suite

description: You stand on the third floor hallway of Deil Inc.  To the north a large
door with a pair of figures fighting stands, reading "World Battling Arena".
To the south the smell of cooking food and laughter comes echoing out into
the hallways.
27229.name: (Deil Inc) 3rd Floor Hallway

description: {x
{x    {*M   {x{x{x    On either side of this avenue large two to four story
{x  {g//{G@{g\\{x   buildings stand, pushed up against each other with only rare
{x  {g<{G@@@{g>{x   alleys leading inbetween them.  The buildings are very clean
{x  {g\\{G@{g//{x   and fancy, reflecting the rich residents which live inside.
{x    {*U   {x{x{x  The cobble stone street stretches north to south in this
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  neighborhood of the southeast city.  Hidden behind the
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  buildings of the west is Kalilyn Park, a lush haven of
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  nature in the city.
{x    {c|{x
{GB{goulevard                                                          {GB{goulevard{x
28302.name: {G[{CLe{7gi{Bon {GB{goulevard{G]{x

description: A large wooden staircase leads up from this room.  A single window
looks north out into an alley.  There is nothing much more in the
room.
27735.name: The Staircase

description: You are on a dusty trail winding its way east-west between huge,
ancient trees that stand close on all sides.  Not a sound is to be
heard - everything is ominously quiet.
27705.name: Narrow trail through the forest

description: A small indoor hangar stands here, big enough for a couple of
airships to fit in.  A few glowing orbs float above, giving off just
enough light to see around the area.  A small workbench is built into
the wall, with a few tools scattered on it.
28242.name: {CP{crivate {CD{cock {m[{C6{m]{x

description: You are in a small "low class" bar.
Pools of beer and vomit cover the floor making thestech awfull.
A stout Small man stands behind the counter cleaning the mugs in a very unsanitary fashion.
If i were you this is not the place to get a drink.
27506.name: Pugslys's Pub

description: {x
{x    {*M   {x{x{x    The avenue stretches to the east and west, lined with its
{x  {g//{G@{g\\{x   rich cobble stone along Camelot Avenue, named after the city
{x  {g<{G@@@{g>{x   keep northwest of Westbridge.  Along the street are large
{x  {g\\{G@{g//{x   two, three and even four story homes, whose outsides reflect
{x    {*U   {x{x{x  that of their rich owners inside.  Along the north behind
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  the homes is the city park known as Kalilyn Park, a lush
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  haven of wilderness amounst the less natural setting of the
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  city.
{x    {c|{x
{GA{gvenue                                                             {GA{gvenue{x
28205.name: {G[{RCa{Ymel{Rot {GA{gvenue{G]{x

description: {x
| {GACSC {RPort Torregiano{x  | |
| |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  | {GX{x: {gEntrace/Exit Your Location{x |
| |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  | {GG{x: {gTemporary/Guest Parking{x    |
27782.name: Above Port Torregiano [Tower 6]

description: A small dirt road known as SouthWest Access Road runs along here
going east and west.  The road runs along the outter fence of the
complex, for security measures.  These roads are used for the Port
Employees to move about and do their business.  The roads encircle the
entire complex to the Main Building, at the southern ends.  The roads
also connect into the main Airship Area.  The Main Building is
Directly to the east.  A staircase leads to the second floors of the
Main Port Building.
{x
[West] Port Cargo Warehouse >{RRESTRICTED AREA{x<
[Up] Second Floor Main Port Building
27395.name: West Port Building Exit

description: The cobble stone road of Main Street continues north into an
intersection, and south into the city, and Sector 9.  The northern
sectors of Torregiano are known for its low class people, more of the
poor end.  To the west a large three story office building stands, a
ship captain outside.  The sign on the door reads "{CTorregiano Port
Manager{x".  The sweet smell of hash and hookas comes from the smaller
two story build to the east.  You see the sign on the window "{CThe
Northern Sector Hash Bar{x".  Main Street continues north and south
through the northern sectors.
28926.name: {RM{rain {GS{gtreet {*[{CSec {R6 {*-+- {CSec {R5 {*]{x

description: Nothing but air.  To the east is the Legionnaire Bridge, below,
The Harbor.
{x
28612.name: {BThe {mW{Mest {CS{cide {RH{rarbor {RB{rridge {GJ{gum{Gp{x

description: This is the warehouse where Anarchist Brewers (Next Door) stores all
there new drinks.  The warehouse is very large, and is filled with crates,
kegs and bottles.  The smell of beer is in the air, and smoke.  You notice
to one side a group of dwarves sit around a table, playing dragon poker,
drinking some brew, and smoking cigars.
27412.name: Warehouse Of The Anarchist Brewers

description: This is a large, recessed bunker made from rock and iron.  A narrow
window looks out to the west, providing a view of the burned cannon
testing ground.  Some chairs are lined up in front of the window to
watch the testing events.  A few stairs lead up to a exit door.
27026.name: OverView

description: The cobble stone continues north and south.  To the west a
{x           small two story red brick building stands.  The windows on      {*M
{x           the second story show signs of it being an apartment, and     {g//{G@{g\\
{x           the bottom window reveals novelty shot glasses.  The sign     {g<{G@@@{g>
{x           above the door reads "Torregiano Shot Glass". To the east     {g\\{G@{g//
{x           a building somewhat set back from the street stands. A few      {*U
{x           glowing signs and glass doors lead into the pool hall. The      {c|
{x           sign above the door reads "Backstreet Billiards".  A sign       {c|
{x           in the window of the Backstreet Billards reads "HEALING         {c|
{x           ROOM".                                                          {c|
{x {CShot Glasses                                                          {CBilliards{x
28904.name: {C>{c-{C>{RT{C<{c--{G[ {RM{rain {GS{gtreet {G]{c--{C>{BP{C<{c-{C<{x

description: The plaza continues north and south.  To the west New Thalos Avenue
aka Sector 9 still continues to the west.  You see all kinds of shops
and buildings, including a few churches.  To the south you see the
SunFlower Cafe, and The Torregiano Opera House.
28912.name: {&-{*[ {7The {RT{rri{Bp{bower {GP{glaza {m({MW{m) {*]{&-{x

description: {x
{&||=====||{x   A large ladder stretches up the side of the massive iron
{&||     ||{x tower.  The tower stretches up to the top of the tower, a
{&||=====||{x possible fifteen stories above the bridge.  Far below under
{&||     ||{x the bridge is the Sea Port of Torregiano, and the waters of
{&||=====||{x the Sea of Istar.  Airships and boats dock at the five
{&||     ||{x massive piers in the sea port.  An unsure footing on this
{&||=====||{x ladder might cause a nasty spill.
28567.name: {RH{rarbor {RB{rridge {ME{mast {CA{cccess {CL{cadder{x

description: The lounge is filled with many couches and a few chairs.  A table
against a far wall contains coffee, and eatery.  The lighting is not
that bright, putting a dark color over the room.  Everything is red.
Pictures of airships and newspaper articles hang on the walls, and
even a few minature models of airships sit under glass.  You see a
bathroom to the south.
27098.name: Hangar Lounge

27559.name: The Med. Barrel of Stalin's Organ

27562.name: The Med. Barrel of Stalin's Organ

description: You follow a small mountain path, along the ridge of the mountain
and into its depths.  You see other citizens enjoying the walk along
this path, going back and forth in arms.  The path turns to the
north...
27699.name: A Small Mountain Pass

description: You enter the West side of Wall Market.  Right away you are greeted
by merchants tring to earn a few coins.  Wall Market is Torregiano's
Main Trade Center, where most of the Trading of the TriPower takes
place.  The Square is very large, and packed with people.  Large
buildings encircle of market itself, and a exit to the far east leads
off to East Torregiano.
27518.name: {&[{mWest{&] {CT{che {CW{call {CM{carket {CS{cquare{x

description: A walkway leads off New Thalos Ave towards a giant building to the
north.  The Port of Torregiano is one of the greatest airship ports in
the world.  The stone walkway goes north up a flight of steps and into
a pair of large doors, leading into the Port Building.  To the either
side of the walkway are the large buildings of New Thalos Ave.

28222.name: {rSouth {CE{cntrance to {CP{cort {RT{rorregiano{x

description: The road turns downwards into the valley.  The smell of death hits your
nose as you enter this area.  The road twists and turns down the road, going
into the sea valley, and you see another large road, going north.
27009.name: The Mountain Road

description: Before you is the inside of the Port Torregiano Repair Shop.  The
floor is covered in airship parts, from complete engines to hull
plates.  The floor also looks to be covered in grease and oil.  Large
chains hang from the ceiling used to hoist up the parts of the
airship.  There is no windows or doors in this area, and has the feel
of being underground.  The large opening above with daylight shining
in is good proof of this, along with a massive wooden platform in the
center of the room to lift airships up to the next level.
{x
{x  TIP: Your Airship is currently being "AUTO" Repaired, which means
the hitpoints will be restored after 4 ticks.  Once your airship is
repaired, it will be dropped off in the Port Torregiano Airship Repair
Shop Pick-Up Lot, located above.  To save money you can use the REPAIR
command in the Repair Shop located UP and EAST from this location.
27951.name: The {CP{cort {RT{rorregiano {YR{yepair {YS{yhop{x {Y[{RAuto Repair Shop{Y]{x

description: Massive windows stretch out away from the building overlooking the
working airship tarmack below.  The windows are rounded out, as so the
room that is sticking out.  Inside the room is a few benches and live
trees.  Outside the airship tarmack stands, with the long term storage
towers in the distance.  Directly north is the fuel pumps of the port.
To the east the Port Building stretches east, and then turns north
following the outter parts of the tarmack.  The Port Building also
continues to the west.
28220.name: {cThe {CP{cort {RT{rorregiano {CO{cverlook{x

description: You stand in a dark hallway.  To the north a pair of iron double
doors stands, locked and sealed.  Two guards stand infront of it,
watching people walk by.  The smell of food comes from the room south,
and you get a peek inside, which all you can see is a dark green
wallpaper.  A staircase leads upwards somewhere, and to the east the
hallway continues.
27193.name: The Hallway

27770.name: Above Port Torregiano

description: The staircase from the street above leads down to a tunnel going to
the Torregiano Airship Port, in the center of this area.  A large
tunnel opens up to the south, leading into the complex itself.  You
see two security guards waiting at a large gate.
27409.name: Torregiano Airship Port North Gate

description: This is more of an office than a shop.  In this office you see a ton of
file cabinets, and a single person sitting behind her desk, watching you.  A
pair of chairs sits infront of her desk.
27239.name: (Deil Inc) Iron Works Corp.

description: A small roadway makes it way off the Main Roads of the port to the
outter security road around the complex.  Directly north is the North
Access Road, and the Northern Gate.
27396.name: {*-{&[{CP{cort {RT{rorregiano {CP{crivate {CH{cangars{&]{*- {x[{RNORTH{x]

description: You stand at the 3rd Floor West Stairwell, the last floor of this
building.  Another black marble hallway extends to the east, with doors on
either side.  At the end of the hallway a pair of double doors stands, with
a pair of guards outside keeping watch.
27228.name: (Deil Inc) 3st Floor W Stairwell

description: The room is somewhat cozy in that home feeling.  A single bed sits
in the corner, an old beat up nightstand next to it.  A dresser and a
mirror in the room, a desk and chair.  There are windows looking out
over the port, with light, white curtians on them.
27105.name: Port Judge Inn - Room 4

description: The Elven Valley Roadway turns sharply here.  To the east, the
road is nothing more than rutted dirt as it leads off through
seemingly endless expanse of wheat-filled plains toward the grand
city of Torregiano.  To the south lies rocky hills, cobblestone
pavement, and the Valley of the Elves.
28115.name: {BThe {GE{glven {GV{galley {7R{&o{*adw{&a{7y{x

description: This is the Drinking Shop, where Deil Inc under the name of Anarchist's
Brewers makes new drinks.  The whole room is filled with stills and tables
filled with diffrent color bottles.  In the middle of the room at least ten
people sit on chairs in the circle, singing happily and passing a bottle
around.
27236.name: (Deil Inc) Drink Corp.

description: You stand in the Cafateria of the Deil Inc.  This room isn't like the
building, but built from a greyish material.  Long square tables are lined
up in rows here, extending through-out the whole cafateria.  To the west,
some small windows open up, showing foods of all kinds.  People stand behind
the food and plate glass windows, scooping out and giving the food out to
the people.
27243.name: (Deil Inc) Cafateria

description: Its walls are made out of the same, black rock the church was.  The
ceiling is high, and the rafters of roof are exposed.  All around you,
everything is draped in darkness.  The windows glare out the light of
the city, through its black glass.  There is a pew here for praying,
facing north, to the throne in front of the church.
27826.name: Eastern Seating Of The Church

description: {x
Offical Project Name: Torregiano II (First Version was razed)
Ground Breaking     : Sunday March 17th, 1998 at 5:36am EST
Offical Size        : 2000 Vnums (Vnum: 27000-28999)
All Room Vnums Used : Saturday January 4th, 2003 at 1:13am EST
--> An Addition 2000 Rooms will be added to continue work.
27000.name: {&/{*|{&\/{*|{&\/{RT{rhe{&^{RMon{ru{Rment{&^{RO{rf{&^{RT{rorregiano{&\/{*|{&\/{*|\{x

description: Below runs a massive beam of iron, forged by the Dwarven Kingdom,
know for its genious work in the art of metal creation.  The Harbor
Bridge was built mostly from this metal, including the massive tower
in the center.  To the north, the island of Accomaxx, once home of the
Legion, now more a neighborhood of upper class houses and stores.  To
the south stands the massive city of Torregiano, stretching south
almost to the horizon.  On a clear day, you can see the mountains that
divide the city from other cities, like Westbridge.  To the east and
west access ladders run down the tower to the bridge itself.  An
unsteady footing might cause for a nasty spill.
28575.name: {BThe {RTop{B Of {RT{rhe {CLe{7gi{Bon{Cna{7ir{Be {RH{rarbor {RB{rridge{x

description: You stand in the cozy room of the Inn.  In here are three beds lined
against the wall, for a group of travelers to sleep in.  A few chairs sit
next to the windows, and a small fireplace stands in the corner, with fresh
wood next to it.
27250.name: (Inn Of The Drow) Room Three

description: This establishment caters to the wealthier visitors and residents
of Torregiano.  The store is clean, and well stocked with all of the
latest fashions of the season.  Wooden mannequins in various poses
display Hilda's clothes and accessories.  The Women's Department,
which dwarfs all other departments in the store is beneath a spiral
staircase to the west.
27806.name: Hilda's Department store

description: You step onto the Westbridge Bound Train....  You hear "ALL ABOARD" and
the train jumps forward, and you begin your trip.
27647.name: The Westbridge Bound Train

{x    {*M   {x{x{x    On either side of this avenue large two to four story

{x  {g\\{G@{g//{x   and fancy, reflecting the rich residents which live inside.
{x    {*U   {x{x{x  The cobble stone street stretches north to south in this
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  neighborhood of the southeast city.  Hidden behind the
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  buildings of the west is Kalilyn Park, a lush haven of

{x    {c|{x
{GB{goulevard                                                          {GB{goulevard{x
28307.name: {G[{CLe{7gi{Bon {GB{goulevard{G]{x

description: Beside the road, a large bunker made from stone pokes halfway up from the
ground with the other half underground.  A small dirt path leads downwards
to a door into the bunker.  To the west, along the road, can be seen burned
and blasted earth.  To the east is a barricaded checkpoint.  To the north,
a grassy valley of some type opens up.
27024.name: {BThe {GE{glven {GV{galley {7R{&o{*adw{&a{7y{x

description: A small indoor hangar stands here, big enough for a couple of
airships to fit in.  A few glowing orbs float above, giving off just
enough light to see around the area.  A small workbench is built into
the wall, with a few tools scattered on it.
28258.name: {CP{crivate {CD{cock {m[{C24{m]{x

description: Platform A, this train platform allows people to board the trains going
to Westbridge, St.  Plattsburg or New Thalos.  To the north, east, and west
you see the great iron beasts sitting, waiting to leave.  You look at the
trains and notice the way they are built, the nice workings on the outside,
who knows what the insides look like.
27646.name: Platform A

description: The room is somewhat cozy in that home feeling.  A single bed sits
in the corner, an old beat up nightstand next to it.  A dresser and a
mirror in the room, a desk and chair.  There are windows looking out
over the port, with light, white curtians on them.
27107.name: Port Judge Inn - Room 1

Massive glass windows overlook the port outside, as the airships of
the Great Realms move back and forth on the tarmack, doing their daily
jobs.  Port Torregiano is one of the largest airships ports in the
Great Realms, since the Tripower and Torregiano was the home of the
original airships.  Passangers and workers walk up and down this giant
lobby which runs along the outside of the port tarmack.  Signs hang
down from the ceiling pointing out locations.
28181.name: Port Torregiano Lobby [Gate V]

description: {x
{x            The rich apartments of Legion Boulevard, named after the       {*M
{x          defense force of the Tripower Kingdom stand smashed up         {g//{G@{g\\
{x          against each other, leaving little to no room inbetween        {g<{G@@@{g>
{x          these two to four story structures.  The buildings are         {g\\{G@{g//
{x          dressed in the best fasion, and reflect those who rent           {*U
{x          within.  Above the cannon support structure stands, casting      {c|
{x          shadows over the city during the day, and giving light from      {c|
{x          large gas lights which hang from the structure itself.           {c|

description: A small room opens up with a long table in the center with a few chairs
around it.  That is pretty much it in the room.
27260.name: The Break Room

description: This is a small and rather unpleasant room.  Although the lighting is
decent, it flickers from time to dime.  An unpleasant smell hovers at the
edge of perception, and the walls look to be in need of an immediate call
from the maid.  The window lets in only a moderate amount of light, and even
if the layer of grime covering it were to be removed, it would probably
offer a view only of the building next door.  The bed, at least, looks
moderately comfortable, and you should be able to get a pretty good night's
sleep in here by ignoring your surroundings.
27303.name: room {#two{0

description: A small dirt road known as NorthEast Access Road runs along here
going east and west.  The road runs along the outter fence of the
complex, for security measures.  These roads are used for the Port
Employees to move about and do their business.  The roads encircle the
entire complex to the Main Building, at the southern ends.  The roads
also connect into the main Airship Area.
27371.name: {RNorth{x-{MEast {CH{cangar {RR{road{x

27339.name: {CP{cort {RT{rorregiano {CT{carmack{x

description: A large stone archway leads into a large courtyard to the south.
A wooden sign hangs in the archway, with the words "Starwind &
Hawkins" carved into it.  To the north is the busy street of New
Thalos Avenue.  To the south is the courtyard.
28632.name: {*| {RS{rtarwind {7& {CH{Bawkins {*|{x

description: Its almost like an endless road, there is very little in the
surrounding area to break it up from looking like the rest of the
road.  The Istar Plains, also sometimes called the Torregiano Plains
is mainly made up of grass fields.  Much of it is left to grow wild,
with an occational farm cutting into the wilderness with well groomed
crop fields.  Southwards the Reaper Scythe Mountains stretch upwards
and block the southern view.  These mountains merge into the 'Central
Bowl' mountains that makes up the center of the Cruoris continent, and
can be seen westwards.  These mountains are much taller than the
Reaper Scythe, many of the peaks stretching far into the atmosphere,
and always snow covered.  The South Istar Roadway continues east
towards Torregiano, or west towards Makou City and the road to Vector.
28441.name: {BThe {RS{routh {BI{bstar {7R{&o{*adw{&a{7y{x

description: You are about 50 feet in the air.  The buildings Of Torregiano seem to be
getting shorting in height.  Some buildings you can already see the tops
too.  You can either go up or down.
27404.name: Climbing The Support Tower

description: You are in the Wall Market of Torregiano, east side.  From here you
can see the whole market, packed full with people and merchants, all
doing business.  The market is filled with buildings, which surround
the whole market, all diffrent businesses.  Merchants here try to get
you to buy something, but seem to be speaking in a foreign tongue.
27520.name: {&[{MEast{&] {CT{che {CW{call {CM{carket {CS{cquare{x

description: The roadway has a strange sound when feet, wheels or anything
touches it.  Unlike cobble stone streets and other roadways, the
surface seems to be made of crushed white colored stone.  Its soft on
the feet, but at times needs to be smoothed out and graded, which can
be costly for the comfort.  Here and there some plants have managed to
grow in the stones, and yet again people must walk and pull the weeds
out, because sooner or later nature would reclaim this path.  The
white road can be seen for a long distance, travelling in a straight
line within the grassy plains of the Istar Sea.  Eastwards the city of
Torregiano can be seen, its massive walls julting upwards far above
the grass, or the massive cannon which sits above the city.  Westwards
the road heads towards the Vectorian Empire, and Makou City.
27136.name: {BThe {RS{routh {BI{bstar {7R{&o{*adw{&a{7y{x

description: Large massive engines stand in the middle of the room, workers
slowly peicing together the parts of the engine themselves.  All the
common and public engines and parts are spread out through this hangar
workshop.  To the east is the public hull shop, and to the north is
the non public engine shop.
27991.name: Public Engine Development

description: You enter a smoked filled room, and no its not on fire.  Several workers
sit around a table, playing cards, and betting there wages.  Along the
walls, you see some others, sleeping on the benches or sitting, relaxing.
The walls in here look like there where once white, but have a yellow look
to them.  You see a chart with names on it, and the days of the week.  On
another wall you see a poster for the factory, and next to it a punch clock.
A whistle blows, and some of the men stand up and leave, and some more men
come in, and sit down.  There are doors all around you.
27257.name: Brewery Workers Break Area

description: You stand on the Steps of the Church Of Nightmares.  Some local
children are here playing on them.  Before you stands a church, made
from the blackest stone in the world.  A large stained glass window
looms above the front doors, and under the steeple, made from the
darkest glass possible, almost totally black.
27280.name: On The Steps Of The Church

description: The room is totally glassed in, except for the ceiling.  Desks,
papers and all kind of equipment surround the control area.  The
windows overlook the entire port.  The staircase leads down.
27093.name: Port Judge Control Tower

description: A small roadway makes it way off the Main Roads of the port to the
outter security road around the complex.  Directly west is the West
Access Road, and the Western Gate.
27390.name: {*-{&[{CP{cort {RT{rorregiano {CP{crivate {CH{cangars{&]{*- {x[{mWEST{x]

description: {x
| {GACSC {RPort Torregiano{x  | |

| |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  | {GG{x: {gTemporary/Guest Parking{x    |
27764.name: Above Port Torregiano [Tower 8]

description: You enter the guild.  Within you find a very large gym, where many
diffrent types of training equipment and practising things stand around the
gym.  The floor is covered in soft mat, which is used for when you train
with your guildmaster.  The master, sits on a stool in the corner, watching
you.  The walls are covered in mirrors, and the ceiling has Makou Gas lights
hanging down from it
27459.name: Ranger's Guild

description: {x
{x    {*M   {x{x{x    The air is heavy with salt coming off the Istar Sea to the
{x  {g//{G@{g\\{x   north, and the Legion Harbor.  The houses and apartments
{x  {g<{G@@@{g>{x   around this neighborhood are poor looking, but not as poor
{x  {g\\{G@{g//{x   as the slums.  The smell of fish also hangs in the air, as
{x    {*U   {x{x{x  most people living here work in the Sea Port and fish the
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  Istar Sea.  To the south behind the homes and buildings
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  stand the Torregiano Battle Gardens, famed battle arena of
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  the city.
{x    {c|{x
{GA{gvenue                                                            {GA{gvenue{x
28507.name: {G[{RW{&estbridge {GA{gvenue{G]{x

description: Under the Makou Reactor directly above the southern gates of
Torregiano is the security check point.  A large iron gate spreads
across the opening, and five smaller turn-style gates stand.
Torregiano Guards watch over the people entering and leaving the city,
for illegal items that are against City Law.  To the south is the iron
gates of Torregiano, and to the north is Torregiano Square, and Main
Street.
26725.name: The {RT{rorregiano {MS{mecurity {GC{gheckpoint{x

description: {x
{R6{&-#-{!A       {!A {*-{7 Port Control

Massive glass windows overlook the port outside, as the airships of
the Great Realms move back and forth on the tarmack, doing their daily
jobs.  Port Torregiano is one of the largest airships ports in the
Great Realms, since the Tripower and Torregiano was the home of the
original airships.  Passangers and workers walk up and down this giant
lobby which runs along the outside of the port tarmack.  Signs hang
down from the ceiling pointing out locations.
28154.name: The Port Torregiano Lobby [South]

description: Nothing but air.  To the west is the Legionnaire Bridge, below,
The Harbor.
{x
28598.name: {BThe {ME{mast {CS{cide {RH{rarbor {RB{rridge {GJ{gum{Gp{x

description: This corner of the building opens up into a large lounge.  A quiet
area of nothing but chairs and magazines is here.  A row of chairs
line the outter wall of the room, and a large long couch thing in the
middle.  Magazines are scattered around the room, and the waiting
passangers wait for their airship to be called.
27147.name: Port Lounge [Waiting Room]

description: The Access Road insects with a few other roads.  To the south is
the Northern Access Road Extension, which connects to the Northern
Airship Road and the main airship run.  To the east and west is the
North Acess Road.  To the north is the tunnel leading to the North
Gate of the Airship Port.
27376.name: {RNorth {CP{cort {RT{rorregiano {CI{cntersection{x

description: {x
{x    {*M   {x{x{x     A large boulevard stretches to the north and south through the
{x  {g//{G@{g\\{x   southwest side of Torregiano, named after one of the greatest
{x  {g<{G@@@{g>{x   inventions of the empire's.  On either side moderate sized one or two
{x  {g\\{G@{g//{x   story houses dot the sides of the boulevard, and the area is submerged
{x    {*U   {x{x{x  with the sounds of active daily life, of those who live in this lower
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  middle class neighborhood.  Eastwards the taller buildings of Downtown
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  Torregiano can be seen, and the obvious presence of the Makou Cannon
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  above looms.
{x    {c|{x
{GB{goulevard{x                                                         {GB{goulevard{x
28806.name: {G[{YA{yirship {GB{goulevard{G]{x

description: You stand in a large room, on either side of you are desks, lined up,
with people working behind them.  This is the office area of the brewery.
On the walls, you see charts and posters hanging, supporting the whole
place.  To the east, a large iron door leads farther into the factory.
27252.name: The Offices Of Anarchist Brewers

27572.name: The Main Barrel of Stalin's Organ

description: You have entered the Clothing shop Shirts pants and other articals
of clothing are on display here before they shop keeper.  Some of the
shirts look like band shirts while others look lik enice dress shirts
pants range from punk plaid pants to a nice pair of slacks.  There is
even a tailor on the premises
27907.name: Clothing Store

description: [ Lesson Three: Navigation ]
{x
{x  You may want to do a few things to see where you are going
with your airship.  A PORTHOLE is an object you can look into,
to see the outside.  Type PORTHOLE in the room you wish to add
a porthole to.  Type LOOK IN PORTHOLE to see outside the ship.
Also any movement outside will be seen.
{x
{x  The COMPASS command will allow you to see available room
exits, and the names of the rooms.
{x
{x  Airships mainly fly around in the "AIR" zone, which excists
above the entire mud.  This is a large area that is 60 rooms
wide, and 50 rooms long.  There is a coordinates system setup
to help you navigate.  There is also "Trade Routes" which help
you navigate from town to town.  There are also maps available.
{x
{x  You cannot see outside in the dark, with your airship.  Your
airship is equiped with lights, which you can toggle on and off
by typing NAVLIGHT.
28193.name: The Airship Driving School

description: Nothing but air.  To the north is the Legionnaire Bridge, below,
The Harbor.
{x
28577.name: {BThe {rS{Routh {CS{cide {RH{rarbor {RB{rridge {GJ{gum{Gp{x

description: UGH!!!!  This is an incredibly dingy hotel room.  The first thing that
reaches the attention of the person entering this room is the horrible
smell.  Next comes the poor lighting and the dirt on every surface...
YUCK!!!  As the new arrival begins to become accustomed to the filth,
several other problems become apparent.  There is no window in this room,
and the bed looks almost less comfortable than the bare floor of this room.
Ah, well...
27302.name: Room {!One{0

description: Before you stands a pair of large, iron and wood gates.  The gates
look big enough to fit a large dragon through it.  The gates stand,
holding the contents of Torregiano within.  Above it stands one of the
many Makou Reactors of the city.  Two guards, dressed in military
uniforms of the Tripower stand on either side of the gate, staring at
the people approaching the gates.  You look at the iron and rock wall
that outstretches to either side of you, curving inwards, giving the
city a circular wall.  You notice right before the gates a large metal
strip that is splitting the ground between the city and the city.  The
strip seems to follow the wall, about a foot outwards all the way to
either side of you.  Behind you is the highway that brought you here,
and the northern plains of the TriPower country.
26511.name: The {&G{*ate{&s {Bof {RT{rorregiano{x

description: {x
{x            The drone of machines running almost drown out the sounds      {*M
{x           of life in this neighborhood, as this area can be known as    {g//{G@{g\\
{x           Zone of Torregiano, factories spewing forth coal dust and     {g<{G@@@{g>
{x           dirt, but luckly the city has created a tunnel underground    {g\\{G@{g//
{x           which pipes all the smoke away from the city, only leaving      {*U
{x           the constant noise of work.  On either side slum homes and      {c|
{x           shacks line the sides of the street.                            {c|
{x                                                                           {c|
{x                                                                           {c|
{GB{goulevard                                                         {GB{goulevard{x
28706.name: {*[{GM{gakou {GB{goulevard{*]{x

description: Several people stand behind a small window.  People line up infront of
each window waiting to place there bet.  The room is filled with people, the
walls are covered in posters.  On one wall you see a large chart, with
people who are fighting and the odds of winning.
27451.name: The Betting Booth

description: You are now on the second floor.  To the east the doors have opened, and
you can see a small hall way with three small rooms on the sides of the
halls.
27207.name: Elevator

description: You are walking in the second floor of the Inn Of The Drow.  To either
side of you is a door.  To the west is room number one, and to the east is
room number two.
27245.name: Inn Of The Drow: Second Story

description: {x
{x    Moderate sized houses standing about one or two stories tall stand on   {*M
{x on either side of the southwest boulevard in Torregiano, named after one {g//{G@{g\\
{x of the Empire's greatest inventions to this world.  The cobble stone     {g<{G@@@{g>
{x street runs north to south, with sidewalks in the side giving way to     {g\\{G@{g//
{x citizen traffic, as the main cobble stone boulevard is mostly used for     {*U
{x airship travel.  The sounds of lower middle class life echo around in      {c|
{x this southwest neighborhood, only a dull roar to the greater sounds        {c|
{x found in Downtown Torregiano, which its tall buildings can be seen         {c|
{x east.                                                                      {c|
{GB{goulevard{x                                                         {GB{goulevard{x
28805.name: {G[{YA{yirship {GB{goulevard{G]{x

description: {x
{x    {*M   {x{x{x    Small pieces of trash blow around along this boulevard,
{x  {g//{G@{g\\{x   named after the greatest invention of the city, sadly the
{x  {g<{G@@@{g>{x   name of the street doesn't reflect the greatness.  On either
{x  {g\\{G@{g//{x   side shacks and poor looking homes sit as this is known as
{x    {*U   {x{x{x  the bad neighborhoods of Torregiano, the slums, sitting just
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  west of the Industrial Zones.  The sounds of daily life echo
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  around, but also are droned out by the sounds of machines
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  constantly running from the factories to the east.
{x    {c|{x
{GB{goulevard                                                         {GB{goulevard{x
28705.name: {*[{GM{gakou {GB{goulevard{*]{x

description: A small indoor hangar stands here, big enough for a couple of
airships to fit in.  A few glowing orbs float above, giving off just
enough light to see around the area.  A small workbench is built into
the wall, with a few tools scattered on it.
28243.name: {CP{crivate {CD{cock {m[{C7{m]{x

description: A small building stands north in front of the Battle Gardens, a
sign hanging overhead reads Ticket Office.  The Ticket Office is the
place to go to purchase tickets to any events in the city of
Torregiano, be it at the Battle Gardens or not.  South an entrance
leaders into a Train Station, to allow easy access to events at the
arena, for people out of town.  Hilp Avenue continues to the east and
west.  Its also known as the party area of the city, always filled at
night with the younger crowds of people coming out, to hand in the
clubs.  North of the street is the Torregiano Battle Gardens, home to
the battle arenas of the city.  To the south stands Kalilyn Park, the
only major area of nature found inside the city, besides people's
front lawns in the neighborhoods.
28931.name: {G[{GH{gilp {GA{gvenue{G]{x

description: This room is decorated with ragged posters and colorful graffiti
across the walls.  Heifong's trendiest teens come here to shop for the
latest rebellious fashions.  The clothing is displayed simply; either
folded in stacks along the wall, or hanging from metal racks near the
back.
27809.name: {YTeen Department{x

description: {x
{Y  ##      {xA massive iron tunnel cuts through the underbelly of     {Y# #
{Y ### #  {xthe city itself.  Far above massive iron beams hold the  {Y# ###
{Y #####  {xceiling, which only a couple feet above is Main Street   {Y#####
{y\{r+---+{y/ {xTorregiano.  The tunnel stretches north towards the Sea {y\{r+---+{y/
{y\   /  {xPort of Torregiano, a massive iron island that stretches {y\   /
{y\_/   {xnorth away from the city into the Sea of Istar.  Large    {y\_/
{y|    {xtorches on the sidewalls light the way, only a bright      {y|
{y|    {xlight shines to the north, at the end of the tunnel.       {y|
27421.name: {B[{&T{*he {RP{rort {RT{runnel {&O{*f {RTo{rrregia{Rno{B]{x

description: You stand in a large hall.  To the south, a small stage stands, with a
long table against it.  A large logo hands behind the table, that of a fist
and hammer...  Must be a union job here.  On the main floor, row after row
of folding chairs rest in place.
27259.name: Brewery Workers Meeting Hall

description: Add this in later.
27650.name: Announcer's Booth

{x    {*M   {x{x{x    Large stone walls make up either side of the avenue, and
{x  {g//{G@{g\\{x   the sound of machinery running is almost deafening to people
{x  {g<{G@@@{g>{x   walking around in this area.  This is the Shire Avenue, home
{x  {g\\{G@{g//{x   to the Torregiano Industrial Zone.  To the north and south
{x    {*U   {x{x{x  stand factories and other facilities, with only a random
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  building of residents.  The street has trash blowing around,
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  but no smoke comes from the factories, all the smoke stacks

{x    {c|{x

had your airship "towed" with the Automatic Repair option, then
your airship will appear here.  It will take several ticks for the
repair crew to complete its repair, in which time the ship will be
dropped off and ready to fly once again.  There are doorways to the
east and west.

{x                                                                           {c|
28174.name: {*[{CS{chire {GA{gvenue{*]{x

description: {x
{&||=====||{x   A large ladder stretches up the side of the massive iron
{&||     ||{x tower.  The tower stretches up to the top of the tower, a
{&||=====||{x possible fifteen stories above the bridge.  Far below under
{&||     ||{x the bridge is the Sea Port of Torregiano, and the waters of
{&||=====||{x the Sea of Istar.  Airships and boats dock at the five
{&||     ||{x massive piers in the sea port.  An unsure footing on this
{&||=====||{x ladder might cause a nasty spill.
28569.name: {RH{rarbor {RB{rridge {ME{mast {CA{cccess {CL{cadder{x

description: You stand outside one of the four Torregiano Makou Reactors.  Above you,
a large tower of metal stands, creating the makou gas that powers the city.
A strange, deep green glow hovers above the reactor.  The side of the
reactor is painted with a large, unknown symbol.  Under the symbol its
number stands in large letters.  The sound of machinery echos from within
the walls.  A large iron gate stands here, keeping you away.
27600.name: Outside Torregiano Reactor #3

description: This small, nondescript room is unremarkable..  But that seems to be the
whole point.  The walls are bare grey stone, and the floor the same,
although it has been cleaned recently.  The only furnishings in the room are
the proprietor's counter, made out of polished wood, and a small Makou gas
lamp hanging from the ceiling, giving off a blindingly bright white light.
Behind the counter you notice a partially concealed entrance to another
room.  Perhaps where the shopkeeper keeps his wares, whatever those might
be..
27312.name: A Hidden Shop..

description: You notice on one of the main supports here, a large ring, filled with
spikes.  A sign hangs next to the ladder reading "TRIPOWER EMPLOYEE'S ONLY,
ALL OTHERS WILL BE SHOT".  The buildings are getting short now.  Most of the
taller ones and only a story high now, except for the TriPower Tower in the
far distance.
27405.name: Climbing The Support Tower

description: You stand in the Courtyard Of Nightmares.  The courtyard extends
out from the rear of the main building, being the actual church.  To
the north another building stands, with a watch tower high above it.
In the middle of the courtyard you see a large fountain, and the doors
to the second building.
27832.name: The Courtyard Of Nightmares (E)

description: You stand at the end of the hallway.  To either side of you is a door.
To the east you see the "CHALLENGER A's WAITING ROOM".  To the west is
"CHALLENGER A's TRAINING GYM".  The hallway continues south.
27455.name: The End Of The Hallway

description: The small booth.  A curtain hangs across the western doorway, which
hides the booth from the rest of the bar.  The walls in here are the
same as the outside.  A large red bench circles around a round table,
which is in the middle.  A single candle sits in the middle of the
table burning.  A few bottles of booze and a empty glass also is on
the table.
27029.name: A Enclosed Booth

description: {x
{yII               {x  The street turns sharply here to the east and south,
{yII  {G+---------+  {xindicating the northwest corner of the city.  Running east
{yII  {G|  {MEast   {G|  {xis The Shire Avenue, also known as the Torregiano Industral
{yII{&={*<{G+---------+  {xZone, filled with factories and facilities that support the
{yII  {G|  {CS{chire  {G|  {xpopulation of the city.  To the south is Makou Boulevard,
{yII  {G| {GA{gvenue  {G|  {xalso known as The Slums of Torregiano, in which the poor
{yII  {G+---------+  {xpeople of the city gather to at least scratch out some sort
{yII               {xof living.  Farther east past the Shire Avenue is Westbridge
{yII  {G+---------+  {xAvenue, home to the fishermen of the Istar Sea and workers
{yII  {G|  {rSouth  {G|  {xof the Sea Port of Torregiano, split by Main Street.  North
{yII{&={*<{G+---------+  {xof Main Street is the Legionaire Harbor Bridge, which runs
{yII  {G| {GM{gakou   {G|  {xabove the harbor below to the Island of Accomaxx, once home
{yII  {G|{GB{goulevard{G|  {xto the Tripower's defense The Legion, but now a part of the
{yII  {G+---------+  {xcity, home to people who do not wish to live directly in the
{yII               {xcity itself.
28608.name: {7I{&ntersection of {*[{GM{gakou{*]{& & {*[{CS{chire{*]{x
