27555.name: The Small Barrel of Stalin's Organ

description: A small indoor hangar stands here, big enough for a couple of
airships to fit in.  A few glowing orbs float above, giving off just
enough light to see around the area.  A small workbench is built into
the wall, with a few tools scattered on it.
28257.name: {CP{crivate {CD{cock {m[{C23{m]{x

description: {x
{x    {*M   {x{x{x    The sounds of middle class life echo against the walls of
{x  {g//{G@{g\\{x   the three to five story buildings, which stand together in
{x  {g<{G@@@{g>{x   a row, giving little to no space inbetween.  Children tend
{x  {g\\{G@{g//{x   to play along this Boulevard in the northeast side of the
{x    {*U   {x{x{x  city, away from the downtown area.  Behind to buildings to
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  the west, almost hidden is the Torregiano Battle Gardens,
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  home to the city's battle arena.  Above as everywhere else
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  in the city is the Makou Cannon Support Structure.
{x    {c|{x
desc
{GB{goulevard                                                          {GB{goulevard{x
28406.name: {G[{bC{*annon {GB{goulevard{G]{x

description: A large room opens up with an office full of papers.  Two large
desks stand side by side, with their backs to the windows overlooking
New Thalos Avenue.  A single chair sits in front of each desk, but
does not look like they have been in any use yet.  Shelves line the
opposite walls, compacted with books and papers, somewhat neatly
placed.  The walls contain a few paintings.
28642.name: The Offices of {RS{rtarwind {7& {CH{Bawkin{x

description: You stand in the northern part of Wall Market.  Here alot of
merchants have set up small shops in the market itself, and speak to
everyone who goes by.  You see all diffrent types of things here,
fruits, veggies, meat, weapons.  You name it, its probably here.  A
road goes off to the north leading to the Harbor Section of
Torregiano, but isn't completed yet.
27523.name: {&[{RNorth{&] {CT{che {CW{call {CM{carket {CS{cquare{x

description: A small back room leads behind the bar and to this area of the
building.  Doors stand in all directions.  To the north a doorway
leads to the staircase going to the second story.  The door to the
west reads "Bathroom" and the door south reads "Kitchen".
27732.name: Back Hallway

description: A small indoor hangar stands here, big enough for a couple of
airships to fit in.  A few glowing orbs float above, giving off just
enough light to see around the area.  A small workbench is built into
the wall, with a few tools scattered on it.
28251.name: {CP{crivate {CD{cock {m[{C13{m]{x

description: A large room opens up, filled with sports equipment and paintings
of sports events.  A large counter wraps around the northwest corner,
with a beautiful woman sitting behind it.  A few chairs line up
against the wall.  There is a door to the north, and to the east.
27708.name: {MN{mew {MT{mhalos {GA{gvenue {RG{rym {*& {&S{7pa{x

description: The room is filled wall to wall with different types and sizes of
cannon shells.  Even some antique cannons sit on shelves behind the
glass counter also containing knives and other small weapons.  This is
the ammo shop, where a person can pick up some shells to fire with his
airship.  There are common shells only available at this time.
28217.name: {CP{cort {RT{rorregiano {CC{cannon-{CA{cmmo {CS{chop{x

description: As you climb up the mountain, the forest and foothills behind you appear.
You can see farther than before, and make out Moria and other roads.
27005.name: The Mountain Road

description: {x
{x    {*M   {x{x{x     A large boulevard stretches to the north and south through the
{x  {g//{G@{g\\{x   southwest side of Torregiano, named after one of the greatest
{x  {g<{G@@@{g>{x   inventions of the empire's.  On either side moderate sized one or two
{x  {g\\{G@{g//{x   story houses dot the sides of the boulevard, and the area is submerged
{x    {*U   {x{x{x  with the sounds of active daily life, of those who live in this lower
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  middle class neighborhood.  Eastwards the taller buildings of Downtown
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  Torregiano can be seen, and the obvious presence of the Makou Cannon
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  above looms.
{x    {c|{x
{GB{goulevard{x                                                         {GB{goulevard{x
28808.name: {G[{YA{yirship {GB{goulevard{G]{x

description: You approach the docks here, a sign is posted next to it reading
"Dock A".  The dock extends way out into the Sea Of Istar, and many
merchant ships are docked on its smaller fingers.  Back south is the
warehouse section.
27276.name: {G[{BS{Ce{Ba {RP{rort {YR{yoad{G]{x

description: The room is somewhat cozy in that home feeling.  A single bed sits
in the corner, an old beat up nightstand next to it.  A dresser and a
mirror in the room, a desk and chair.  There are windows looking out
over the port, with light, white curtians on them.
27106.name: Port Judge Inn - Room 2

description: | Mob Program to Pass The Ticket Booth |
| To get into the Colliseum you must   |
| buy a ticket, which is sold 1 south  |
| of this room. If you do not have a   |
| ticket, you cannot enter. To show    |
| your ticket to the booth checker,    |
| hold your ticket (type "Hold Ticket")|
| and say ticket (in small letters) and|
| he will either let you pass or not.  |
You are shoved into a small booth, enough for one person to walk by.  A
large man, stands infront of you asking for your ticket.  (READ SIGN)
27441.name: Ticket Booth

description: {x
{x    {*M   {x{x{x    On either side of this avenue large two to four story
{x  {g//{G@{g\\{x   buildings stand, pushed up against each other with only rare
{x  {g<{G@@@{g>{x   alleys leading inbetween them.  The buildings are very clean
{x  {g\\{G@{g//{x   and fancy, reflecting the rich residents which live inside.
{x    {*U   {x{x{x  The cobble stone street stretches north to south in this
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  neighborhood of the southeast city.  Hidden behind the
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  buildings of the west is Kalilyn Park, a lush haven of
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  nature in the city.
{x    {c|{x
{GB{goulevard                                                          {GB{goulevard{x
28310.name: {G[{CLe{7gi{Bon {GB{goulevard{G]{x

description: You stand in the working area of the Brewery.  All around you men walk,
with sacks and crates of ingredients.  To either side of you, very large
towers of booze stand, you see some of the men climbing up the stairs to it,
and dropping in the contents of the sacks.  The smell of oaks and barly is
very strong around here.  A door leads off to the east.
27256.name: The Brewery Area (D)

description: Nothing but air.  To the east is the Legionnaire Bridge, below,
The Harbor.
{x
28588.name: {BThe {mW{Mest {CS{cide {RH{rarbor {RB{rridge {GJ{gum{Gp{x

description: This massive hangar has enough room to stuff a small fleet of
airships within.  This is the Tripower Industrial Hangar, personal
hangar of the Tripower Company.  There is nothing too special about
this area though, the floors are made from large stone tiles, the
walls are made from stone blocks.  There are large timber supports
holding up the ceiling.  Makou Lamps hang down by chains to help
illuminate the area.
26552.name: {r={c={C[ {RT{rri{Bp{bower {&Industrial Hangar {C]{c={r={x

description: You stand in the working area of the Brewery.  All around you men walk,
with sacks and crates of ingredients.  To either side of you, very large
towers of booze stand, you see some of the men climbing up the stairs to it,
and dropping in the contents of the sacks.  The smell of oaks and barly is
very strong around here.  The Brewer Continues eastwards.
27255.name: The Brewery Area (C)

description: A small dirt road known as West Access Road runs along here going
north and south.  The road runs along the outter fence of the complex,
for security measures.  These roads are used for the Port Employees to
move about and do their business.  The roads encircle the entire
complex to the Main Building, at the southern ends.  The roads also
connect into the main Airship Area.  Directly south is the Western
Gate and West Access Road.
27385.name: {RNorth{x-{mWest {CH{cangar {RR{road{x

Massive glass windows overlook the port outside, as the airships of
the Great Realms move back and forth on the tarmack, doing their daily
jobs.  Port Torregiano is one of the largest airships ports in the
Great Realms, since the Tripower and Torregiano was the home of the
original airships.  Passangers and workers walk up and down this giant
lobby which runs along the outside of the port tarmack.  Signs hang
down from the ceiling pointing out locations.
28168.name: Port Torregiano Lobby [Dock II]

description: {x
| {GACSC {RPort Torregiano{x  | |
| |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  | {GX{x: {gEntrace/Exit Your Location{x |
| |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  | {GG{x: {gTemporary/Guest Parking{x    |
27772.name: Above Port Torregiano

description: You walk amoung about 10 round tables.  Most of the tables are filled up
with people talking and laughing.  On each table, an umbrella comes out of
the middle, blocking the people from the sun and or anything else.  To the
west a small cafe stands, filled with people inside.
27428.name: The Outside Sitting Area

description: A large pool table stands infront of you, full size and green.  The
walls around the pool table are filled with pictures and paintings of
other famous billard players.  An ashtray sits on the corner of the
pool table.  The pool hall continues in almost all directions.
27929.name: The Backstreet Pool Hall

description: The western end of New Thalos Avenue within the Sector 7-8.  To the
west is the intersection of Makou and Airship, the western side of
Torregiano.  A small two story building stands to the north
kiddie-corner between the streets.  The front windows of the shop are
filled with books, and the sign on the window reads "{CWalden's Fine
Book Emporium{x".  To the south a small iron diner stands, an eatery on
the west side of Torregiano.  The glowing sign outside reads "{CThe Eat
and Run{x".  The intersection of Makou and Airship is to the west, and
New Thalos Avenue continues to the east.
28940.name: {G[{MN{mew {MT{mhalos {GA{gvenue{G]{x

description: {x
{x          The Boulevard named after another invention of the               {*M
{x        Tripower Kingdom stretches north to south along the north        {g//{G@{g\\
{x        east side of the city.  The three to five story buildings        {g<{G@@@{g>
{x        along the side of the street sit together, only once in          {g\\{G@{g//
{x        awhile giving way to an alley leading behind them.  To the         {*U
{x        west stands the Torregiano Battle Gardens.  Above the cannon       {c|
{x        support structure stands, large iron gas lights hanging off        {c|
{x        of it.                                                             {c|
{x                                                                           {c|
desc
{GB{goulevard                                                          {GB{goulevard{x
28405.name: {G[{bC{*annon {GB{goulevard{G]{x

description: In the center of the warehouse stands a few larges desks, a table
and some file cabinets.  This is the business center of the cargo
warehouse here in Port Torregiano.  To the east and west are large
iron racks that stretch in either direction the length of the
warehouse.  All kinds of races work here, including some titans who
move the wooden crates with ease.
27392.name: Port Torregiano Cargo Warehouse

description: A small indoor hangar stands here, big enough for a couple of
airships to fit in.  A few glowing orbs float above, giving off just
enough light to see around the area.  A small workbench is built into
the wall, with a few tools scattered on it.
28245.name: {CP{crivate {CD{cock {m[{C8{m]{x

description: The bathroom of the main hangar....  Looks like a bathroom.  The
walls, ceiling and floor are white, there is three toilets and a sink.
That's about it.
27099.name: Bathroom

description: Nothing but air.  To the south is the Legionnaire Bridge, below,
The Harbor.
{x
28583.name: {BThe {RN{rorth {CS{cide {RH{rarbor {RB{rridge {GJ{gum{Gp{x

description: The Inn Of The Drow.  You stand in the hardwood lobby.  A large desk
stands to one side, with a few workers dressed in suits and dresses standing
behind it.  The lobby is filled with benches and chairs, and paintings.  You
see doors to the south and to the east, leading out into the city.  To the
north, a door leads into another room, you can see a stair case going up in
there.  To the west, the sounds of a lounge for drinking and socializing
echos from the door to the west.
27160.name: The Inn Of The Drow

description: {x
{x         \ Fine Home Cooking & Airship Repairs /
{x         \ Inn Rooms, Horse & Chocobo Stables  /
{x             /----Airship----Bar & Inn----\
{x             \----Repairs----and Goods----/
You enter the guild.  Within you find a very large gym, where many
diffrent types of training equipment and practising things stand around the
gym.  The floor is covered in soft mat, which is used for when you train
with your guildmaster.  The master, sits on a stool in the corner, watching
you.  The walls are covered in mirrors, and the ceiling has Makou Gas lights
hanging down from it.
27453.name: The Druid's Guild

description: Now you are on the third floor.  The elevator once again opens to the
east, and looking down the hallway you see that this area looks quite a lot
nicer than the rooms you were just at.
27212.name: Elevator

description: {x
{x           The smell of salt and fish hangs in the air, mostly coming      {*M
{x         from some dead fish hanging from hooks on the sides of the      {g//{G@{g\\
{x         homes and apartments which line this street.  The avenue is     {g<{G@@@{g>
{x         named after the famous city of Westbridge, and is home to       {g\\{G@{g//
{x         the fishermen of the Istar Sea, and workers of the Sea Port       {*U
{x         of Torrregiano.  To the south behind the homes stands the         {c|
{x         Torregiano Battle Gardens, and to the north and below stands      {c|
{x         the Tripower's Legion Base, home to the kingdom's defense.        {c|
{x                                                                           {c|
{GA{gvenue                                                            {GA{gvenue{x
28506.name: {G[{RW{&estbridge {GA{gvenue{G]{x

description: "{CPip's Party Favors{x" stands to the north in a three story building.
The shop is known for having novelty items for parties.  The front
windows of the shop is filled with paper plates, cups, hats and party
items.  To the south is a small herbable store known as "{CBox of Rain{x".
New Thalos Avenue continues to the west in the Sector 7-8, and east
into Sector 9.
28939.name: {G[{MN{mew {MT{mhalos {GA{gvenue{G]{x

description: Nothing but air.  To the west is the Legionnaire Bridge, below,
The Harbor.
{x
28595.name: {BThe {ME{mast {CS{cide {RH{rarbor {RB{rridge {GJ{gum{Gp{x

description: You are standing in the living room of a pretty good-sized home.  It
seems pretty clean and tidy, And would be considered suitable living.
27800.name: A Large house

Massive glass windows overlook the port outside, as the airships of
the Great Realms move back and forth on the tarmack, doing their daily
jobs.  Port Torregiano is one of the largest airships ports in the
Great Realms, since the Tripower and Torregiano was the home of the
original airships.  Passangers and workers walk up and down this giant
lobby which runs along the outside of the port tarmack.  Signs hang
down from the ceiling pointing out locations.
28165.name: The Port Torregiano Lobby [South]

description: The Sea Valley can be viewed from here.  To the northeast a city can be
seen, with large walls.  To the north a large road travles north off into
the distance.  A large forest is to the northwest.
27010.name: The Mountain Road

description: Behind the counter sits a large man with several shiny keys on it.  He is
a fairly tall human, who looks like the inn is making him a fait amount of
money.  Looking toward the south you see the enterance, looking west you see
a hallway leading to an elevator, and to the east you see a a fairly small
reception area.
27202.name: Front Counter

description: The smell of food is strong from the westside of the street.  To
the west you see a large expensive cafe, with a patio sitting right
next to the sidewalk.  "{CThe Main Street Cafe{x" is one of the better
places to eat in this town, or so does it say under the cafe's sign.
A few people sit inside, eating, drinking, laughing their cares away.
The building to the east is not too fancy.  A stoop outside leads up
to the door, which inside is the "{CMakou Gas Company{x".  Main Street
continues to the north in Sector 9, to the south is the TriPower
Plaza.
28918.name: {C>{c-{C>{RT{C<{c-{G[ {RM{rain {GS{gtreet {G]{c-{C>{BP{C<{c-{C<{x

description: {x
{x             Cobble stone stretches to the east and west, making up        {*M
{x           what is known as Camelot Avenue, named after a city to the    {g//{G@{g\\
{x           south.  The homes along this avenue are large, standing       {g<{G@@@{g>
{x           from two to three stories tall, reflecting their rich         {g\\{G@{g//
{x           owners inside.  Kalilyn Park stands behind the homes to         {*U
{x           the north, a rich natural haven within the city.  Life of       {c|
{x           the rich goes on as usual in this area, giving a false          {c|
{x           sense to what the rest of the city look like.                   {c|
{x                                                                           {c|

28203.name: {G[{RCa{Ymel{Rot {GA{gvenue{G]{x

description: Its walls are made out of the same, black rock the church was.  The
ceiling is high, and the rafters of roof are exposed.  All around you,
everything is draped in darkness.  The windows glare out the light of
the city, through its black glass.  There is a pew here for praying,
facing north, to the throne in front of the church.
27828.name: Western Seating Of The Church

description: You are in a tiny store.  The counter takes up most the room filled will
gems and jewlry.  A small man stands behind that counter apraising gems of
all sorts.  {GGreen{x and {BBlue{x colors glitter from the gems in the room
making it look like a prism.
27508.name: A Gem Shop

description: You are in the small lobby of this housing complex.  It seems to be nice
and well kept, but certanly not the most luxurious place you seen.  Small
plants fill the lobby and an elevator is near with a locked gate.
27502.name: Lobby Of ZoZo Hights

description: A large pool table stands infront of you, full size and green.  The
walls around the pool table are filled with pictures and paintings of
other famous billard players.  An ashtray sits on the corner of the
pool table.  The pool hall continues in almost all directions.
27933.name: The Backstreet Pool Hall

description: At the top of these stairs there are two doors inbeeded into the
brick of the surrounding the building.  To the west is large iron door
stands, with a single slot at eye height for someone to look out of.
To the north stands a wooden door with a large window, blocked by a
peice of leather.  The glass on the door reads | Starwind & Hawkins |
28636.name: Entranceway

description: A large hallway extends to the east and west between two doors on
either end, brightly lit up by an exit sign.  On either side of the
hallway is a single door with a white blurred window going into
another room of the building.  The hallway continues this east and
west.  On the walls are varies pictures and plaques of the port.
27721.name: The Office of the TPAA

description: A large structure reaches out from the port building, and large
rings hang off the metal structure to allow airships to dock here.
These Gate Towers are used for overnight parking.  Airships cannot
remained here park for months on end.  DOWN is the Port Tarmack, and
south is the PORT BUILDING.
28179.name: {CP{cort {RT{rorregiano {GG{gate {RT{rower {x[{BIV{x]

description: You walk into a shop, filled with all kinds of diffrent armor.  Chain
Mail, Leather, Iron, you name it, they have it.  The floor of the shop is
well kept, for all the metal going by.  To wall to the north is covered in
torso armor, gauntlets and leggins.  The wall to the south is covered in
helmets and other.  A hairy looking man stands behind the counter custom
fitting a peice of armor, he loosk up at you.
27434.name: The Torregiano Armory

description: You stand in the second floor hallway of the Deil Inc building.  To the
north you hear loud singing, and glass against glass.  To the south you see
a door with a picture of an airship and some metal.  The hallway is made
from that same old black marble too.
27226.name: (Deil Inc) 2st Floor Hallway

description: {x
{x  The cobble stone of the avenue stretches to the east and west,           {*M
{x lined with iron makou gas lamps, which at night give off a strange      {g//{G@{g\\
{x green glow, giving the city an odd look during the nighttime.  On       {g<{G@@@{g>
{x either side large two or three story homes stand, prepped and clean     {g\\{G@{g//
{x compared to other neighborhoods in this city, only a piece of trash       {*U
{x floats about in the streets from time to time.  It is somewhat quiet      {c|
{x around here, compared to the dull road of the downtown area, or even      {c|
{x more so the industrial area in the northwest side.  As seen all over      {c|
{x the city, the support structure of the makou cannon stands above.         {c|
28106.name: {G[{bZ{ro{bZ{ro {GA{gvenue{G]{x

description: A large city is in view.  You see a large 20 foot stone wall
surrounding the whole city.  In this corner a large building has been
built into the wall, making up the corner.  The sounds of machines
working echos here.  Above the building in the corner you see steam,
and a green glow within the steam.  A long road follows the outter
wall of Torregiano north, towards Port Judge.
27017.name: {BThe {RS{routh {BI{bstar {7R{&o{*adw{&a{7y{x

description: {x
{x    {*M   {x{x{x    The avenue of cobble stone stretches to the east to the
{x  {g//{G@{g\\{x   west, along the southwest side of the city of Technology.
{x  {g<{G@@@{g>{x   Along each side past the stone sidewalks and makou gas
{x  {g\\{G@{g//{x   lights are large victorian homes, ranging from two to three
{x    {*U   {x{x{x  stories tall.  The streets are clean and well guarded, as
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  daily life of night and day continue on this avenue, far
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  away from the hustle and louder atmosphere of Downtown.
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  Numbers are carved into the sides of the sidewalk.
{x    {c|{x

27768.name: Above Port Torregiano

description: A small indoor hangar stands here, big enough for a couple of
airships to fit in.  A few glowing orbs float above, giving off just
enough light to see around the area.  A small workbench is built into
the wall, with a few tools scattered on it.
28240.name: {CP{crivate {CD{cock {m[{C1{m]{x

description: There are fairly large doors leading to the north, east, and south.  On
each door there is a brass number, which corresponds to the keys bought at
the front counter.
27208.name: Short Hallway

description: The office is bare, the walls are not even completed yet.
27194.name: Office

description: The circle continues its path around the Bar and Grill in the
center.  To the west "Hangar Number 101" stands.  The circle continues
north and south.
27072.name: Port Circle

description: Nothing but air.  To the north is the Legionnaire Bridge, below,
The Harbor.
{x
28576.name: {BThe {rS{Routh {CS{cide {RH{rarbor {RB{rridge {GJ{gum{Gp{x

description: This is an empty lot where a building may have stood.  The grass grows
healthy here and there is no trash on the ground.  You may find the
occasional neighborhood kid playing stickball or chase with his friends.  To
the west is a stone building with no windows or doors.
27703.name: An Empty Lot

description: A small dirt road known as NorthEast Access Road runs along here
going east and west.  The road runs along the outter fence of the
complex, for security measures.  These roads are used for the Port
Employees to move about and do their business.  The roads encircle the
entire complex to the Main Building, at the southern ends.  The roads
also connect into the main Airship Area.  Directly west is the
Northern Gate and North Access Road.
27375.name: {RNorth{x-{MEast {CH{cangar {RR{road{x

description: You stand in the southern part of Wall Market.  To the west you can
see a bar and the book store.  To the east you see a pawn shop and a
inn.  To the south, the southern road leads south, which isn't
completed at this time.
27524.name: {&[{rSouth{&] {CT{che {CW{call {CM{carket {CS{cquare{x

description: | To The Realms Of Vector........195m |
| To St.Plattsburg...............205m |
| To The Fortress Of Vector......215m |
The Road To The Realms Of Vector.  This road is very long, it follows the
coastline of The Sea of Istar right up to St.  Plattsburg.  A sign stands to
one side of the road (READ SIGN).  To the east you can see the walls of
Torregiano.  To the north you see a dark forest to the west and the blue
Istar sea to the east.  Two Legion Guards watch you as you walk by.
27016.name: {MThe V{mectorian Ro{Madway{x

description: {x
{x             Cobble stone stretches to the east and west, making up        {*M
{x           what is known as Camelot Avenue, named after a city to the    {g//{G@{g\\
{x           south.  The homes along this avenue are large, standing       {g<{G@@@{g>
{x           from two to three stories tall, reflecting their rich         {g\\{G@{g//

{x           by two Seconds, Sector One to the westside, and Sector Two      {*U

{x

{Y  ##      {xA massive iron tunnel cuts through the underbelly of     {Y# #

{Y #####  {xceiling, which only a couple feet above is Main Street   {Y#####

description: {x
{&||=====||{x   A large ladder stretches up the side of the massive iron
{&||     ||{x tower.  The tower stretches up to the top of the tower, a
{&||=====||{x possible fifteen stories above the bridge.  Far below under
{&||     ||{x the bridge is the Sea Port of Torregiano, and the waters of
{&||=====||{x the Sea of Istar.  Airships and boats dock at the five
{&||     ||{x massive piers in the sea port.  An unsure footing on this
{&||=====||{x ladder might cause a nasty spill.

The Harbor.
{x
28591.name: {BThe {ME{mast {CS{cide {RH{rarbor {RB{rridge {GJ{gum{Gp{x

description: A large iron balcony slightly hangs off the building overlooking
the intersection below.  To the east was New Thalos Avenue, to the
north is Makou Avenue, and south is Airship Avenue.  To the west is
the room.
27741.name: The Balcony Of Jack's Bar Room 5

27571.name: The Main Barrel of Stalin's Organ

description: You stand at the end of the hallway.  To either side of you is a door
leading into the rooms.  To the east the door reads Room Number 3, and to
the west reads Room Number 4.
27248.name: Inn Of The Drow: Second Story

description: A small indoor hangar stands here, big enough for a couple of
airships to fit in.  A few glowing orbs float above, giving off just
enough light to see around the area.  A small workbench is built into
the wall, with a few tools scattered on it.
28259.name: {CP{crivate {CD{cock {m[{C20{m]{x

description: {x
{yV{x    The {CLe{7gi{Bon{Cna{7ir{Be {RH{rarbor {RB{rridge{x is the only connection   {yV
{&|{x  between the city of {RT{rorregiano{x and the {GI{gsland{x of         {&|
{&|{x  {YAc{ycoma{Yxx{x, located just north of {RT{rorregiano{x.  The island  {&|
{&|{x  was once home to The {CLe{7gi{Bon{x, and the {ROr{rd{7er {&Of Ju{7d{rgem{&ent, {&|
{&|{x  before the {CLe{7gi{Bon{x was disbanned.  It now serves as a     {&|
{&|{x  small village, as part of the city of {RT{rorregiano{x.  The   {&|
{&|{x  bridge, built from massive stone blocks, stretches high  {&|
{*---{x above the harbor and sea port below.                    {*---{x
28562.name: {RT{rhe {CLe{7gi{Bon{Cna{7ir{Be {RH{rarbor {RB{rridge{x

description: East Seating A thunderous roar fills the stadium as you clamber to find
your seat and witness the upcoming arena match.  You see bloodstains on the
very front benches from particularly gruesome matches of the past, and you
try to find a clean patch of bench and get comfortable.  For whom will you
cheer to reign victorious over the corpse of his fallen opponent?
27445.name: East Sitting

description: The cobble stone street of Hilp Avenue continues to run its east to
west course heading into the eastern side of the city.  Its also known
as the party area of the city, always filled at night with the younger
crowds of people coming out, to hand in the clubs.  North of the
street is the Torregiano Battle Gardens, home to the battle arenas of
the city.  To the south stands Kalilyn Park, the only major area of
nature found inside the city, besides people's front lawns in the
neighborhoods.  To the north is the entrance to the Torregiano Battle
Gardens, also known as the World Battle Arena, in which different
arena matches and events take place when they come to the city.  To
the south is a lush path leading into Kalilyn Park.
28930.name: {G[{GH{gilp {GA{gvenue{G]{x

description: This is the main hangar of Port Judge, in Torregiano.  The hangar
is made from brick, and stands very tall above you.  To either side
huge wooden doors lock away airships in special storage areas.
Bay 9 is north.  Bay 10 is south.
27051.name: Eastern Main Hangar

description: {x
{** {R       Tattoos 500 platinum      {*    *{x
{x
* {!       Tattoos 500 platinum      {*    *
This small studio is littered with beautiful works of art.  Oil
paintings, charcoal sketches, water colors and ink drawings are all
displayed proudly on the walls.  The only chair in the room is propped
in a corner beneath a brightly burning makou gas torch.
27902.name: {!Raka'asha's Artistic Dermagraphics{X

description: {x
{x    {*M   {x{x{x    The air is heavy with salt coming off the Istar Sea to the
{x  {g//{G@{g\\{x   north, and the Legion Harbor.  The houses and apartments
{x  {g<{G@@@{g>{x   around this neighborhood are poor looking, but not as poor
{x  {g\\{G@{g//{x   as the slums.  The smell of fish also hangs in the air, as
{x    {*U   {x{x{x  most people living here work in the Sea Port and fish the
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  Istar Sea.  To the south behind the homes and buildings
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  stand the Torregiano Battle Gardens, famed battle arena of
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  the city.
{x    {c|{x
{GA{gvenue                                                            {GA{gvenue{x
28505.name: {G[{RW{&estbridge {GA{gvenue{G]{x

description: In the future, airship pilots will be able to transport airship
cargo to varies locations all over the realms.  The system is not open
at this time.
28215.name: Airship Cargo Transport School

description: You stand in the cozy room of the Inn.  In here are three beds lined
against the wall, for a group of travelers to sleep in.  A few chairs sit
next to the windows, and a small fireplace stands in the corner, with fresh
wood next to it.
27247.name: (Inn Of The Drow) Room Two

description: A small dirt road known as NorthWest Access Road runs along here
going east and west.  The road runs along the outter fence of the
complex, for security measures.  These roads are used for the Port
Employees to move about and do their business.  The roads encircle the
entire complex to the Main Building, at the southern ends.  The roads
also connect into the main Airship Area.
27380.name: {RNorth{x-{mWest {CH{cangar {RR{road{x

description: You enter a large building, even though this room seems very plain.
To the north a large desk with a secretary stands, she is reading one
of the magazines that is going around Torregiano, the cover reading
"Timber Maniacs".  The room has a few posters on it, and some chairs
lining the walls.  A pair of guards stands next to the door to the
north.  You notice a very strong magical aura in this building.
27191.name: TriPower Viewing Crystal Station

description: {x
{x            The drone of machines running almost drown out the sounds      {*M
{x           of life in this neighborhood, as this area can be known as    {g//{G@{g\\
{x           Zone of Torregiano, factories spewing forth coal dust and     {g<{G@@@{g>
{x           dirt, but luckly the city has created a tunnel underground    {g\\{G@{g//
{x           which pipes all the smoke away from the city, only leaving      {*U
{x           the constant noise of work.  On either side slum homes and      {c|
{x           shacks line the sides of the street.                            {c|
{x                                                                           {c|
{x                                                                           {c|
{GB{goulevard                                                         {GB{goulevard{x
28701.name: {*[{GM{gakou {GB{goulevard{*]{x

description: Inside the bar is dark and smokey.  All the seats are filled on
even the deadest of nights.  A large bar stands to the west, and
tables dot the inner bar through out.  The place looks well
established, and old.  A bartender and a waitress stand behind the
bar, and a few fellow people sit at the bar and tables.  The juke box
plays a tune.
27731.name: {RJ{rack's {RB{rar{x

27573.name: The Main Barrel of Stalin's Organ

description: {x
{x  The cobble stone of the avenue stretches to the east and west,           {*M
{x lined with iron makou gas lamps, which at night give off a strange      {g//{G@{g\\
{x green glow, giving the city an odd look during the nighttime.  On       {g<{G@@@{g>
{x either side large two or three story homes stand, prepped and clean     {g\\{G@{g//
{x compared to other neighborhoods in this city, only a piece of trash       {*U
{x floats about in the streets from time to time.  It is somewhat quiet      {c|
{x around here, compared to the dull road of the downtown area, or even      {c|
{x more so the industrial area in the northwest side.  As seen all over      {c|
{x the city, the support structure of the makou cannon stands above.         {c|
28111.name: {G[{bZ{ro{bZ{ro {GA{gvenue{G]{x

description: This roadway was originally built the Vectorian Empire as part of
its continential network, in theory a person could walk these roadways
all the way to the Figaro Kingdom on the western coast, untold miles
away.  This road served as the main trade passage between what is
known as the Northern Vectorian Tier and Southern Vectorian Tier,
divided by the Reaper Scythe mountains to the south.  Together this
once made the entire Vectorian Empire until the sucession of the
Tripower Kingdom, which ruled over the entire Southern Tier for a
period of time.  Now they only rule over these grassy plains, while
the rest of the Southern Tier is ruled by the Factions.
28435.name: {BThe {RS{routh {BI{bstar {7R{&o{*adw{&a{7y{x

description: You stand in the lobby of one of the shabbiest hostelries you have ever
seen.  The desk is littered with paper, and behind it stands a bruiser of a
man, looking decidedly unfriendly.  The security here, at least, is enough
to make this room (relatively!!!)  Safe from the crime outside, although not
enough to keep several homeless from bedding in the corners.  There is also
a shabby magician here, obviously hoping to use some of his skills in
healing to separate the local residents from their hard earned money.
27300.name: A dingy lobby

description: The NorthWest Access Road ends in this corner.  To the south is
West Access Road, which leads to the Western Gate.  To the East is
NorthWest Access Road, which leads to the Northern Gate.
27382.name: {RNorth{x-{mWest {CH{cangar {RR{road{x

description: The hallway ends here, and the stairs down is to the north.  Three
doors stand before you as part of the complex.  To the west is "Room
4".  To the east is "Room 5" and to the south is "Room 6".
27737.name: The Hallway

description: At first glance it becomes obvious that this is a shop of ill repute.
Lining the wall behind the counter is a large display case with a dizzying
array of weapons and pain-inducing devices.  The counter itself looks more
like the guard cage in a prison than anything which might be expected in a
shop, with thick iron bars seperating it from the room outside.  Obviously,
the proprietor of this shop has too much experience with weaponry not to
take precautions against it.
27306.name: Elran's instruments of death

description: [Lession 1: The Airship]
An airship is a big sailing type vessel that is built for flying
in the air.  They resemble an old scooner type boat with a blimp
holding them up.  Graphical pictures are available on the web
site (Help WWW).  On the mud, it is a moveable object which you
enter like a portal, inside will be a helm, and a bunch of rooms
that you can use for your own purpose.  They have cannons which
can be used to attack each other, they can teleport to locations,
they have engines, they use fuel, they take damage, and later on
they will go to airship-accessable areas and be used to make
platinum by transporting cargo.  As an owner you will need to
concern yourself about parts of your ship, and other things.
28187.name: The Airship Ownership School

description: A small indoor hangar stands here, big enough for a couple of
airships to fit in.  A few glowing orbs float above, giving off just
enough light to see around the area.  A small workbench is built into
the wall, with a few tools scattered on it.
28237.name: {CP{crivate {CD{cock {m[{C3{m]{x

description: You stand in the middle of the Wall Market.  Here, you can see the
cobble stone square whichs makes out the market.  Merchants and
dealers of all types walk around here, tring to sell something.  Other
people, Citizens, ignore some and some stop for business.  A large
fountain with emense beuty stands here, pouring clear water.  You can
see buildings and roads in all Directions.
27519.name: {CT{che {CW{call {CM{carket {CS{cquare{x

Massive glass windows overlook the port outside, as the airships of
the Great Realms move back and forth on the tarmack, doing their daily
jobs.  Port Torregiano is one of the largest airships ports in the
Great Realms, since the Tripower and Torregiano was the home of the
original airships.  Passangers and workers walk up and down this giant
lobby which runs along the outside of the port tarmack.  Signs hang
down from the ceiling pointing out locations.
28173.name: The Port Torregiano Lobby [S-W]

description: A small dirt road known as East Access Road runs along here going
north and south.  The road runs along the outter fence of the complex,
for security measures.  These roads are used for the Port Employees to
move about and do their business.  The roads encircle the entire
complex to the Main Building, at the southern ends.  The roads also
connect into the main Airship Area.  Directly south is the Eastern
Gate and East Access Road.
27367.name: {&[{RT{r-{BA{b-{RP{&]{B East Access Road{x

description: Before you stands a very large museum.  The outside is made from light
brown/grey brick.  In the stone is carved ""The History Torregiano Museum".
Inside alot of relics and items from the worlds past is on display for
people to view.  The courtyard is filled with shrubs and trees, a large
fountain stands in the middle of the walkway, pouring out water.
27435.name: The Courtyard To The Museum

description: {x
{x    {*M   {x{x{x    The air is heavy with salt coming off the Istar Sea to the
{x  {g//{G@{g\\{x   north, and the Legion Harbor.  The houses and apartments
{x  {g<{G@@@{g>{x   around this neighborhood are poor looking, but not as poor
{x  {g\\{G@{g//{x   as the slums.  The smell of fish also hangs in the air, as
{x    {*U   {x{x{x  most people living here work in the Sea Port and fish the
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  Istar Sea.  To the south behind the homes and buildings
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  stand the Torregiano Battle Gardens, famed battle arena of
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  the city.
{x    {c|{x
{GA{gvenue                                                            {GA{gvenue{x
28500.name: {G[{RW{&estbridge {GA{gvenue{G]{x

description: This shop is unnervingly quiet except for the sounds of rustling
pages from patrons perusing one of the many tomes that line the
bookshelves situated along the walls of this shop.  With titles
ranging from "The Cookbook of the Nine Hells" to "Inside Secrets of a
Deva", Walden's is sure to have a book for even the most finicky
reader!
27909.name: Walden's Fine Book Emporium

description: [ Lesson One: Starting & Stopping Your Airship ]
{x
{x  To start your airship, you will need to make sure your airship
has the following...ENGINES and FUEL.  Once you have engines and
fuel, within the HELM ROOM with the ignition switch, to start your
airship, you type "PUT KEY IGNITION".  Your airship will startup.
From this point you may move around, and or teleport.
{x
{x  To turn off your airship, type "GET KEY IGNITION".
{x
Move 1 Room Down For Moving Your Airship.
28191.name: The Airship Driving School

description: A large hallway extends to the east and west between two doors on
either end, brightly lit up by an exit sign.  On either side of the
hallway is a single door with a white blurred window going into
another room of the building.  The hallway continues this east and
west.  On the walls are varies pictures and plaques of the port.
[North] Port Authority Manager's Office
[South] Port Torregiano Meeting Hall
[Up] Port Control Room & Port Manager's Office
27724.name: 2nd Floor Hallway

description: You have walked into the West Wing of the colliseum.  Before you stands a
long hallway going down, doors on each side.  The hallway is filled with
diffrent people, walking in either direction.  People walk in and out of
each door.  The door to the west reads "WARRIOR'S GUILD".
27447.name: The West Colliseum Wing

description: The whole shop is filled with dust and debree.  A man, stands in a pair
of pants, bangs away on a red hot peice of metal.  In the shop, you see
several furnices, giving off a dark green glow.  Around the furnice area is
a ton of tools, all hanging down from the ceiling.  A workbench and a anvail
stand infront of the furnice.  Around the room, you see diffrent metal
things.  A peice of armor, still rough.  A wall filled with horse shoes, all
diffrent kinds.
27430.name: Smokey Joe's Blacksmith

description: A large structure reaches out from the port building, and large
rings hang off the metal structure to allow airships to dock here.
These Gate Towers are used for overnight parking.  Airships cannot
remained here park for months on end.  DOWN is the Port Tarmack, and
south is the PORT BUILDING.

{x    Moderate sized houses standing about one or two stories tall stand on   {*M
{x on either side of the southwest boulevard in Torregiano, named after one {g//{G@{g\\
{x of the Empire's greatest inventions to this world.  The cobble stone     {g<{G@@@{g>
{x street runs north to south, with sidewalks in the side giving way to     {g\\{G@{g//
{x citizen traffic, as the main cobble stone boulevard is mostly used for     {*U
{x airship travel.  The sounds of lower middle class life echo around in      {c|
{x this southwest neighborhood, only a dull roar to the greater sounds        {c|

{x east.                                                                      {c|

28801.name: {G[{YA{yirship {GB{goulevard{G]{x

description: You stand on top of the great mountain range, on a bluff,
overlooking the grass filled plains of the valley floor below.  In the
valley you can see the Istar see off in the distance, and the only
road to Vector.  To the far east, you see a few huts, and alot of
burnt ground.  Dotting the fields below are small farms and houses.
To the far east you see a road going towards the Chain Islands.  Then
to the northeast, you see the work of Nisstyre, the greatest city in
the Great Realms, or at least some say.  Torregiano looms in the
distance, the sky above it seems to be darken, almost like Torregiano
was in eternal darkness.  In the four corners of the city, the large
Makou Reactors run, giving off a deep green glow over the whole city.
Within the walls, the three support tracks of the great Makou Cannon
is very visable from here, and the TriPower Complex Tower.  You follow
the roads, tracing one back to the east through a mountain pass, and
into the road that is between Westbridge and New Thalos.  You see in
the middle of the mountain pass, construction of some sort going on.
To the south, you take in the older land's view.  The Dwarven Kingdom,
Polaris, New Thalos, The Sands Of Sorrow, Westbridge, the Mages Tower,
the Wyrven tower, and all the other sites of what is know as "The Old
World".  To the north, the future, the "New World" stands before you.
27282.name: The Torregiano Bluff

description: The intersection of Main Street, Shire Avenue and Westbridge Avenue
at the northern end of Torregiano.  This is between Sector 5 to the
east, and Sector 6 to the west.  The northern districts of Torregiano
is more of the industrial zone, a dirty high crime area.  To the west
on Shire Avenue you see a long road leading down an industrial zone.
Many warehouses and factories line the side of that street, even a few
apartment buildings....  To the east is Westbridge Avenue, a low class
residential area made up of most of the fishermen crowd, from the
port.  South is Main Street running between Sectors 5 and 6, and going
into the rich Sector 9.
28508.name: {*[{CS{chire{*] {7- {G[{RM{rain{G] {7- {G[{RW{&estbridge{G]

description: You enter into a New Age store decorated with many various surreal
artworks, but what catches your eye is the large mural of a marijuana leaf
that covers the entire back wall.  There are many shelves of books covering
a wide variety of topics.  There are also several shelves with jewelry made
of hemp.  There is an entire wall devoted to hookas and bongs, along with
many quite interesting pipes.
27709.name: Box of Rain

description: {x
{yV{x    The {CLe{7gi{Bon{Cna{7ir{Be {RH{rarbor {RB{rridge{x is the only connection   {yV
{&|{x  between the city of {RT{rorregiano{x and the {GI{gsland{x of         {&|

person about to go into the arena to heal and wait.  A large table stands in
the middle of the room for the challenger to sit on, or lay on.  Lockers
line the wall for the challenger to put things into, before the fight.  A
large iron door stands to the west, leading into the arena.

{x  A massive door opens up to the north leading out to the airship
parking field.  The room is open with a high ceiling, big enough
for a couple of airships to be parked inside.  The air is heavy
with the smell of oil, grease and makou fuel, a strench that could
not be covered except for a good cleaning.  The entire dock area is
scattered with the parts of airships, engines, iron hull plates,
and cables.  From the ceiling several hooked chains hang on pulley
systems, so they can move about the room on their iron girders.
One wall is built as a large system of shelves, which are packed
full with oily and greasy parts.  Another wall is covered in tools.
{x
Type REPAIR HELP to learn how to repair your airship yourself.
28231.name: {CP{cort {RT{rorregiano {YA{yirship {YR{yepair {YD{yock{x

description: You are on a dusty trail winding its way east-west between huge,
ancient trees that stand close on all sides.  Not a sound is to be
heard - everything is ominously quiet.
27808.name: Narrow trail through the forest

description: A massive tunnel runs off north into the distance, big enough for
several airships to run side by side.  Dim gas lights bring light all
the way down, but mostly the tunnel disappears into the darkness.  To
the west is the development area of the Airship Testing Facility.  To
the east is the Control Room and offices of the ATF.
27968.name: The A.T.F. -> STARTING LINE <-

description: {x
| {GACSC {RPort Torregiano{x  | |

27776.name: Above Port Torregiano [Tower 2]

description: {x
{&||=====||{x   A large ladder stretches up the side of the massive iron
{&||     ||{x tower.  The tower stretches up to the top of the tower, a
{&||=====||{x possible fifteen stories above the bridge.  Far below under
{&||     ||{x the bridge is the Sea Port of Torregiano, and the waters of
{&||=====||{x the Sea of Istar.  Airships and boats dock at the five
{&||     ||{x massive piers in the sea port.  An unsure footing on this
{&||=====||{x ladder might cause a nasty spill.
28565.name: {RH{rarbor {RB{rridge {mW{Mest {CA{cccess {CL{cadder{x

description: The Bar and Grill of this fine establishment.  The inside of the
grill has a nice, home feeling to it.  Also run down and poor, like a
truck stop.  The room is filled with tables, waitresses walk around
selling the food which the Owner/Bartender/Innkeeper Gillian is
grilling on the other side of the bar.  A juke box plays in the
corner, and people enjoy there stop.  The Inn part is to the south.
27100.name: {&The {YP{yor{Yt {RJu{rd{Rge {YB{yar {&& {RG{rril{Rl{x

description: The roadway comes very close to the Istar Sea, and someday may even
erode into it.  Just northn The roadway comes very close to the Istar
Sea, and someday may even erode into it.  Just north of the well
groomed path lies the shoreline, as the sea cuts inwards to create a
small bay near here.  The South Istar Roadway continues east towards
Torregiano and west towards the road to Vector.
28436.name: {BThe {RS{routh {BI{bstar {7R{&o{*adw{&a{7y{x

description: This is a *small* but clean room.  The window admits welcome light and
fresh air into the room, and the walls tile and floors all look freshly
scrubbed.  The only thing detracting from this room is the lack OF room.  It
is hard to get to maneuver through the narrow walkway between the bed and
the wall, and there is no place to sit but on the bed.  It's a good thing the
bed looks so comfortable, because that is probably where you are going to be
spending ALL your time in this room.
27304.name: room {^three{0

description: The road turns away from the forest, and beings to travel into the
highlands.  Some animals are heard, running around in the woods, hiting a
bush.  Some birds fly away.
27002.name: The Mountain Road

description: You walk into a room with large posters covering the walls.  Many are of
strange places you have probably never seen.  There are many photo's of
troops in battle along the walls.  There is a large portrait of the current
Marshal, Malachus.  The door to the west is marked OOJ Dept.  A man in a
Legion uniform wearing Seargent's Stripes is sitting at a desk.
27704.name: The Legion Recruitment Office

description: Nothing but air.  To the south is the Legionnaire Bridge, below,
The Harbor.
{x
28582.name: {BThe {RN{rorth {CS{cide {RH{rarbor {RB{rridge {GJ{gum{Gp{x

description: Welcome to the Torregiano Cigar Shop.  The owner greets you as you enter.
On the walls you see shelf after shelf of cigars.  All kinds of diffrent
brands.  Many boxes on each shelves, some open, some closed.  The small of
tobacco fills the room.  You see alot of posters on the wall of diffret
cigar types.  On the west wall, you see a shelf not filled with cigars, but
bricks of a deep green type of tobacco...  If that is what it is.
27420.name: Torregiano Cigar Shop

description: The cobble stone of the northern sectors continue north and south.
Main Street Torregiano runs through the whole center of the city,
going near the TriPower Complex Tower.  To the east and west both
stand small two story buildings.  The upper floors look like
apartments.  To the west the "{CSunglass Hut{x" stands, selling shades to
the tourist of the city.  To the east the windows of that story is
filled with religious items.  The cross shaped sign on the door reads
"{CReligious Supply Store{x".  Main Street continues north and south.
28923.name: {C>{c-{C>{RT{C<{c-{G[ {RM{rain {GS{gtreet {G]{c-{C>{BP{C<{c-{C<{x

description: You stand outside one of the four Torregiano Makou Reactors.  Above you,
a large tower of metal stands, creating the makou gas that powers the city.
A strange, deep green glow hovers above the reactor.  The side of the
reactor is painted with a large, unknown symbol.  Under the symbol its
number stands in large letters.  The sound of machinery echos from within
the walls.  A large iron gate stands here, keeping you away.
27621.name: Outside Torregiano Reactor #1

{&||=====||{x   A large ladder stretches up the side of the massive iron

{&||     ||{x the bridge is the Sea Port of Torregiano, and the waters of
{&||=====||{x the Sea of Istar.  Airships and boats dock at the five
{&||     ||{x massive piers in the sea port.  An unsure footing on this

description: {W*{RWARNING{W*{x A sign posted alarmingly close to the road marks Ground Zero
of the Cannon Test Site.  As TriPower continues to develop the Makou Cannon,
they use this area as a testing ground.  The surrounding earth is all ripped
up and black from fire.  The wheat that normally grows has all been blasted
down.  To the east there is a small stone mound with a narrow, rectangular
window in the front. Further east can be seen a checkpoint of some kind
along the dirt road.  To the north, a grassy valley of some type opens up.
27025.name: {BThe {GE{glven {GV{galley {7R{&o{*adw{&a{7y{x

description: You walk down the hallway in Deil Inc.  Doors are to either side of you,
leading into various rooms and shops.  To the east a large stairwell curls
up to the second floor.  To the north the door reads "WBA Information
Center" and to the south reads "WBA Workout Gym".
27222.name: (Deil Inc) 1st Floor Hallway

description: NORTH: Swordfish/Hammerhead
SOUTH: Hammerheads
28083.name: UNUSED

description: A large iron gate blocks any further travel down this tunnel.  Two
guards standing on either side are keeping guard.  To the north the
tunnel continues for a little more, and opens up back into the air.
The guards glance at you up and down...  Looking for a pass.
27548.name: {&[{RT{r-{BA{b-{RP{&]{B South Security Gate{x

description: {x
{x    {*M   {x{x{x    Small pieces of trash blow around along this boulevard,
{x  {g//{G@{g\\{x   named after the greatest invention of the city, sadly the
{x  {g<{G@@@{g>{x   name of the street doesn't reflect the greatness.  On either
{x  {g\\{G@{g//{x   side shacks and poor looking homes sit as this is known as
{x    {*U   {x{x{x  the bad neighborhoods of Torregiano, the slums, sitting just
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  west of the Industrial Zones.  The sounds of daily life echo
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  around, but also are droned out by the sounds of machines
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  constantly running from the factories to the east.
{x    {c|{x
{GB{goulevard                                                         {GB{goulevard{x
28707.name: {*[{GM{gakou {GB{goulevard{*]{x

description: This large building located on the corner of Main Street & Shire
has always been a home to the Fishermen and Dock Workers who dwell
below in the Torregiano Sea-Port.  After a long day or night worth of
working, most workers find it relaxing to drop by the old Burning
Dwarf and kick back a few with their fellow co-workers.  The bar is
dark and made from deeply stained oak wood.  The bar runs along the
western wall, behind it a shelf filled all sorts of booze and spirits.
A large mirror helps reflect the alcohol and allows people sitting at
the bar, to see the activities in the main room.  The main floor is
filled with small round tables, each with a burning candle.  To the
northern side raised above the main floor is the pool table area with
several tables ready to be played.  A makou power jukebox sits behind
the tables.  The walls are covered with pictures from the city of
Torregiano, many of them showing scenes of construction work, such as
the Legionaire Harbor Bridge, Tripower Tower and the Makou Cannon
Support Structures.  Alot of memories have been made here, and alot of
broken hearts.
26726.name: {*<{&--{m> {rTh{Re B{Yur{7n{Yin{Rg Dwa{rrf{x {CB{car {M& {CG{crille {m<{&--{*>{x

description: Here is where this family sits and relaxes on the sofas and reads a book.
27801.name: the Den

description: The hangar opens up to the east and west, and continues north to
the northern end, and out to the main area.  Two long corridors
stretch to the east and west, massive tall corridors.  On either side
you see four doors, eight in all, massive wooden doors.  A metal
spiral staircase leads up into the office and lounge area.  The
northern doors lead out to the main complex of the port.
27048.name: Port Judge Main Hangar

description: You step into a very full shop, in the shop you see nothing but shoes and
boots.  Nothing but diffrent kinds of boots and shoes, diffrent designs,
diffrent sizes.  The shopkeepers look at you from behind her counter and
smiles.  Behind you is the streets of Torregiano.
27439.name: The Shoe Shop

description: [ Lesson Two: AIRDESC ]
{x
{x  The Airdesc command uses the OLC editor that builders use to
write room descriptions.  It opens a type of text editor, which
allows you to type the room description freely.  To activate the
command, type AIRDESC.  Within the edit, you just type in the
description, which will be recorded.  There are several commands
in which you can use to help you edit thing.
{x
{x.r 'old' 'new'   - replace a substring
{x                   (requires '', "")
{x.h               - Displays this information.
{x.s               - Shows description so far.
{x.f               - Formats your description to be nice.
{x.c               - Deletes everything you written or is.
{x.d               - Deletes a single line.
{x@                - Stop Editing
{x
28196.name: The Airship Cutomizing School

description: Its walls are made out of the same, black rock the church was.  The
ceiling is high, and the rafters of roof are exposed.  All around you,
everything is draped in darkness.  The windows glare out the light of
the city, through its black glass.  There is a pew here for praying,
facing north, to the throne in front of the church.
27825.name: Western Seating Of The Church

description: [South] Passages To Reactor Gates 8W, 1, 2E
27994.name: Under The Torregiano Plate [S]

description: A small man sits behind a counter, in this overly stuffed room.  A
single counter stands in front of you, and behind it stands row after
row of shelves with dusy boxes.  The room is somewhat dimly lit, and
the heavy smell of grease and buring ores hung over the room.  A
single waiting chair sits next to the bullentin board with the latest
Nudy Calandar.  A doorway to the north leads to another shop, and a
doorway to the east leads to the Weapon Forging Room.
27898.name: Port Torregiano Engine Shop

description: [Lesson Two: Firing Your Weapons]
{x
To fire your weapons, you type FIRE (Weapon Name).  The weapon
will fire, making it unable to fire again, until you either
hit a target, or miss.  After you recieve a message of either
hit or miss, you may fire again.
{x
If you purchase multiple cannons of the same name, you will use
a small alias system built into the mud.  Here is an example of
aiming multiple weapons.
{x
EXAMPLE:  Aim CANNON Target, Aim 2.CANNON Target, Aim 3.CANNON Target
{x
EXAMPLE:  Fire CANNON Target, Fire 2.CANNON Target, AIM 3.CANNON Target
28213.name: The Airship Battle School

description: The southeast corner of Port Circle.  The Bar & Grill stands to the
northwest, and the Main Port Road to the northeast.  The circle
continues north, and to the west.
27075.name: Port Circle

description: Welcome to the AIRSHIP OWNERSHIP SCHOOL, this is a special area
setup to teach you about airships.  This school is setup to explain to
you the airship system, for those who are looking to purchase an
airship, but still do not understand the system.  A system of rooms
here will explain about different parts of an airship, what they mean,
and what purpose they have.  This will NOT cover purchasing and
buying, but can be found in other schools next door.
28186.name: The Airship Ownership School

description: You enter the guild.  Within you find a very large gym, where many
diffrent types of training equipment and practising things stand around the
gym.  The floor is covered in soft mat, which is used for when you train
with your guildmaster.  The master, sits on a stool in the corner, watching
you.  The walls are covered in mirrors, and the ceiling has Makou Gas lights
hanging down from it
27461.name: Thieve's Guild

description: A small dirt road known as East Access Road runs along here going
north and south.  The road runs along the outter fence of the complex,
for security measures.  These roads are used for the Port Employees to
move about and do their business.  The roads encircle the entire
complex to the Main Building, at the southern ends.  The roads also
connect into the main Airship Area.  Directly north is the Eastern
Gate and East Access Road.
27397.name: {&[{RT{r-{BA{b-{RP{&]{B East Access Road{x

description: This building seems uncharacteristic of the rest of this section of
town.  It is in fairly good condition and there seems to be an upbeat
nature to the place.
27551.name: Mangle's Wares

description: Welcome to the Colliseum Bar.  The bar room is filled with people
enjoying drinks and cigarettes, and other things.  The bar is in two levels,
the lower level is filled with small round tables.  On the northern wall, a
large Viewing Crystal stands, showing the events of the arena fight.  On the
second level, a large bar, filled with all kinds of diffrent drinks stands,
with a really odd bartender serving drinks.
27454.name: The Colliseum Bar

description: You stand in the cozy room of the Inn.  In here are three beds lined
against the wall, for a group of travelers to sleep in.  A few chairs sit
next to the windows, and a small fireplace stands in the corner, with fresh
wood next to it.
27249.name: (Inn Of The Drow) Room Four

description: You find a small room, with a desk, a dresser with a mirror and a
bed within the room.  A single carpet lies on the floor between all
three peices of furniture.  A closet stands to one side.  Windows look
out over whatever landscape is on the side of the building.
27744.name: [Jack's Bar] Room 2

description: [Lesson 3: Your Airship Hull & Design]
{x
The term hull is used for two different systems.  At the hull
construction shop, you will find different models and designs
that you will purchase to make your airship.  Each model has
its own specifications, and can be found at HELP AIRSHIP-MANU.
{x
The second term is Hull Materia, which is what the outside of
your airship is constructive of, and how much hitpoints your
airship will have.  When you first purchase your airship, it
will have a WOODEN HULL, which is only 10,000 hitpoints.  There
are six other different types, and a max of 40,000 hitpoints.
You can "Upgrade" your hull using the "HULL" command.  Type
HULL HELP to learn how to use the command.
28189.name: The Airship Ownership School

description: What You Will Need To Buy...
{x
The first thing you will need to buy is a HULL DESIGN.  This
is the biggest part of your ship, which determines just about
all aspects of an airship.  First you need to figure out which
airship you want to buy, and what is within your price range.
To see information about airships, see Help Airship-Manufactor.
{x
When you have figured it out, type BUY (#) (Name Of Airship).
You will name your airship at this time.  After you have the
hull, next you will get the engines.
{x
Engines will determine how fast you go, the bigger the engine,
the faster you will go.  You will find a list of engines in the
Engine Construction Shop.  Each airship has its own max number
of engines.  You do not need to purchase all of these engines,
but it will harm your speed horribly.
28199.name: Airship Purchasing School

description: A lonely dirt road travels through the open expanse of the Istar
plains.  The surrounding countryside is quite flat and covered in
tall golden wild wheat.  When the wind blows, the plains ripple as
is they were liquid.  The road continues west and east.
28094.name: {BThe {GE{glven {GV{galley {7R{&o{*adw{&a{7y{x

description: You stand in the employee's bar.  This bar is like the rest of the
building, made from the same black marble, with the green makou gas lights
hanging on the wall.  A large black marble bar extends to the west, behind
it shelves filled with all diffrent kinds of drinks.  Large round tables are
thrown through-out the room.  A large stage stands to the north for after
hour entertainment.  A large Viewing Crystal stands to the eastern wall,
connected to the Arena Battles in the world.
27242.name: (Deil Inc) Employee Bar

description: {x
{x    {*M   {x{x{x    Large stone walls make up either side of the avenue, and
{x  {g//{G@{g\\{x   the sound of machinery running is almost deafening to people
{x  {g<{G@@@{g>{x   walking around in this area.  This is the Shire Avenue, home
{x  {g\\{G@{g//{x   to the Torregiano Industrial Zone.  To the north and south
{x    {*U   {x{x{x  stand factories and other facilities, with only a random
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  building of residents.  The street has trash blowing around,
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  but no smoke comes from the factories, all the smoke stacks
{x    {c|   {x{x{x  are connected to a tunnel leading out of the city.
{x    {c|{x
28604.name: {*[{CS{chire {GA{gvenue{*]{x

description: The base of the control tower.  There is nothing that much of
interest here except the metal stair case going up.
27090.name: Bottom of the Control Tower

28031.name: On Top Of Sector 9 Makou Reactor

description: You stand in the building of Deil Incorperated.  This place is a major
stronghold of technology and other things.  This business being the largest
in the world, takes pride in inventions and selling.  The only major
compition it has is the Realms Of Vector, known for there supreme merchant
skills.  As you enter the lobby a large black fountain stands in the middle,
several sprays come out from it.  The whole lobby is made from a black
marble, and on the walls hang paintings and makou gas lights.  To the east,
you see a large hallway, that seems to be very busy.
27220.name: (Deil Inc) Building Lobby

description: You stand in the Food Shop of Deil Inc.  This room is filled with Makou
Gas Stoves and a ton of those glass tubes and bottles.  Some people stand
around eating some bread, laughing for some reason.  You hear someone
exclaim that they created a bread the makes you laught, but is that the
truth?
27235.name: (Deil Inc) Food Corp.

description: A massive church built from black stone stands to the north.  It
stands three stories tall with a large stain glass window in the
front.  The bell tower rises in the front, stretching towards the sky
and Tower Structure.  This is the "{CChurch of Nightmares{x", the religion
that worships Nisstyre.  To the south stands an empty lot.  New Thalos
Avenue continues east and west.
28175.name: {G[{MN{mew {MT{mhalos {GA{gvenue{G]{x

27771.name: Above Port Torregiano [Tower 5]

description: You stand at the northern end of the TriPower Plaza.  To the north
the cobble stone of Main Street continues into the northern part of
Sector 9, and the city.  To the east TriPower Plaza continues past the
{CTorregiano Ritz{x, the five star hotel in this city.  To the west is
also the TriPower Plaza.  Leading to the western sectors.  South is
the guarded rear of the TriPower Tower Complex.
28914.name: {&-{*[ {7The {RT{rri{Bp{bower {GP{glaza {m({MN{m) {*]{&-{x

27761.name: Above Port Torregiano

description: You stand on the Warrior's Club, a club for Warriors only.  The building
is made from brown brick, and a sign saying "Warrior's Club" hangs above the
doorway.  A bouncer stands outside checking everyone's pass.
27431.name: Entrance To the Warrior's Club.

description: You are standing in the most beautyful part of the inn.  There are many
pretty paintings on the walls, and at the end of the hallway stand two
guards.  The guards stand before a large gate, with the words "Adventurer
Suite" over the gate.  If you give your pass to the guards, they will open
the gate, and let you in to paradise.
27218.name: Adventurer Hallway

description: The northeast corner of the TriPower Plaza.  To the north the side
of the Makou Gas Company stands, a few billboards hang on the outside
of the building, advertising things in the city.  To the east a large
six story building stands, known as the "{CTorregiano Ritz{x".  Many
parties and meetings take place in that famous hotel.  The TriPower
Plaza continues to the south towards the Bank and Citizen's Center, or
west to the other side of the Plaza, and North Main Street.
28915.name: {&-{*[ {7The {RT{rri{Bp{bower {GP{glaza {m({MNE{m) {*]{&-{x

description: A small indoor hangar stands here, big enough for a couple of
airships to fit in.  A few glowing orbs float above, giving off just
enough light to see around the area.  A small workbench is built into
the wall, with a few tools scattered on it.
28249.name: {CP{crivate {CD{cock {m[{C12{m]{x

description: {x
| {GACSC {RPort Torregiano{x  | |
| |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  | {GX{x: {gEntrace/Exit Your Location{x |
| |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  | {GG{x: {gTemporary/Guest Parking{x    |
27769.name: Above Port Torregiano [Tower 11]

description: A small dirt road known as West Access Road runs along here
going north and south.  The road runs along the outter fence of the
complex, for security measures.  These roads are used for the Port
Employees to move about and do their business.  The roads encircle the
entire complex to the Main Building, at the southern ends.  The roads
also connect into the main Airship Area.
27383.name: {RNorth{x-{mWest {CH{cangar {RR{road{x

description: Many grasshoppers lazily sun themselves on the rutted dirt surface
of the Elven Valley Roadway, jumping out of the way only at the last
minute to avoid being crushed.  The tall wheat of the Istar plains
grows all around, whispering quietly in the breeze.
28099.name: {BThe {GE{glven {GV{galley {7R{&o{*adw{&a{7y{x

description: The lobby opens up inside the building.  You stand in the center of
the building, and a large desk with a pretty lady behind it greets
you.  To the east and west you see uniformed officers checking bags
and crates, a large sign over them reads "Customs".  To the southeast
you see a small diner type area, and to the west a regular waiting
lounge.  To the north east and north west you can see ticket booths,
for the selling of tickets for citizens to travel between cities.
Directly north are doors leading out to the main complex, a restricted
area for an ordanary citizen.
[North] To the Port Yard
[West] To Airship Construction & The Lounge
[East] To The Cafeteria
[South] Building Exit
[West] To Second Floor & Port Cargo Warehouse
27151.name: Welcome To Port Torregiano

description: {x
{&||=====||{x   A large ladder stretches up the side of the massive iron
{&||     ||{x tower.  The tower stretches up to the top of the tower, a
{&||=====||{x possible fifteen stories above the bridge.  Far below under
{&||     ||{x the bridge is the Sea Port of Torregiano, and the waters of
{&||=====||{x the Sea of Istar.  Airships and boats dock at the five
{&||     ||{x massive piers in the sea port.  An unsure footing on this
{&||=====||{x ladder might cause a nasty spill.
28570.name: {RH{rarbor {RB{rridge {ME{mast {CA{cccess {CL{cadder{x

description: The stairs come to a complete end at the top, and turns to the west
into the main port building.  A large hallway extends across the
building, with three doors on the north and south side.  The hallway
is wide, with all kinds of pictures and plaques on the walls.
27720.name: East Stairs To Second Floor

description: {x
{x                                                             {yII
{x  The street turns here heading either north or west along   {yII  {G+---------+
{xthe southwest corner of Torregiano.  To the north runs       {yII  {G| {RNorth   {G|
{xLegion Boulevard, made up of rich row housing and apartment  {yII{&={*<{G+---------+
{xbuildings.  Past the intersection of Legion and Hilp is      {yII  {G| {CLe{7gi{Bon  {G|
{xMakou Boulevard, made up also of row housing and apartment   {yII  {G|{GB{goulevard{G|
{xbuildings for the middle class citizens of the city.  To     {yII  {G+---------+
{xwest run Camelot Avenue, filled with the homes of the rich   {yII
{xcitizens of the city.  Past the intersection with Main       {yII  {G+---------+
{xStreet is Zozo Avenue, filled with more homes of the middle  {yII  {G|  {mWest   {G|
{xclass people.  Southeast of the corner is one of the eight   {yII{&={*<{G+---------+
{xMakou Reactors of the city.  Above is the outter ring of     {yII  {G| {RCa{Ymel{Rot {G|
{xthe Makou Cannon dubbed Stalin's Organ.                      {yII  {G| {GA{gvenue  {G|
{x                                                             {yII
28208.name: {7I{&ntersection of {G[{RCa{Ymel{Rot{G]{& & {G[{CLe{7gi{Bon{G]{x

description: This corridor is very shabby, but shows signs that it might not have been
that way forever.  Though greatly worn, the carpet shows traces that it was
once intricately died in rich colors.  Underneath the grime on the walls is
fine, although faded, wallpaper.  The only new things in this lobby are the
newly introduced Makou Gas lamps, and those show a flicker which is enough
to cause concern about a leak somewhere in the pipeline.  Guest rooms of
varying quality lay in every direction except up.
27301.name: A small room above the lobby

description: A massive meeting hall opens up here on this side of the port
building.  A large stage stands to the north for people to speak on.
A large table is setup on the stage with a podium in the center, and
two long tables on either side.  The entire room is filled with small
metal folding out chairs.  The exit is to the west.
28227.name: {CP{cort {RT{rorregiano {CM{ceeting {CH{call{x

description: You stand in the smelly locker room of the factory.  Row after row of
locker stands, with benches inbetween them.  Some workers are in here,
getting dressed, some undressed.  That is about it.
27258.name: Brewery Workers Locker Room

description: [Lession 2: The Systems]
{x
Your airship is made up of several systems.
HULLS * ENGINES * WEAPONS * FUEL * REPAIR
{x
HULLS:  The hull of your airship is basically how much hitpoints
your airship has.  Hitpoints are what determines the working
condition of your ship, when it becomes 0, your airship is
disabled.
{x
ENGINES:  Engines determine the speed of your airship, and come
in several sizes.  The more engines you have, the faster your
airship will go.  The bigger the engine, the faster your airship
will go.  Engines can be purchased in the Engine Construction Shop.
{x
WEAPONS:  Weapons are your defence against another airship.  There
are no "NPK" airships that are immune to attack, all airships are
open to attack.  The bigger the weapon, the more damage you will
do.  Weapons require ammo.  Weapons can be purchased in the Weapon
Construction Shop.  Ammo can be purchased at Ammo Shops.
{x
FUEL:  Needed to move your airship.  Fuel is purchased at fueling
stations like a shop.  If you do not have fuel, your airship will
not run.  Fuel usage is determined by 1 gallon per engine every
airship tick, which is 4 to 6 minutes.
{x
REPAIRS:  At times after battle when your airship is disabled or
damaged, you may need to repair the airship.  Your airship will
be towed and repaired back to full hitpoints.
28188.name: The Airship Ownership School

27557.name: The Small Barrel of Stalin's Organ

description: Torregiano Square, the centerpoint of the lower sectors of
Torregiano.  The square stands outside the southern gates, and has a
large clock in the center.  To the west you see Zozo Avenue, aka
Sector 1.  Down that street you see middle class homes, and a nice
neighborhood.  To the east you see Camelot Ave aka Sector 2.  The
street stretches into another middle class neighborhood.  To the
north, Main Street stretchs all the way to the northern end of
Torregiano.  The TriPower Tower Complex rises above the city skyline.
Dwarfing the city is the Cannon Support Track, three massive rings
held up by iron towers, that hold the 5000mm cannon known as Stalin's
Organ.

{x  A massive door opens up to the north leading out to the airship
parking field.  The room is open with a high ceiling, big enough
for a couple of airships to be parked inside.  Either side of the
room the walls are built as iron shelves, holding large wooden
crates.  Several workers slide around on ladders connected to the
shelves, latching hooks onto the crate from chains in the ceiling.
A large desk sits in the back of the room jam packed with papers.
Painted on the front of the desk reads COURIER CARGO MANAGER.

Massive glass windows overlook the port outside, as the airships of
the Great Realms move back and forth on the tarmack, doing their daily
jobs.  Port Torregiano is one of the largest airships ports in the
Great Realms, since the Tripower and Torregiano was the home of the
original airships.  Passangers and workers walk up and down this giant
lobby which runs along the outside of the port tarmack.  Signs hang
down from the ceiling pointing out locations.
28171.name: The Port Torregiano Lobby [South]

description: Before you stands a long hallway going down, doors on each side.  The
hallway is filled with diffrent people, walking in either direction.  People
walk in and out of each door.  The door to the east reads "COLLISEUM BAR"
and the door to the west reads "DRUID'S GUILD".

description: You stand in a reception room.  The door to the north has a strong
smell of flesh coming out of it that anyone could smell.  To the east
a hallway went east, past a bunch of doors.  You see the Inn Desk in
the northeast corner of the room, and the Innkeeper Assistant waiting
behind the counter.
27077.name: Port Judge Bar, Grill & Inn

description: You stand within the clock tower of Torregiano.  All around you
gears and things ticking run the clock just outside.  A large bell
hangs in the center of all of this, with a large ringer next to it,
cocked.  The bell rings out the hour all day and all night long.
